English: Now the LORD called to Moses, and spoke to him from the tabernacle of meeting, saying
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, Kră Yang krao Môis khan

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When any one of you brings an offering to the LORD, you shall bring your offering of the livestock—of the herd and of the flock.
Bahnar: Pơma roi bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael thoi âu: Layơ bu lăm lu iĕm đei năm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang athei rôp iŏk rơmo, triu dah bơbe đơ̆ng lăm khŭl sem dơrong na pơyơ̆r.

English: ‘If his offering is a burnt sacrifice of the herd, let him offer a male without blemish; he shall offer it of his own free will at the door of the tabernacle of meeting before the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơmam sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh hăm rơmo, sư athei pơyơ̆r rơmo tơno ưh kơ đei tơdrong jĭ kiơ, ăn kơ sư pơyơ̆r tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang wă kơ Sư lăp đon iŏk.

English: Then he shall put his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it will be accepted on his behalf to make atonement for him.
Bahnar: Na bơngai pơyơ̆r sư dan ti sư tơ kơpal kơ̆l sem dơrong wă soi 'buh noh na kon sem noh gô jing tơmam soi pơklaih tơdrong yoch sư.

English: He shall kill the bull before the LORD; and the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall bring the blood and sprinkle the blood all around on the altar that is by the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Sư gô 'bet pơlôch rơmo dăm noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, na lu 'bok soi kon drŏ-nglo Arôn iŏk pham rơmo pơyơ̆r păng tơtreh tăp dăr kơ chơnang soi 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And he shall skin the burnt offering and cut it into its pieces.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lŏng akar rơmo păng kăt lơ kơnăt.

English: The sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire on the altar, and lay the wood in order on the fire.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn gô iŏk 'long ŭnh tơkuh tơ kơpal chơnang soi.

English: Then the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall lay the parts, the head, and the fat in order on the wood that is on the fire upon the altar
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh lu 'bok soi kon drŏ-nglo Arôn săp lu kơnăt 'nhĕm, kơ̆l păng rơmă dan kơpal 'long ŭnh, mă ŭnh oei khơ̆ng kơpal chơnang soi.

English: but he shall wash its entrails and its legs with water. And the priest shall burn all on the altar as a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư gô iŏk đak ôp klak păng tơkong. Đơ̆ng noh lu 'bok soi gô 'buh dan đĭ tơmam soi tơ kơpal chơnang soi, noh boih tơmam soi 'buh, wă khan tơmam soi 'buh lăm ŭnh sa wă pơyơ̆r đei 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘If his offering is of the flocks—of the sheep or of the goats—as a burnt sacrifice, he shall bring a male without blemish.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơmam sư wă pơyơ̆r soi 'buh hăm triu dah bơbe sư athei rơih chă tơno mă ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ

English: He shall kill it on the north side of the altar before the LORD; and the priests, Aaron’s sons, shall sprinkle its blood all around on the altar.
Bahnar: ket pơlôch hloi tơ gah yă-nơ̆m kơ chơnang soi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Đơ̆ng noh lu 'bok soi kon drŏ-nglo Arôn gô iŏk pham tơtreh tăp dăr kơ chơnang soi.

English: And he shall cut it into its pieces, with its head and its fat; and the priest shall lay them in order on the wood that is on the fire upon the altar
Bahnar: Kăt lơ kơnăt 'nhĕm, kơnăt 'nhĕm kơ̆l păng rơmă 'măn lê̆ pha, lu 'bok soi gô dan 'nhĕm noh tơ kơpal 'long ŭnh mă ŭnh sa oei khơ̆ng tơ chơnang soi

English: but he shall wash the entrails and the legs with water. Then the priest shall bring it all and burn it on the altar; it is a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư gô iŏk đak ôp klak păng tơkong. Đơ̆ng noh lu 'bok soi gô pơyơ̆r đĭ tơmam soi 'buh dan tơ kơpal chơnang soi noh pơm tơmam soi 'buh wă khan tơmam soi 'buh lăm ŭnh wă pơyơ̆r đei 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘And if the burnt sacrifice of his offering to the LORD is of birds, then he shall bring his offering of turtledoves or young pigeons.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơmam sư pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang tơmam soi 'buh hăm sem păr, athei iŏk pơyơ̆r sem pơgâm bri dah kon sem kơtơp.

English: The priest shall bring it to the altar, wring off its head, and burn it on the altar; its blood shall be drained out at the side of the altar.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô chĕp ba sem noh tơ chơnang soi, wĕch kơ̆l sư, na phang tơ kơpal chơnang soi; pham sư tơdjoh cheng chơnang soi.

English: And he shall remove its crop with its feathers and cast it beside the altar on the east side, into the place for ashes.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô pleh lê̆ ben păng buch sŏk hăm klơ̆m lê̆ tơ cheng kơ chơnang soi tơ gah hơlĕch anih mă đe tuh lê̆ tơnuh ŭnh.

English: Then he shall split it at its wings, but shall not divide it completely; and the priest shall burn it on the altar, on the wood that is on the fire. It is a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư gô hek 'bar pah pơnăr, mă-lei lê̆ sư oei tơklep ưh kơ tơpleh. Đơ̆ng noh 'bok soi 'buh dan tơ kơpal chơnang soi, ŭnh sa oei khơ̆ng, noh tơmam soi 'buh, wă khan tơmam soi 'buh lăm ŭnh, wă pơyơ̆r đei 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘When anyone offers a grain offering to the LORD, his offering shall be of fine flour. And he shall pour oil on it, and put frankincense on it.
Bahnar: Layơ bu wă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang tơmam soi phe 'ba, bơngai noh athei iŏk tơpŭng hĕch lŭk hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ păng dan tơmam 'bâu phu tơ kơpal.

English: He shall bring it to Aaron’s sons, the priests, one of whom shall take from it his handful of fine flour and oil with all the frankincense. And the priest shall burn it as a memorial on the altar, an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư gô ba ăn kơ lu 'bok soi kon drŏ-nglo Arôn; lu 'bok soi gô chup iŏk minh kơđôp tơpŭng mă hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ noh păng hơdai hăm đĭ-đăng tơmam 'bâu phu sư; păng wă soh đĭ tơmam soi noh tơ kơpal chơnang soi, pơm 'blŏk hơdơ̆r minh tơdrong soi pơyơ̆r 'buh soh hăm ŭnh wă kơ 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: The rest of the grain offering shall be Aaron’s and his sons’. It is most holy of the offerings to the LORD made by fire.
Bahnar: Dôm tơmam kiơ oei đei, đơ̆ng tơmam pơyơ̆r tơpŭng lê̆ đĭ kơ lu 'bok soi kon drŏ-nglo Arôn. Noh jơ̆ tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh lăm lu tơmam pơyơ̆r soh hăm ŭnh sa mă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘And if you bring as an offering a grain offering baked in the oven, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mixed with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.
Bahnar: Layơ ih ba tơmam pơyơ̆r tơpŭng pơtŏ boih tơ lăm tơnuh ŭnh athei iŏk tơpŭng hĕch man pơm 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông hrâu đak rơmă ôliwơ dah 'bĕng klang ưh kơ đei 'buih pông pik đak rơmă ôliwơ mơ̆n.

English: But if your offering is a grain offering baked in a pan, it shall be of fine flour, unleavened, mixed with oil.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơmam pơyơ̆r hăm tơpŭng hĕch hơdrĕng tơ lăm gŏ gang ih athei man hăm tơpŭng ưh kơ đei hrâu 'buih pông hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ.

English: You shall break it in pieces and pour oil on it; it is a grain offering.
Bahnar: Phĕ sư iĕ iĕ păng tuh đak rơmă tơ kơpal, noh jơ̆ tơmam soi phe 'ba.

English: ‘If your offering is a grain offering baked in a covered pan, it shall be made of fine flour with oil.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơmam soi ih pơyơ̆r hăm tơpŭng hơdrĕng tơ lăm gŏ gang tih ih athei pơm hăm tơpŭng hĕch hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ.

English: You shall bring the grain offering that is made of these things to the LORD. And when it is presented to the priest, he shall bring it to the altar.
Bahnar: Tơmam soi tơpŭng phe 'ba hơmet lê̆ bơih, ih năm ba pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, jao tơmam soi noh ăn kơ 'bok soi, sư gô chĕp ba dan tơ kơpal chơnang soi.

English: Then the priest shall take from the grain offering a memorial portion, and burn it on the altar. It is an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi sư gô iŏk tơmam soi wă pơyơ̆r noh pơm tơmam soi 'blŏk hơdơ̆r, soh tơ chơnang soi noh pơm tơmam soi soh hăm ŭnh sa đei 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: And what is left of the grain offering shall be Aaron’s and his sons’. It is most holy of the offerings to the LORD made by fire.
Bahnar: Dôm tơmam soi phe 'ba mă oei đei gô lê̆ đĭ kơ Arôn păng kon drŏ-nglo sư; noh jơ̆ tơmam soi 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh lăm lu tơmam soi soh hăm ŭnh sa pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘No grain offering which you bring to the LORD shall be made with leaven, for you shall burn no leaven nor any honey in any offering to the LORD made by fire.
Bahnar: Dôm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r hăm tơpŭng phe 'ba mă lu iĕm pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang 'nĕ kơ hrâu hăm 'buih pông; yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ soh 'buih pông hăm đak sut ôh lăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r soh hăm ŭnh sa wă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: As for the offering of the firstfruits, you shall offer them to the LORD, but they shall not be burned on the altar for a sweet aroma.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gơh pơyơ̆r tơmam soi noh ăn kơ Kră Yang thoi tơmam soi pơyơ̆r plei blŭng-a. Mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ kơ 'buh tơ ŭnh tơ kơpal chơnang soi thoi tơmam soi đei 'bâu phu.

English: And every offering of your grain offering you shall season with salt; you shall not allow the salt of the covenant of your God to be lacking from your grain offering. With all your offerings you shall offer salt.
Bahnar: Ih athei tah 'boh lăm dôm tơmam pơyơ̆r tơpŭng; 'nĕ ăn tơmam tơpŭng pơyơ̆r mă ưh kơ đei 'boh ôh. Yua kơ 'boh wă tơ'bôh kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih lăm dôm lu tơmam ih pơyơ̆r athei đei 'boh.

English: ‘If you offer a grain offering of your firstfruits to the LORD, you shall offer for the grain offering of your firstfruits green heads of grain roasted on the fire, grain beaten from full heads.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi hăm tơpŭng plei 'long, phe 'ba blŭng-a lăm bơyan ăn kơ Kră Yang athei iŏk hơie 'ba oei adrih peh pơhĕch păng hơdrĕng lê̆ sư.

English: And you shall put oil on it, and lay frankincense on it. It is a grain offering.
Bahnar: Ih athei tuh đak rơmă ôliwơ păng tơmam 'bâu phu tơ kơpal sư, noh bơih tơmam soi tơpŭng phe 'ba ưh kơ đei pham.

English: Then the priest shall burn the memorial portion: part of its beaten grain and part of its oil, with all the frankincense, as an offering made by fire to the LORD.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh 'bok soi iŏk minh puăt lăm lu tơpŭng mă đei hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ păng tơmam 'bâu phu na soh. Wă pơm 'blŏk hơdơ̆r, noh jơ̆ tơmam soi phe 'ba hle soh lăm ŭnh pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘When his offering is a sacrifice of a peace offering, if he offers it of the herd, whether male or female, he shall offer it without blemish before the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơdah bu wă pơyơ̆r tơmam 'blŏk bơnê kơ Kră Yang hăm rơmo tơno dah akăn, athei rơih rơmo 'lơ̆ng huay kơ đei jĭ kiơ.

English: And he shall lay his hand on the head of his offering, and kill it at the door of the tabernacle of meeting; and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall sprinkle the blood all around on the altar.
Bahnar: Sư gô dan ti sư tơ kơpal kơ̆l kon rơmo mă sư pơyơ̆r noh na 'bet pơlôch hloi, 'bơ̆t 'măng tơm mơ̆t tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm. Lu 'bok soi kon drŏ-nglo Arôn gô tơtraih pham noh tăp dăr kơ chơnang soi.

English: Then he shall offer from the sacrifice of the peace offering an offering made by fire to the LORD. The fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is on the entrails
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơmam pơyơ̆r 'blŏk bơnê 'nâu sư gô pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi yua hăm ŭnh na pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang lu rơmă, mă dôm klak păng lu rơmă dơwir klep tơ klak sư

English: the two kidneys and the fat that is on them by the flanks, and the fatty lobe attached to the liver above the kidneys, he shall remove
Bahnar: 'bar tŏ boh-lăn rơmă lom 'bar tŏ boh-lăn cheng rơhiĕo sư păng mơ'nhao hơtăng lom klơm, pleh lê̆ đơ̆ng 'bar tŏ boh-lăn.

English: and Aaron’s sons shall burn it on the altar upon the burnt sacrifice, which is on the wood that is on the fire, as an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn gô 'buh pơyơ̆r dôm tơmam noh tơ kơpal chơnang soi tơ kơpal tơmam soi 'buh mă đei dan kơpal 'long ŭnh, ŭnh oei sa, noh jơ̆ tơmam soi ăn ŭnh sa 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘If his offering as a sacrifice of a peace offering to the LORD is of the flock, whether male or female, he shall offer it without blemish.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơmam sư pơyơ̆r wă 'blŏk bơnê kơ Kră Yang hăm triu tơno dah akăn athei rơih triu 'lơ̆ng huay kơ đei jĭ kiơ ôh.

English: If he offers a lamb as his offering, then he shall offer it before the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơdah sư pơyơ̆r hăm kon triu pơm tơmam soi, sư athei pơyơ̆r 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: And he shall lay his hand on the head of his offering, and kill it before the tabernacle of meeting; and Aaron’s sons shall sprinkle its blood all around on the altar.
Bahnar: Dan ti sư tơ kơpal kơ̆l kon triu đơ̆ng noh 'bet pơlôch hloi 'bơ̆t anăp 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm. Lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn gô tơtraih pham jum dăr kơ chơnang soi.

English: ‘Then he shall offer from the sacrifice of the peace offering, as an offering made by fire to the LORD, its fat and the whole fat tail which he shall remove close to the backbone. And the fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is on the entrails
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'blŏk bơnê noh, sư athei soi 'buh pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang: Rơmă, kiĕng chơ̆ng iŏk 'bơ̆t kơting chơđui, đĭ-đăng lu rơmă lom klak.

English: the two kidneys and the fat that is on them by the flanks, and the fatty lobe attached to the liver above the kidneys, he shall remove
Bahnar: 'Bar tŏ boh-lăn hăm rơmă lom sư 'bơ̆t kơiĕng păng mơ'nhao lom klơm (bơngai noh athei lŏng rơmă gom hơdai hăm boh-lăn).

English: and the priest shall burn them on the altar as food, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi gô soh pơyơ̆r đĭ tơmam âu tơ chơnang soi, noh tơmam sa pơyơ̆r soh hăm ŭnh ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘And if his offering is a goat, then he shall offer it before the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơmam sư pơyơ̆r păng bơbe sư athei pơyơ̆r 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: He shall lay his hand on its head and kill it before the tabernacle of meeting; and the sons of Aaron shall sprinkle its blood all around on the altar.
Bahnar: Dan ti sư tơ kơpal kơ̆l kon bơbe noh. Na sư pơlôch hloi 'bơ̆t anăp Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm. Lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn gô tơtraih pham jum dăr kơ chơnang soi.

English: Then he shall offer from it his offering, as an offering made by fire to the LORD. The fat that covers the entrails and all the fat that is on the entrails
Bahnar: Sư gô pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi 'buh ŭnh sa ăn kơ Kră Yang, lu rơmă lom klak hăm đĭ-đăng rơmă klep tơ klak sư.

English: the two kidneys and the fat that is on them by the flanks, and the fatty lobe attached to the liver above the kidneys, he shall remove
Bahnar: 'Bar tŏ boh-lăn, hăm rơmă lom tơ boh-lăn 'bơ̆t kơiĕng păng mơ'nhao hơtăng lom klơm lu sư gô iŏk ba hơdai hăm 'bar tŏ boh-lăn.

English: and the priest shall burn them on the altar as food, an offering made by fire for a sweet aroma; all the fat is the LORD’s.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô soh pơyơ̆r dôm tơmam noh tơ kơpal chơnang soi pơm tơmam sa pơyơ̆r soh hăm ŭnh, đei 'bâu phu đĭ-đăng rơmă noh jing tơmam 'Bok Kei-Dei ngăl.

English: ‘This shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings: you shall eat neither fat nor blood.’ ”
Bahnar: 'Nâu bơih jing tơdrong juăt ăn kơ lu adrĕch adrung iĕm ling-lang lăm đĭ-đăng jơhnơr lu iĕm oei arih tơ lăm đĭ-đăng anih tơ yơ lu iĕm oei, lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa rơmă dah pham.

English: Now the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘If a person sins unintentionally against any of the commandments of the LORD in anything which ought not to be done, and does any of them
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael: Tơdah bu mă hơch 'bơm kơ pơm yoch glăi minh tơdrong lăm nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă ưh kơ ăn pơm.

English: if the anointed priest sins, bringing guilt on the people, then let him offer to the LORD for his sin which he has sinned a young bull without blemish as a sin offering.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'bok soi mă đei tuh đak rơmă boih na pơm yoch, noh pơm ăn kơ kon pơlei yoch kiơ̆, 'bok soi noh sư athei pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang minh pôm rơmo dăm ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ, yua kơ yoch sư pơm noh.

English: He shall bring the bull to the door of the tabernacle of meeting before the LORD, lay his hand on the bull’s head, and kill the bull before the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư athei dui ba rơmo dăm; noh 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm tơ anăp Kră Yang dan ti sư tơ kơ̆l rơmo dăm đơ̆ng noh 'bet pơlôch hloi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Then the anointed priest shall take some of the bull’s blood and bring it to the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi mă chu tuh đak rơmă bơih gô iŏk pham rơmo noh chĕp ba mơ̆t lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: The priest shall dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle some of the blood seven times before the LORD, in front of the veil of the sanctuary.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi tôt hơnglâu ti sư lăm pham tơdjoh tơpơh wơ̆t 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'bơ̆t jê̆ che pĕng găn anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: And the priest shall put some of the blood on the horns of the altar of sweet incense before the LORD, which is in the tabernacle of meeting; and he shall pour the remaining blood of the bull at the base of the altar of the burnt offering, which is at the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô pik pham tơ kơpal lu ake chơnang soi tơmam 'bâu phu lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng tuh đĭ pham rơmo tơ jơ̆ng chơnang soi tơmam soi 'buh, dan tơ anăp 'măng mơ̆t tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: He shall take from it all the fat of the bull as the sin offering. The fat that covers the entrails and all the fat which is on the entrails
Bahnar: Sư gô pleh lê̆ đĭ rơmă rơmo dăm mă pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi huai iŏk yoch, lu rơmă mơ'nhao păng rơmă lom klak.

English: the two kidneys and the fat that is on them by the flanks, and the fatty lobe attached to the liver above the kidneys, he shall remove
Bahnar: 'Bar tŏ boh-lăn păng rơmă klep tơ 'bar tŏ boh-lăn jê̆ kơiĕng mơ'nhao hơtăng lom klơm, sư iŏk rơmă noh hăm boh-lăn.

English: as it was taken from the bull of the sacrifice of the peace offering; and the priest shall burn them on the altar of the burnt offering.
Bahnar: Thoi pleh iŏk đĭ rơmă đơ̆ng lăm rơmo dăm pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'blŏk bơnê, đơ̆ng noh 'bok soi gô 'buh tơmam noh tơ chơnang soi pơm tơmam soi 'buh hăm ŭnh.

English: But the bull’s hide and all its flesh, with its head and legs, its entrails and offal
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu akar rơmo dăm đĭ-đăng sĕch sư, kơ̆l, tơkong păng ĭch sư.

English: the whole bull he shall carry outside the camp to a clean place, where the ashes are poured out, and burn it on wood with fire; where the ashes are poured out it shall be burned.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng akâu rơmo noh sư athei chĕp ba lĕch tơ 'nguaih kơ anih kơđông, năm tơ minh anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, anih mă lu sư tuh tơnuh, đơ̆ng noh dan hơtŏk tơ kơpal 'long ŭnh păng 'buh hăm ŭnh, đe gô 'buh đĭ-đăng 'bơ̆t anih đe tuh tơnuh noh.

English: ‘Now if the whole congregation of Israel sins unintentionally, and the thing is hidden from the eyes of the assembly, and they have done something against any of the commandments of the LORD in anything which should not be done, and are guilty
Bahnar: Tơdah đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael yua kơ hơch 'bơm pơm yoch boih, mă-lei lu bơngai tơpôl akŭm tam mă băt păng lu sư pơm yoch minh tơdrong lăm lu nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă khă ưh kơ ăn pơm, yua kơ tơdrong noh sư jing yoch boih.

English: when the sin which they have committed becomes known, then the assembly shall offer a young bull for the sin, and bring it before the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơdrong yoch lu sư noh pơdah 'bôh tơ 'nguaih, đĭ-đăng lu bơngai tơpôl athei pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo dăm iĕ wă pơm tơmam soi huai iŏk yoch sư, dui ba kon rơmo noh 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And the elders of the congregation shall lay their hands on the head of the bull before the LORD. Then the bull shall be killed before the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu kră bơngai Isơrael athei dan ti lu sư 'bơ̆t kơ̆l rơmo dăm đơ̆ng noh pơlôch hloi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: The anointed priest shall bring some of the bull’s blood to the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi mă đe tuh đak rơmă bơih, gô chĕp ba pham kon rơmo dăm, mơ̆t tơ lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: Then the priest shall dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle it seven times before the LORD, in front of the veil.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô tôt hơnglâu ti sư tơ lăm pham tơdjoh tơpơh wơ̆t 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, tơ anăp che pĕng.

English: And he shall put some of the blood on the horns of the altar which is before the LORD, which is in the tabernacle of meeting; and he shall pour the remaining blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư gô pik pham tơ lu ake chơnang soi lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, đơ̆ng noh lu pham oei đei tuh đĭ tơ jơ̆ng chơnang soi tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'buh dan tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: He shall take all the fat from it and burn it on the altar.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pleh lê̆ đĭ lu rơmă 'măn 'buh tơ chơnang soi.

English: And he shall do with the bull as he did with the bull as a sin offering; thus he shall do with it. So the priest shall make atonement for them, and it shall be forgiven them.
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong sư pơyơ̆r rơmo dăm, kư̆m thoi sư pơyơ̆r rơmo pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, sư gô pơm thoi noh mơ̆n kơ tơmam âu. 'Bok soi gô pơm tơdrong sut rơgoh tơdrong yoch lu sư na lu sư gô đei tơdrong mơnat ăn

English: Then he shall carry the bull outside the camp, and burn it as he burned the first bull. It is a sin offering for the assembly.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng noh lu sư anhăk ba rơmo dăm noh lĕch tơ 'nguaih kơđông, na 'buh pơyơ̆r thoi sư 'buh pơyơ̆r rơmo dăm adrol ki mơ̆n, noh Jơ̆ tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch kơ lu khŭl akŭm.

English: ‘When a ruler has sinned, and done something unintentionally against any of the commandments of the LORD his God in anything which should not be done, and is guilty
Bahnar: Tơdah đei yŏng pơgơ̆r ayơ mă yua kơ hơch 'bơm pơm yoch minh tơdrong lăm nơ̆r tơtă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư khă ưh kơ ăn pơm, mă đei pơm yoch boih.

English: or if his sin which he has committed comes to his knowledge, he shall bring as his offering a kid of the goats, a male without blemish.
Bahnar: Layơ tơdrong yoch sư pơm đe tơ'bôh ăn kơ sư boih, sư athei chĕp ba tơmam soi sư minh pôm bơbe tơno ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ.

English: And he shall lay his hand on the head of the goat, and kill it at the place where they kill the burnt offering before the LORD. It is a sin offering.
Bahnar: Na dan ti sư tơ kơ̆l bơbe tơno noh, đơ̆ng noh pơlôch hloi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, pơm tơmam soi 'buh wă huai tơdrong yoch.

English: The priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and pour its blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô iŏk pham sem dơrong pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch na tôt hơnglâu ti sư na pik tơ ake chơnang soi gah tơmam soi 'buh păng tuh pham mă oei đei tơ jơ̆ng chơnang soi 'buh.

English: And he shall burn all its fat on the altar, like the fat of the sacrifice of the peace offering. So the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin, and it shall be forgiven him.
Bahnar: Đĭ rơmă sư gô 'buh tơ kơpal chơnang soi, thoi rơmă tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê mơ̆n, noh na 'bok soi gô pơm tơdrong sut rơgoh yoch sư, na sư gơh đei tơdrong mơnat ăn.

English: ‘If anyone of the common people sins unintentionally by doing something against any of the commandments of the LORD in anything which ought not to be done, and is guilty
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai lăm lu kon pơlei hơch 'bơm pơm yoch, minh tơdrong lăm nơ̆r tơtă Kră Yang păng pơm tơdrong Sư khă ưh kơ ăn pơm noh na jing yoch boih.

English: or if his sin which he has committed comes to his knowledge, then he shall bring as his offering a kid of the goats, a female without blemish, for his sin which he has committed.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơdrong sư pơm yoch đe tơ'bôh boih kơ sư. Sư athei chĕp ba tơmam soi minh pôm bơbe akăn ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ wă pơm tơmam soi yua kơ tơdrong yoch sư pơm boih.

English: And he shall lay his hand on the head of the sin offering, and kill the sin offering at the place of the burnt offering.
Bahnar: Sư athei dan ti sư tơ kơ̆l sem dơrong pơm tơmam soi noh, klaih kơ noh pơlôch hloi tơ anih đe juăt kơ pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh.

English: Then the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger, put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and pour all the remaining blood at the base of the altar.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô tôt hơnglâu ti sư tơ lăm pham pik tơ lu ake chơnang soi tơmam soi 'buh păng tuh đĭ pham mă oei đei noh tơ jơ̆ng chơnang soi.

English: He shall remove all its fat, as fat is removed from the sacrifice of the peace offering; and the priest shall burn it on the altar for a sweet aroma to the LORD. So the priest shall make atonement for him, and it shall be forgiven him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư gô pleh lê̆ đĭ rơmă thoi pleh lu rơmă tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê mơ̆n. 'Bok soi chĕp ba 'buh tơ chơnang soi jing tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'bâu phu kơ Kră Yang, noh bơih 'bok soi gô pơm tơdrong sut rơgoh yoch sư, na bơngai noh Kră Yang gô mơnat ăn.

English: ‘If he brings a lamb as his sin offering, he shall bring a female without blemish.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, athei pơyơ̆r triu akăn ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ.

English: Then he shall lay his hand on the head of the sin offering, and kill it as a sin offering at the place where they kill the burnt offering.
Bahnar: Dan ti sư tơ kơpal kơ̆l sem dơrong pơm tơmam soi huai yoch noh, na pơlôch hloi, sư jing tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch 'bơ̆t anih đe juăt kơ pơlôch sem dơrong pơm tơmam soi 'buh

English: The priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and pour all the remaining blood at the base of the altar.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh 'bok soi gô iŏk pham tơmam soi yua kơ tơdrong yoch, tôt hơnglâu ti sư lăm pham, pik tơ ake chơnang soi 'buh, pham mă oei đei noh tuh đĭ tơ jơ̆ng chơnang soi.

English: He shall remove all its fat, as the fat of the lamb is removed from the sacrifice of the peace offering. Then the priest shall burn it on the altar, according to the offerings made by fire to the LORD. So the priest shall make atonement for his sin that he has committed, and it shall be forgiven him.
Bahnar: Sư pleh đĭ rơmă thoi đei pleh rơmă triu kon pơm tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê, 'bok soi gô chĕp ba 'buh tơ chơnang soi tơ kơpal tơmam soi 'buh hăm ŭnh pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, thoi noh bơih 'bok soi gô pơm tơdrong sut rơgoh yoch bơngai mă pơm yoch na tơdrong yoch sư gơh mơnat ăn.

English: ‘If a person sins in hearing the utterance of an oath, and is a witness, whether he has seen or known of the matter—if he does not tell it, he bears guilt.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu pơm kơdranh mă đei pơkăm pơkă bơih. Păng pơm glăi yua kơ ưh pơdah kơ đe tơdrong sư đêl 'bôh, dah đêl băt lei bơngai noh pŭ yoch sư kơdih bơih.

English: ‘Or if a person touches any unclean thing, whether it is the carcass of an unclean beast, or the carcass of unclean livestock, or the carcass of unclean creeping things, and he is unaware of it, he also shall be unclean and guilty.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu ưh kơ băt ôh hơtŭt 'bơm minh pôm tơmam 'mê̆-'mach đêl akâu sem bri lôch ưh kơ rơgoh dah akâu sem dơrong ưh kơ rơgoh, dah akâu 'bih kơep lep-ler ưh kơ rơgoh, mă khan kơdih sư ưh kơ băt ră, lei bơngai noh ưh kơ rơgoh mơ̆n păng kư̆m yoch bơih.

English: Or if he touches human uncleanness—whatever uncleanness with which a man may be defiled, and he is unaware of it—when he realizes it, then he shall be guilty.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu băt ră dah ưh kơ băt na hơtŭt 'bơm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach kon bơngai, mă dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach ayơ pơm kơ sư 'mê̆-'mach boih, tơdah đe tơbăt kơ sư bơngai noh kư̆m yoch.

English: ‘Or if a person swears, speaking thoughtlessly with his lips to do evil or to do good, whatever it is that a man may pronounce by an oath, and he is unaware of it—when he realizes it, then he shall be guilty in any of these matters.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu pơkă 'bơm glăi wă pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ dah tơdrong 'lơ̆ng mă tơdrong kiơ hăt kơ pơkă pơkăm na sư ưh kơ băt, na đơ̆ng rŏng sư băt mơn kơdih, lei bơngai noh gô đei tơdrong yoch lăm tơdrong âu dah tơdrong to.

English: ‘And it shall be, when he is guilty in any of these matters, that he shall confess that he has sinned in that thing
Bahnar: Kơplah bu mă đei pơm yoch minh lăm tơdrong âu, sư athei roi tơdrong yoch sư mă pơm boih.

English: and he shall bring his trespass offering to the LORD for his sin which he has committed, a female from the flock, a lamb or a kid of the goats as a sin offering. So the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư athei chĕp ba tơmam soi pơyơ̆r yua kơ pơm yoch, hăm tơdrong juăt Kră Yang minh pôm kon triu dah bơbe akăn pơm tơmam soi huai iŏk yua kơ yoch, na 'bok soi gô soi sơmah kơ sư wă kơ sư rơgoh đơ̆ng yoch.

English: ‘If he is not able to bring a lamb, then he shall bring to the LORD, for his trespass which he has committed, two turtledoves or two young pigeons: one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering.
Bahnar: Tơdah sư chă ưh kơ kĕ đei minh pôm kon triu akăn dah bơbe akăn, yua kơ yoch sư đei pơm bơih, na sư athei anhăk ba kơ Kră Yang minh hơgrop sem pơgâm dah kơtơp kon, minh pôm wă yua lăm tơmam sư huai đơ̆ng yoch, minh pôm wă yua lăm tơmam soi 'buh.

English: And he shall bring them to the priest, who shall offer that which is for the sin offering first, and wring off its head from its neck, but shall not divide it completely.
Bahnar: Sư gô chĕp ba minh hơgrop sem noh ăn kơ 'bok soi. 'Bok soi gô pơyơ̆r minh pôm adrol pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch wĕch kơ̆l sem noh 'bơ̆t hơko mă-lei ưh kơ ăn kơtĕch.

English: Then he shall sprinkle some of the blood of the sin offering on the side of the altar, and the rest of the blood shall be drained out at the base of the altar. It is a sin offering.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư tơtraih pham tơmam soi yua kơ yoch tơ cheng kơ chơnang soi, pham mă oei rơkah hling tơ ala jơ̆ng chơnang soi, noh bơih tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch.

English: And he shall offer the second as a burnt offering according to the prescribed manner. So the priest shall make atonement on his behalf for his sin which he has committed, and it shall be forgiven him.
Bahnar: Sư gô pơyơ̆r mă 'bar, noh jing tơmam soi 'buh kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt 'bok soi gô sơmah wă kơ rơgoh, đơ̆ng yoch bơngai noh mă pơm boih, na tơdrong yoch bơngai noh gơh mơnat ăn.

English: ‘But if he is not able to bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons, then he who sinned shall bring for his offering one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour as a sin offering. He shall put no oil on it, nor shall he put frankincense on it, for it is a sin offering.
Bahnar: Tơdah sư ưh kơ kĕ đei wă pơyơ̆r minh hơgrop sem pơgâm dah sem kơtơp kon ôh. Na yua kơ tơdrong yoch sư đei pơm sư athei pơyơ̆r minh lăm mơjĭt êphaa tơpŭng rơgoh 'lơ̆ng wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, 'nĕ kơ tuh đak rơmă ôliwơ păng đak rơmă 'bâu phu kơpal yua kơ 'nâu jơ̆ tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch.

English: Then he shall bring it to the priest, and the priest shall take his handful of it as a memorial portion, and burn it on the altar according to the offerings made by fire to the LORD. It is a sin offering.
Bahnar: Sư gô chĕp ba tơpŭng noh tơ 'bok soi, 'bok soi gô chup minh kơđôp wă kơ 'blŏk hơdơ̆r păng 'buh pơyơ̆r tơ chơnang soi tơ kơpal tơmam soi ăn ŭnh sa pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, noh jơ̆ minh tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch.

English: The priest shall make atonement for him, for his sin that he has committed in any of these matters; and it shall be forgiven him. The rest shall be the priest’s as a grain offering.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh 'bok soi gô soi sơmah wă huai đơ̆ng yoch yua kơ sư pơm yoch boih iŏk minh lăm tơmam 'nâu, bơngai noh gơh đei mơnat ăn; tơpŭng mă oei rơkah noh gô lê̆ kơ 'bok soi kư̆m thoi tơmam soi pơyơ̆r phe 'ba mơ̆n.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “If a person commits a trespass, and sins unintentionally in regard to the holy things of the LORD, then he shall bring to the LORD as his trespass offering a ram without blemish from the flocks, with your valuation in shekels of silver according to the shekel of the sanctuary, as a trespass offering.
Bahnar: Layơ bơngai bu mă hơch 'bơm kơ pơm yoch lăm minh tơmam rơgoh Kră Yang. Na bơngai noh yua kơ tơdrong yoch sư kơdih, sư athei chĕp ba tơ Kră Yang minh pôm kon triu tơno ưh kơ đei Jĭ kiơ, athei rôp đơ̆ng lăm khŭl sư, ih jô̆ tinh kon triu noh gĭt sư hơgăt kiơ̆ kơ jên hu seikơl đơ̆ng hnam akŭm rơgoh, noh jơ̆ minh tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch pơm glăi kơ khôi juăt.

English: And he shall make restitution for the harm that he has done in regard to the holy thing, and shall add one-fifth to it and give it to the priest. So the priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering, and it shall be forgiven him.
Bahnar: Bơngai noh athei hơmet ming yua kơ tơdrong noh ưh kơ rơgoh păng thim minh lăm pơđăm, na jao tơmam noh kơ 'bok soi, na 'bok soi gô iŏk pơm sut rơgoh tơdrong yoch hăm kon triu tơno jing tơmam soi sơmah ăn yua kơ tơdrong pơm yoch na sư gơh đei mơnat ăn.

English: “If a person sins, and commits any of these things which are forbidden to be done by the commandments of the LORD, though he does not know it, yet he is guilty and shall bear his iniquity.
Bahnar: Tơdah bu mă pơm glăi minh tơdrong lăm dôm lu nơ̆r tơtă Kră Yang khă kuă ăn kơ pơm, mă khan sư ưh kơ băt ôh kơ tơdrong noh, lei bơngai noh kư̆m yoch bơih păng gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong yoch sư.

English: And he shall bring to the priest a ram without blemish from the flock, with your valuation, as a trespass offering. So the priest shall make atonement for him regarding his ignorance in which he erred and did not know it, and it shall be forgiven him.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong yoch sư kơdih bơngai noh athei chĕp ba tơ 'bok soi minh pôm kon triu tơno ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ. Ih jô̆ sư gĭt thoi tơmam soi pơyơ̆r yua kơ đơ̆ng yoch glăi kơ khôi juăt, na 'bok soi gô soi sơmah ăn kơ bơngai mă glăi 'bơm pơm yoch, na tơdrong yoch bơngai noh gô mơnat ăn.

English: It is a trespass offering; he has certainly trespassed against the LORD.”
Bahnar: Noh jơ̆ tơmam soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch yua kơ sư đei pơm yoch hăm khôi juăt, sư pơm yoch boih 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “If a person sins and commits a trespass against the LORD by lying to his neighbor about what was delivered to him for safekeeping, or about a pledge, or about a robbery, or if he has extorted from his neighbor
Bahnar: Tơdah bu đei pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang, đơ̆ng sư pơma hơlĕnh hăm lu bơngai rông 'bôt sư gah tơmam sư pơjao, dah wei-lăng ăn; dah tơtông iŏk, dah pơgŏ sa đơ̆ng rông 'bôt sư kơdih.

English: or if he has found what was lost and lies concerning it, and swears falsely—in any one of these things that a man may do in which he sins
Bahnar: Dah mă đei dônh tơmam đe hiong mă-lei sơngah pơkă pơkăm hơlĕnh dơ̆ng păng pơm minh lăm lu tơdrong mă đe juăt kơ pơm, noh yoch bơih.

English: then it shall be, because he has sinned and is guilty, that he shall restore what he has stolen, or the thing which he has extorted, or what was delivered to him for safekeeping, or the lost thing which he found
Bahnar: Layơ mă đei glăi, pơm yoch boih, na sư athei pơdrâu tơmam đêl sư tơtông, dah đêl sư tơgar iŏk, dah đe jao kơ sư, dah tơmam đe hiong đêl sư dônh.

English: or all that about which he has sworn falsely. He shall restore its full value, add one-fifth more to it, and give it to whomever it belongs, on the day of his trespass offering.
Bahnar: Dah tơmam đêl sư pơkăm pơkă hơlĕnh, sư athei pơdrâu mă tôm 'blep. Đơ̆ng noh sư athei 'mong dơ̆ng minh lăm pơđăm, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong gĭt sư, ăn kơ tơ'ngla tơmam noh lăm năr mă sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch sư pơm.

English: And he shall bring his trespass offering to the LORD, a ram without blemish from the flock, with your valuation, as a trespass offering, to the priest.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ ih khan hơgăt kơ sư, bơngai noh athei rôp triu tơno ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ, na năm ba kơ 'bok soi pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng tơdrong sư pơm glăi kơ tơdrong juăt.

English: So the priest shall make atonement for him before the LORD, and he shall be forgiven for any one of these things that he may have done in which he trespasses.”
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch bơngai noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, na tơdrong yoch bơngai noh gơh mơnat ăn mă dôm tơdrong yoch kiơ sư đei pơm glăi.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Command Aaron and his sons, saying, ‘This is the law of the burnt offering: The burnt offering shall be on the hearth upon the altar all night until morning, and the fire of the altar shall be kept burning on it.
Bahnar: Tơtă bĕ kơ Arôn hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư: 'Nâu Jơ̆ tơdrong juăt gah tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam soi 'buh athei dan kơpal ŭnh tơ chơnang soi prăt măng dĭng truh tơ pơgê. Ŭnh kơpal chơnang soi athei wei khơ̆ng hơnơ̆ng.

English: And the priest shall put on his linen garment, and his linen trousers he shall put on his body, and take up the ashes of the burnt offering which the fire has consumed on the altar, and he shall put them beside the altar.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô hrŭk ao che 'bui hơdrông păng hơbĕn che 'bui sư, na chup tơnuh đêl ŭnh sa tơ kơpal chơnang soi tuh lê̆ tơ cheng jê̆ chơnang soi.

English: Then he shall take off his garments, put on other garments, and carry the ashes outside the camp to a clean place.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư plôh lê̆ hơbĕn, na iŏk hrŭk hơbĕn ao nai chĕp ba tơnuh noh tơ 'nguaih tuh tơ minh anih rơgoh.

English: And the fire on the altar shall be kept burning on it; it shall not be put out. And the priest shall burn wood on it every morning, and lay the burnt offering in order on it; and he shall burn on it the fat of the peace offerings.
Bahnar: Ŭnh kơpal chơnang soi athei khơ̆ng ling-lang, ưh kơ gơh păt ôh. Rim pơgê 'bok soi dan 'long ŭnh kơpal chơnang soi, dan tơmam soi 'buh kơpal 'long ŭnh păng 'buh rơmă tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê tơ noh.

English: A fire shall always be burning on the altar; it shall never go out.
Bahnar: Ŭnh athei khơ̆ng hơnơ̆ng tơ kơpal chơnang soi 'nĕ kơ ăn păt ôh.

English: ‘This is the law of the grain offering: The sons of Aaron shall offer it on the altar before the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nâu jơ̆ tơdrong juăt tơmam pơyơ̆r phe 'ba, lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi âu tơ anăp chơnang soi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: He shall take from it his handful of the fine flour of the grain offering, with its oil, and all the frankincense which is on the grain offering, and shall burn it on the altar for a sweet aroma, as a memorial to the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư gô chup minh kơđôp tơpŭng lăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ păng đĭ-đăng tơmam 'bâu phu chĕp ba soh pơyơ̆r tơ chơnang soi wă kơ 'blŏk hơdơ̆r gah tơmam soi đei 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: And the remainder of it Aaron and his sons shall eat; with unleavened bread it shall be eaten in a holy place; in the court of the tabernacle of meeting they shall eat it.
Bahnar: Lu tơmam mă oei oei Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư gô sa tơmam noh, ưh kơ đei 'buih pông, tơ lăm minh anih rơgoh, wă khan sa tơ cham Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: It shall not be baked with leaven. I have given it as their portion of My offerings made by fire; it is most holy, like the sin offering and the trespass offering.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ gơh pai tơpŭng noh hăm 'buih ôh, Inh ăn kơ sư minh pah tơmam pơyơ̆r yua soh hăm ŭnh, Noh jing tơmam rơgoh hloh. Thoi tơmam pơyơ̆r huai đơ̆ng yoch păng tơmam huai đơ̆ng tơdrong hơch 'bơm kơ pơm yoch.

English: All the males among the children of Aaron may eat it. It shall be a statute forever in your generations concerning the offerings made by fire to the LORD. Everyone who touches them must be holy.’ ”
Bahnar: Rim 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn gơh iŏk sa noh, jơ̆ tơdrong juăt pơtă ăn ling-lang kơ adrĕch adrung lu iĕm, đơ̆ng tơmam pơyơ̆r soh hăm ŭnh pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang; bu hơtŭt 'bơm tơmam noh gô jing rơgoh.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “This is the offering of Aaron and his sons, which they shall offer to the LORD, beginning on the day when he is anointed: one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour as a daily grain offering, half of it in the morning and half of it at night.
Bahnar: 'Nâu jơ̆ tơmam pơyơ̆r Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, gô pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang lăm năr đe tuh đak rơmă tơ lu sư minh lăm mơjĭt êpha tơpŭng, pơm tơmam pơyơ̆r hăm tơpŭng đe juăt kơ pơyơ̆r hơnơ̆ng, minh puăt pơyơ̆r til pơgê, minh puăt pơyơ̆r til kơsơ̆

English: It shall be made in a pan with oil. When it is mixed, you shall bring it in. The baked pieces of the grain offering you shall offer for a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơmam soi noh đe gô hơdrĕng hơmet lê̆ tơ gŏ gang hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ. Sĭn bơih ih athei chĕp ba kăt hơmet, na pơyơ̆r đei 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: The priest from among his sons, who is anointed in his place, shall offer it. It is a statute forever to the LORD. It shall be wholly burned.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi lăm lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn, bơngai ayơ mă đe tuh đak rơmă wă tơplih sư pơm 'bok soi kư̆m athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'nâu kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong juăt pơkă ling-lang 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang đe gô soh pơyơ̆r đĭ tơmam noh.

English: For every grain offering for the priest shall be wholly burned. It shall not be eaten.”
Bahnar: Dôm rim tơmam soi hăm phe 'ba đơ̆ng 'bok soi athei soh lê̆ đĭ ưh kơ gơh sa.

English: Also the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis.

English: “Speak to Aaron and to his sons, saying, ‘This is the law of the sin offering: In the place where the burnt offering is killed, the sin offering shall be killed before the LORD. It is most holy.
Bahnar: Roi bĕ kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư: 'Nâu boih tơdrong juăt gah tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch athei pơlôch bĕ kon sem wă soi huai đơ̆ng yoch 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Tơ anih mă đe juăt kơ pơlôch kon sem wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh noh jơ̆ tơmam rơgoh hloh.

English: The priest who offers it for sin shall eat it. In a holy place it shall be eaten, in the court of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi pơyơ̆r tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch noh gô sa tơmam noh, đe gô sa lăm minh anih tơ cham Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: Everyone who touches its flesh must be holy. And when its blood is sprinkled on any garment, you shall wash that on which it was sprinkled, in a holy place.
Bahnar: Bu mă hơtŭt 'bơm 'nhĕm soi gô jing rơgoh păng tơdah pham sư tơprah tơ ao athei pih ao ih noh tơ lăm minh anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: But the earthen vessel in which it is boiled shall be broken. And if it is boiled in a bronze pot, it shall be both scoured and rinsed in water.
Bahnar: Gŏ teh mă đêl pai boih 'nhĕm noh, athei teh pơchah lê̆; Tơdah đe pai noh hăm gŏ kong athei hơkôih păng ôp hăm đak mă rơgoh.

English: All the males among the priests may eat it. It is most holy.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo lăm lu 'bok soi gơh sa 'nhĕm noh; noh jing tơmam rơgoh hloh.

English: But no sin offering from which any of the blood is brought into the tabernacle of meeting, to make atonement in the holy place, shall be eaten. It shall be burned in the fire.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah tơmam soi wă huai dơ̆ng yoch đe chĕp ba tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm wă soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; athei soh lê̆ bĕ.

English: ‘Likewise this is the law of the trespass offering (it is most holy)
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong juăt gah tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch jơ̆ tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh.

English: In the place where they kill the burnt offering they shall kill the trespass offering. And its blood he shall sprinkle all around on the altar.
Bahnar: Lăm anih đe pơlôch kon sem pơm tơmam soi 'buh na athei pơlôch kon sem pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, đơ̆ng noh tơtraih pham sư jum dăr tơ chơnang soi.

English: And he shall offer from it all its fat. The fat tail and the fat that covers the entrails
Bahnar: Păng đe pơyơ̆r đĭ tơmam kiĕng păng rơmă dôm klak mot sư

English: the two kidneys and the fat that is on them by the flanks, and the fatty lobe attached to the liver above the kidneys, he shall remove
Bahnar: 'bar tŏ boh-lăn hăm rơmă sư klep tơ rơhiĕo păng mơ'nhao hơtăng lom klơm, na pleh hơdai hăm 'bar tŏ boh-lăn.

English: and the priest shall burn them on the altar as an offering made by fire to the LORD. It is a trespass offering.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô 'buh pơyơ̆r đĭ tơ chơnang soi, noh pơm tơmam soi 'buh ŭnh sa pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang jơ̆ tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch.

English: Every male among the priests may eat it. It shall be eaten in a holy place. It is most holy.
Bahnar: Lu drŏ-nglo lăm adrĕch 'bok soi gơh sa 'nhĕm noh, tơ minh anih rơgoh. Na noh jing tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh.

English: The trespass offering is like the sin offering; there is one law for them both: the priest who makes atonement with it shall have it.
Bahnar: Tơmam soi huai iŏk đơ̆ng pơm glăi kơ tơdrong juăt kư̆m thoi tơmam soi huai iŏk đơ̆ng pơm yoch, đei tơdrong juăt kơ lu sư 'bok soi gô soi sơmah wă sut tơdrong yoch păng 'bok soi yua sư.

English: And the priest who offers anyone’s burnt offering, that priest shall have for himself the skin of the burnt offering which he has offered.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ bu sư gô đei akar đơ̆ng kon sem mă sư pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi 'buh noh

English: Also every grain offering that is baked in the oven and all that is prepared in the covered pan, or in a pan, shall be the priest’s who offers it.
Bahnar: Dôm tơmam pơyơ̆r tơpŭng mă pơtŏ bơih tơ bơmur ŭnh dah đĭ-đăng tơmam hơtŭk lăm gŏ dah đei hơdrĕng tơ gŏ gang dah phang tơ adring. Gô ăn kơ 'bok soi mă pơyơ̆r noh.

English: Every grain offering, whether mixed with oil or dry, shall belong to all the sons of Aaron, to one as much as the other.
Bahnar: Mă dôm lu tơmam pơyơ̆r tơpŭng phe 'ba đei jrâu đak rơmă dah lê̆ hrĕng kro gô 'măn lê̆ klah asong lei-lăi ăn kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn.

English: ‘This is the law of the sacrifice of peace offerings which he shall offer to the LORD
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih tơdrong juăt gah tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê gô pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang.

English: If he offers it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer, with the sacrifice of thanksgiving, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, unleavened wafers anointed with oil, or cakes of blended flour mixed with oil.
Bahnar: Tơdah bu pơyơ̆r tơmam noh wă bơnê, sư athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi lu 'bĕng ưh kơ đei hrâu hăm 'buih, dah jrâu hăm đak ôliwơ ôh. 'Bĕng klang ưh kơ hrâu hăm 'buih, jrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ păng 'bĕng tơpŭng wă pơm 'bĕng hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ.

English: Besides the cakes, as his offering he shall offer leavened bread with the sacrifice of thanksgiving of his peace offering.
Bahnar: 'Bĕng tơpŭng hrâu hăm 'buih, na pơyơ̆r hơdai hăm tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê.

English: And from it he shall offer one cake from each offering as a heave offering to the LORD. It shall belong to the priest who sprinkles the blood of the peace offering.
Bahnar: Sư gô iŏk minh pôm 'bĕng dơ̆ng lăm rim tơmam pơyơ̆r hăm phe 'ba pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang tơmam soi noh gô 'măn kơ 'bok soi, mă đêl tơtraih pham kon sem tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê.

English: ‘The flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offering for thanksgiving shall be eaten the same day it is offered. He shall not leave any of it until morning.
Bahnar: 'Nhĕm sĕch tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê băt bơnê athei sa pơđĭ hloi lăm năr mă pơyơ̆r noh, ưh kơ gơh 'măn lê̆ oei đei truh pơgê ôh.

English: But if the sacrifice of his offering is a vow or a voluntary offering, it shall be eaten the same day that he offers his sacrifice; but on the next day the remainder of it also may be eaten
Bahnar: Tơdah tơmam pơyơ̆r âu yua kơ tơdrong pơkă dah tơmam pơyơ̆r 'maih wă, đe gô sa tơmam soi noh lăm năr mă pơyơ̆r tơdah oei rơkah gơh sa năr dơning dơ̆ng.

English: the remainder of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day must be burned with fire.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'nhĕm sĕch oei rơkah truh năr mă pêng, đe gô soh lê̆ hăm ŭnh.

English: And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offering is eaten at all on the third day, it shall not be accepted, nor shall it be imputed to him; it shall be an abomination to him who offers it, and the person who eats of it shall bear guilt.
Bahnar: Tơdah bu sa 'nhĕm soi noh lăm năr mă pêng, Kră Yang ưh kơ lăp ôh kơ bơngai pơyơ̆r păng Kră Yang kư̆m lăng ưh kơ yua kiơ kơ sư mơ̆n; noh jing tơmam soi Kră Yang areh, na bu sa tơmam noh gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong kư̆ kă sư.

English: ‘The flesh that touches any unclean thing shall not be eaten. It shall be burned with fire. And as for the clean flesh, all who are clean may eat of it.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ gơh sa ôh 'nhĕm ayơ mă đei hơtŭt 'bơm tơmam 'mê̆-'mach, 'nhĕm noh athei 'buh hŭt lê̆ tơ ŭnh. 'Nhĕm ayơ mă gơh sa lu bơngai rơgoh đĕch gơh sa 'nhĕm noh.

English: But the person who eats the flesh of the sacrifice of the peace offering that belongs to the LORD, while he is unclean, that person shall be cut off from his people.
Bahnar: Bu mă đei tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach na sa tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, bơngai noh đe gô puh tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla.

English: Moreover the person who touches any unclean thing, such as human uncleanness, an unclean animal, or any abominable unclean thing, and who eats the flesh of the sacrifice of the peace offering that belongs to the LORD, that person shall be cut off from his people.’ ”
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu hơtŭt 'bơm tơmam kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach dah đơ̆ng kon bơngai 'mê̆-'mach, đơ̆ng kon sem brem ưh kơ rơgoh dah đơ̆ng tơdrong kiơ mă Kră Yang areh na sa 'nhĕm tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, bơngai noh đe gô puh tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis.

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘You shall not eat any fat, of ox or sheep or goat.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael: Iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa ôh dôm rơmă rơmo, triu dah bơbe.

English: And the fat of an animal that dies naturally, and the fat of what is torn by wild beasts, may be used in any other way; but you shall by no means eat it.
Bahnar: Rơmă lu kon sem brem lôch kơmăp dah lôch đơ̆ng kon sem bri kăp hek gơh yua lăm tơdrong nai, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa ôh

English: For whoever eats the fat of the animal of which men offer an offering made by fire to the LORD, the person who eats it shall be cut off from his people.
Bahnar: bơngai bu sa rơmă lu kon sem brem yua 'buh hăm ŭnh sa pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, đe gô puh tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei sư kơdih.

English: Moreover you shall not eat any blood in any of your dwellings, whether of bird or beast.
Bahnar: Tơ anih ayơ mă lu iĕm oei, lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ sa pham lu sem păr dah lu sem bri.

English: Whoever eats any blood, that person shall be cut off from his people.’ ”
Bahnar: Bu mă sa lu pham noh đe gô puh tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei sư kơdih.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘He who offers the sacrifice of his peace offering to the LORD shall bring his offering to the LORD from the sacrifice of his peace offering.
Bahnar: Roi tơbăt bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael bơngai bu mă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê ăn kơ Kră Yang athei anhăk ba kơ Kră Yang tơmam soi mă đơ̆ng lăm tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê sư.

English: His own hands shall bring the offerings made by fire to the LORD. The fat with the breast he shall bring, that the breast may be waved as a wave offering before the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư athei chĕp ba hăm ti sư kơdih tơmam soi yua 'buh hăm ŭnh ăn kơ Kră Yang; sư athei chĕp ba rơmă hăm sĕch kơtơh, sĕch kơtơh wă yua lăm tơmam pơyơ̆r chro to, âu 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang

English: And the priest shall burn the fat on the altar, but the breast shall be Aaron’s and his sons’.
Bahnar: 'bok soi gô soh rơmă tơ kơpal chơnang soi, na sĕch kơtơh gô 'măn kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư.

English: Also the right thigh you shall give to the priest as a heave offering from the sacrifices of your peace offerings.
Bahnar: Iĕm gô ăn kơ 'bok soi blu gah 'ma wă pơm tơmam pơyơ̆r gah tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê.

English: He among the sons of Aaron, who offers the blood of the peace offering and the fat, shall have the right thigh for his part.
Bahnar: Bu lăm lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn pơyơ̆r pham păng rơmă kon sem tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'blŏk bơnê, bơngai noh gô đei iŏk blu gah 'ma.

English: For the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the heave offering I have taken from the children of Israel, from the sacrifices of their peace offerings, and I have given them to Aaron the priest and to his sons from the children of Israel by a statute forever.’ ”
Bahnar: Yua kơ lăm lu tơmam pơyơ̆r 'blŏk bơnê chro to âu bơngai Isơrael Inh iŏk blu kon sem tơmam soi noh ăn kơ 'bok soi Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt oei ling-lang mă lu kon sâu bơngai Isơrael athei pơm kiơ̆.

English: This is the consecrated portion for Aaron and his sons, from the offerings made by fire to the LORD, on the day when Moses presented them to minister to the LORD as priests.
Bahnar: Noh tơmam soi 'măn đơ̆ng lăm lu tơmam soi yua 'buh hăm ŭnh pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang jao ăn kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư lăm năr mă đe tuh đak rơmă pôk sư pơm 'bok soi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: The LORD commanded this to be given to them by the children of Israel, on the day that He anointed them, by a statute forever throughout their generations.
Bahnar: Noh tơdrong mă Kră Yang tơtă kơ kon pơlei Isơrael ăn kơ lu sư lăm năr sư chu tuh đak rơmă, noh jing minh tơdrong juăt wei ling-lang đơ̆ng jơhnơr âu truh tơ jơhnơr nai.

English: This is the law of the burnt offering, the grain offering, the sin offering, the trespass offering, the consecrations, and the sacrifice of the peace offering
Bahnar: Noh jơ̆ tơdrong juăt gah tơmam soi 'buh, gah tơmam soi phe 'ba, gah tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch păng hơch 'bơm pơm yoch, gah tơmam soi pôk tơdrong jang păng tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê.

English: which the LORD commanded Moses on Mount Sinai, on the day when He commanded the children of Israel to offer their offerings to the LORD in the Wilderness of Sinai.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơtă boih kơ Môis tơ kơpal kông Sinai, năr mă Sư tơtă kơ kon pơlei Isơrael pơyơ̆r tơmam soi lu sư kơ Kră Yang lăm char glă Sinai.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, the anointing oil, a bull as the sin offering, two rams, and a basket of unleavened bread
Bahnar: Chông ba bĕ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, chĕp ba ao tai, đak rơmă pơgang 'bâu phu, rơmo dăm mơlôh, pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r huai đơ̆ng yoch, 'bar tŏ bơbe tơno păng 'bar tŏ 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih.

English: and gather all the congregation together at the door of the tabernacle of meeting.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh akŭm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei, 'bơ̆t anăp Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: So Moses did as the LORD commanded him. And the congregation was gathered together at the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Môis pơm kiơ̆ hloi thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang pơkă. Kon pơlei akŭm hơdai tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And Moses said to the congregation, “This is what the LORD commanded to be done.”
Bahnar: Môis pơma hăm lu bơngai akŭm: 'Nâu tơdrong Kră Yang pơkă boih athei pơm.

English: Then Moses brought Aaron and his sons and washed them with water.
Bahnar: Môis chông ba Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư năm jê̆ păng iŏk đak pơ'nhao ăn kơ lu sư.

English: And he put the tunic on him, girded him with the sash, clothed him with the robe, and put the ephod on him; and he girded him with the intricately woven band of the ephod, and with it tied the ephod on him.
Bahnar: Sư pơhrŭk ăn ao hơ'bơ̆l, tơ̆n ăn tơlei tơ̆n, sư pơhrŭk ăn ao tai êphot păng tơ̆n tơlei tơ̆n êphot đe tanh wê̆; wă kơ êphot huay kơ tơpleh.

English: Then he put the breastplate on him, and he put the Urim and the Thummim in the breastplate.
Bahnar: Sư atol bơnal tơ kơtơh păng pơklep Urim păng Thumim.

English: And he put the turban on his head. Also on the turban, on its front, he put the golden plate, the holy crown, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Sư yơ̆l mu tơ kơ̆l sư, tơ anăp mu sư pơklep plăk maih, wă khan môk pơtao 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă kơ Môis.

English: Also Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the tabernacle and all that was in it, and consecrated them.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Môis iŏk pơgang 'bâu phu păng sư pik tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng dôm tơmam lăm noh păng 'măn lê̆ pha jing tơmam rơgoh wă pơyơ̆r.

English: He sprinkled some of it on the altar seven times, anointed the altar and all its utensils, and the laver and its base, to consecrate them.
Bahnar: Sư tơdjoh pơgang 'bâu phu tơpơh wơ̆t tơ kơpal chơnang soi păng tơdjoh tơ lu tơmam wă yua lăm chơnang soi noh kơthŭng păng jơ̆ng sư 'măn lê̆ pha jing rơgoh wă pơyơ̆r.

English: And he poured some of the anointing oil on Aaron’s head and anointed him, to consecrate him.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m tuh pơgang 'bâu phu noh kơpal kơ̆l Arôn wă kơ sư jing rơgoh.

English: Then Moses brought Aaron’s sons and put tunics on them, girded them with sashes, and put hats on them, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Môis krao lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn năm jê̆ sư, pơhrŭk ăn ao tai, chô̆ tơlei tơ̆n, pơyơ̆l ăn môk kiơ̆ kơ Kră Yang đei pơtă kơ sư.

English: And he brought the bull for the sin offering. Then Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the bull for the sin offering
Bahnar: Sư dui ba rơmo dăm mơlôh, wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch. Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư dan ti lu sư kơpal kơ̆l kon rơmo noh.

English: and Moses killed it. Then he took the blood, and put some on the horns of the altar all around with his finger, and purified the altar. And he poured the blood at the base of the altar, and consecrated it, to make atonement for it.
Bahnar: Môis pơlôch rơmo păng iŏk pham, yua hơnglâu ti sư pik pham noh tơ jum dăr ake chơnang soi wă kơ pơm kơ chơnang rơgoh; đơ̆ng noh tuh pham noh tơ jơ̆ng chơnang soi, thoi noh 'măn lê̆ chơnang soi rơgoh wă soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch tơ noh.

English: Then he took all the fat that was on the entrails, the fatty lobe attached to the liver, and the two kidneys with their fat, and Moses burned them on the altar.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk lu rơmă lom klak, mơ'nhao lom klơm, 'bar tŏ boh-lăn păng rơmă sư, đơ̆ng noh Môis chĕp 'buh tơ kơpal chơnang soi.

English: But the bull, its hide, its flesh, and its offal, he burned with fire outside the camp, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Oei pă lu akar, sĕch sư, ĭch sư, chĕp ba soh lê̆ tơ 'nguaih kơđông, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei pơkă kơ Môis.

English: Then he brought the ram as the burnt offering. And Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram
Bahnar: Môis sư kư̆m athei chĕp ba triu tơno wă yua pơm tơmam soi 'buh, Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư dan ti tơ kơpal kơ̆l kon sem noh.

English: and Moses killed it. Then he sprinkled the blood all around on the altar.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Môis 'bet pơlôch păng tơtraih pham jum dăr chơnang soi.

English: And he cut the ram into pieces; and Moses burned the head, the pieces, and the fat.
Bahnar: Đe kăt 'nhĕm bơbe noh kăt lơ kơnăt păng 'buh kơ̆l, hăm kơnăt păng lu rơmă noh.

English: Then he washed the entrails and the legs in water. And Moses burned the whole ram on the altar. It was a burnt sacrifice for a sweet aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Đang kơ đe iŏk đak ôp klak mot, lu tơkong, đơ̆ng noh Môis iŏk đĭ akâu kon bơbe tơno 'buh pơyơ̆r tơ kơpal chơnang soi, noh pơm tơmam soi 'buh đei 'bâu phu yua 'buh hăm ŭnh wă pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang kiơ̆ thoi đei tơtă kơ Môis boih.

English: And he brought the second ram, the ram of consecration. Then Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Môis anhăk ba triu tơno nai dơ̆ng wă yua pơm tơmam soi pôk tơdrong jang, Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư dan ti sư tơ kơpal kơ̆l triu tơno noh.

English: and Moses killed it. Also he took some of its blood and put it on the tip of Aaron’s right ear, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
Bahnar: Môis pơlôch kon triu, iŏk pham pik tơ hla đon gah 'ma Arôn păng pik tơ hơnglâu yŏng ti 'ma, tơ hơnglâu yŏng jơ̆ng 'ma Arôn.

English: Then he brought Aaron’s sons. And Moses put some of the blood on the tips of their right ears, on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet. And Moses sprinkled the blood all around on the altar.
Bahnar: Môis kư̆m athei kon drŏ-nglo Arôn năm jê̆ păng kư̆m pik pham tơ hla đon gah 'ma lu sư, pik tơ hơnglâu yŏng ti 'ma lu sư pik tơ hơnglâu jơ̆ng 'ma lu sư; đơ̆ng noh Môis săi pham tăp dăr kơ chơnang soi.

English: Then he took the fat and the fat tail, all the fat that was on the entrails, the fatty lobe attached to the liver, the two kidneys and their fat, and the right thigh
Bahnar: 'Blă đơ̆ng noh sư iŏk rơmă, rơmă kiĕng, đĭ-đăng lu rơmă lu mơ'nhao dom tơ klơm, 'bar tŏ boh-lăn hăm rơmă đơ̆ng 'bar tŏ boh-lăn păng blu gah 'ma.

English: and from the basket of unleavened bread that was before the LORD he took one unleavened cake, a cake of bread anointed with oil, and one wafer, and put them on the fat and on the right thigh
Bahnar: Sư iŏk dơ̆ng đơ̆ng lăm bai 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông mă dan 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang boih, minh tŏ 'bĕng iĕ ưh kơ đei 'buih pông, minh tơpei 'bĕng đei jrâu đak rơmă păng minh hlak 'bĕng klang, dan lu 'bĕng noh tơ kơpal lu rơmă păng blu gah 'ma.

English: and he put all these in Aaron’s hands and in his sons’ hands, and waved them as a wave offering before the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư dan đĭ-đăng tơmam noh lăm ti Arôn păng lăm ti lu kon drŏ-nglo sư. Sư pơyơ̆r chro 'ma 'ngiĕo 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Then Moses took them from their hands and burned them on the altar, on the burnt offering. They were consecration offerings for a sweet aroma. That was an offering made by fire to the LORD.
Bahnar: Môis iŏk hĭ tơmam noh đơ̆ng ti lu sư, chĕp ba 'buh pơyơ̆r tơ kơpal chơnang soi dan hơdai kơpal tơmam soi 'buh, noh jing tơmam soi pôk tơdrong jang đei 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng tơmam ăn ŭnh sa pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang.

English: And Moses took the breast and waved it as a wave offering before the LORD. It was Moses’ part of the ram of consecration, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Môis iŏk sĕch kơtơh kon triu tơno kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong pơyơ̆r chro 'ma 'ngiĕo 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang noh 'nhĕm ăn kơ Môis kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang pơkă kơ sư.

English: Then Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood which was on the altar, and sprinkled it on Aaron, on his garments, on his sons, and on the garments of his sons with him; and he consecrated Aaron, his garments, his sons, and the garments of his sons with him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Môis iŏk đak rơmă pơgang 'bâu phu păng pham đơ̆ng kơpal chơnang soi, na prôi tơ Arôn păng hơbĕn ao sư păng kư̆m prôi tơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, tơ hơbĕn ao lu sư mơ̆n. Thoi noh Môis 'măn lê̆ kơ Arôn hăm lu hơbĕn ao sư păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, hăm hơbĕn ao lu sư.

English: And Moses said to Aaron and his sons, “Boil the flesh at the door of the tabernacle of meeting, and eat it there with the bread that is in the basket of consecration offerings, as I commanded, saying, ‘Aaron and his sons shall eat it.’
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư: Lu iĕm athei pai sa 'nhĕm tơ anăp 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng sa hloi tơ noh, sa hăm 'bĕng lăm bai gah tơmam soi pôk tơdrong jang, thoi inh đei pơkă bơih kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư gô sa 'nhĕm noh.

English: What remains of the flesh and of the bread you shall burn with fire.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm athei soh lê̆ lu 'bĕng mă oei rơkah noh tơ lăm ŭnh.

English: And you shall not go outside the door of the tabernacle of meeting for seven days, until the days of your consecration are ended. For seven days he shall consecrate you.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh năr lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh lĕch ôh đơ̆ng 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, dĭng truh tơ dang yơ mă năr pôk tơdrong jang iĕm keh đang, yua kơ tơdrong pôk tơdrong jang iĕm noh keh tơpơh năr.

English: As he has done this day, so the LORD has commanded to do, to make atonement for you.
Bahnar: Thoi đei pơm boih năr âu Kră Yang pơkă bơih, wă pơm kơ lu iĕm rơgoh đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.

English: Therefore you shall stay at the door of the tabernacle of meeting day and night for seven days, and keep the charge of the LORD, so that you may not die; for so I have been commanded.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh iĕm athei oei kơtă tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm măng păng 'năr, kơtĕch lăm tơpơh năr, pơm thoi Kră Yang đei pơkă boih kơnh hli kơ lu iĕm lôch, yua kơ Sư đei tơtă kơ inh thoi noh.

English: So Aaron and his sons did all the things that the LORD had commanded by the hand of Moses.
Bahnar: Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư pơm dôm tơdrong noh kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang yua Môis tơtă ăn.

English: It came to pass on the eighth day that Moses called Aaron and his sons and the elders of Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă tơhngam Môis krao Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư păng đĭ-đăng lu kră bơngai Isơrael.

English: And he said to Aaron, “Take for yourself a young bull as a sin offering and a ram as a burnt offering, without blemish, and offer them before the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư khan bơtho Arôn thoi âu: Rôp iŏk bĕ minh pôm kon rơmo tơno wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, minh pôm triu tơno pơm tơmam soi 'buh, 'bar tŏ noh ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ ôh păng pơyơ̆r 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: And to the children of Israel you shall speak, saying, ‘Take a kid of the goats as a sin offering, and a calf and a lamb, both of the first year, without blemish, as a burnt offering
Bahnar: Ih athei khan bĕ kơ bơngai Isơrael: Lu iĕm athei rôp minh pôm bơbe tơno pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, minh pôm rơmo kon păng minh pôm triu kon mă ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ ôh păng 'bar tŏ noh đei minh sơnăm ngăl bơih. Wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh.

English: also a bull and a ram as peace offerings, to sacrifice before the LORD, and a grain offering mixed with oil; for today the LORD will appear to you.’ ”
Bahnar: Minh pôm rơmo dăm, minh pôm triu tơno, wă pơm tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê, pơyơ̆r 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng tơmam pơyơ̆r tơpŭng lŭk hrâu boih hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ yua kơ năr âu Kră Yang gô tơ'bôh akâu Sư kơdih kơ iĕm.

English: So they brought what Moses commanded before the tabernacle of meeting. And all the congregation drew near and stood before the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu sư chĕp ba tơ anăp Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm dôm tơmam mă Môis đei pơkă bơih; đơ̆ng noh đĭ-đăng lu bơngai năm akŭm năm jê̆ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Then Moses said, “This is the thing which the LORD commanded you to do, and the glory of the LORD will appear to you.”
Bahnar: Môis khan: 'Nâu tơdrong mă Kră Yang tơtă, lu iĕm pơm bĕ na tơdrong ư-ang Kră Yang gô tơ'bôh kơ lu iĕm.

English: And Moses said to Aaron, “Go to the altar, offer your sin offering and your burnt offering, and make atonement for yourself and for the people. Offer the offering of the people, and make atonement for them, as the LORD commanded.”
Bahnar: Môis khan dơ̆ng kơ Arôn: Ih athei năm jê̆ tơ chơnang soi, pơyơ̆r bĕ tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh ih, wă soi huai đơ̆ng yoch ih kơdih gơh rơgoh păng soi huai đơ̆ng yoch kon pơlei pơla păng sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch lu sư, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang đei tơtă bơih.

English: Aaron therefore went to the altar and killed the calf of the sin offering, which was for himself.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Arôn năm jê̆ tơ chơnang soi, pơlôch kon rơmo tơno yua pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch sư kơdih.

English: Then the sons of Aaron brought the blood to him. And he dipped his finger in the blood, put it on the horns of the altar, and poured the blood at the base of the altar.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn iŏk pham ba kơ sư, sư tôt hơnglâu ti sư tơ pham pik tơ lu ake chơnang soi, đơ̆ng noh tuh pham tơ jơ̆ng chơnang soi.

English: But the fat, the kidneys, and the fatty lobe from the liver of the sin offering he burned on the altar, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk soh pơyơ̆r rơmă, 'bar tŏ boh-lăn păng mơ'nhao hơtăng lom klơm kon sem tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, pơyơ̆r tơ chơnang soi, kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang tơtă bơih kơ Môis.

English: The flesh and the hide he burned with fire outside the camp.
Bahnar: Sư 'buh lê̆ sĕch hăm akar tơ 'nguaih kơ kơđông.

English: And he killed the burnt offering; and Aaron’s sons presented to him the blood, which he sprinkled all around on the altar.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư pơlôch kon sem pơm tơmam soi 'buh; lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn chĕp ba kơ sư pham, na sư săi pham noh tăp dăr kơ chơnang soi.

English: Then they presented the burnt offering to him, with its pieces and head, and he burned them on the altar.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m ăn kơ Arôn lu 'nhĕm kăt lê̆ bơih păng kơ̆l sư hloi, na soh pơyơ̆r đĭ tơmam soi noh tơ kơpal chơnang soi.

English: And he washed the entrails and the legs, and burned them with the burnt offering on the altar.
Bahnar: Sư ôp klak mot păng tơkong anhăk ba 'buh hơdai hăm tơmam soi 'buh tơ chơnang soi.

English: Then he brought the people’s offering, and took the goat, which was the sin offering for the people, and killed it and offered it for sin, like the first one.
Bahnar: Păng sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kon pơlei pơla. Sư rôp bơbe tơno pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch kon pơlei păng pơlôch kon bơbe noh, pơyơ̆r wă huai đơ̆ng yoch, nhen thoi tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch mă adrol ki.

English: And he brought the burnt offering and offered it according to the prescribed manner.
Bahnar: Sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh, kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong juăt.

English: Then he brought the grain offering, took a handful of it, and burned it on the altar, besides the burnt sacrifice of the morning.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi hăm phe 'ba, sư chup minh kơđôp anhăk ba soh tơ chơnang soi 'nguaih kơ tơmam soi 'buh til pơgê.

English: He also killed the bull and the ram as sacrifices of peace offerings, which were for the people. And Aaron’s sons presented to him the blood, which he sprinkled all around on the altar
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi noh mơ̆n, sư pơlôch rơmo păng triu tơno pơm tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê yua kơ kon pơlei pơla. Lu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn ăn kơ sư pham na sư tơtraih pham noh tăp dăr kơ chơnang soi.

English: and the fat from the bull and the ram—the fatty tail, what covers the entrails and the kidneys, and the fatty lobe attached to the liver
Bahnar: Păng kư̆m chĕp ba kơ sư rơmă rơmo păng triu tơno, rơmă kiĕng, lu rơmă lom klak 'bar tŏ boh-lăn păng pơ'nhao lom klơm.

English: and they put the fat on the breasts. Then he burned the fat on the altar
Bahnar: Lu sư dan lu rơmă tơ kơpal sĕch kơtơh, đơ̆ng noh soh pơyơ̆r tơ kơpal chơnang soi.

English: but the breasts and the right thigh Aaron waved as a wave offering before the LORD, as Moses had commanded.
Bahnar: Arôn iŏk sĕch kơtơh păng blu 'ma pơm tơmam soi chro 'ma 'ngiĕo 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang thoi Môis tơtă.

English: Then Aaron lifted his hand toward the people, blessed them, and came down from offering the sin offering, the burnt offering, and peace offerings.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Arôn yơ̆r ti sư tơklă gah kon pơlei pơla sơkat ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê, na sư jur đơ̆ng chơnang soi.

English: And Moses and Aaron went into the tabernacle of meeting, and came out and blessed the people. Then the glory of the LORD appeared to all the people
Bahnar: Môis păng Arôn mơ̆t lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm; kơplah sư wă lĕch đơ̆ng hnam noh, bre sư sơkat pŭn hiôk ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla. Na tơdrong ư-ang Kră Yang tơ'bôh 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng kon pơlei.

English: and fire came out from before the LORD and consumed the burnt offering and the fat on the altar. When all the people saw it, they shouted and fell on their faces.
Bahnar: Ŭnh lĕch đơ̆ng anăp Kră Yang sa tơmam soi 'buh păng rơmă kơpal chơnang soi. 'Bơ̆t đĭ-đăng kon pơlei 'bôh tơdrong noh, wang chhôk jreo drap kŭp kơ̆l tơ teh.

English: Then Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, each took his censer and put fire in it, put incense on it, and offered profane fire before the LORD, which He had not commanded them.
Bahnar: Nađap păng Abihu 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn, măr sư tă kơ chĕp gĕl tơmam 'bâu phu ngăl, tah ŭnh lăm noh, tah tơmam 'bâu phu kơpal păng pơyơ̆r ŭnh đơ̆ng nai 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Ŭnh thoi noh Kră Yang ưh kơ đei tơtă ôh kơ lu sư.

English: So fire went out from the LORD and devoured them, and they died before the LORD.
Bahnar: Ŭnh đơ̆ng anăp Kră Yang soh chhông bre noh, na măr sư lôch hloi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: And Moses said to Aaron, “This is what the LORD spoke, saying: ‘By those who come near Me I must be regarded as holy; And before all the people I must be glorified.’ ” So Aaron held his peace.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis khan kơ Arôn tơdrong âu: Kră Yang đei khan boih, Inh gô pơdah jơhngơ̆m rơgoh Inh kơ lu đe bu mă oei jê̆ Inh păng Inh đei tơdrong đe pơyom 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng kon pơlei. Arôn ngăn hreh.

English: Then Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said to them, “Come near, carry your brethren from before the sanctuary out of the camp.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Môis krao Misael păng Êlsaphan, 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Usiêl, ma Arôn păng khan kơ lu sư: Năm jê̆ tơ âu, tung bĕ akâu 'nhŏng oh iĕm lôch weh đơ̆ng anih rơgoh. Anhăk ba tơ 'nguaih kơđông.

English: So they went near and carried them by their tunics out of the camp, as Moses had said.
Bahnar: Thoi noh sư năm jê̆ tung anhăk 'bar 'nu bơngai oei hrŭk ba ao tai sư, tung tơ 'nguaih kơ kơđông, kiơ̆ thoi Môis tơtă boih.

English: And Moses said to Aaron, and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his sons, “Do not uncover your heads nor tear your clothes, lest you die, and wrath come upon all the people. But let your brethren, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which the LORD has kindled.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Môis khan kơ Arôn păng 'bar 'nu kon sư Êlêasar păng Ithamar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơ achăng sŏk ôh păng 'nĕ kơ hek ao lu iĕm kơdih, kơnh hli kơ lu iĕm lôch păng kơnh tơdrong hil mĭl Kră Yang gô truh kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei oei akŭm, mă-lei 'nhŏng oh lu iĕm, adrĕch Isơrael iĕm, athei nhơ̆m kơ lu bơngai mă Kră Yang soh chhông hăm ŭnh.

English: You shall not go out from the door of the tabernacle of meeting, lest you die, for the anointing oil of the LORD is upon you.” And they did according to the word of Moses.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ lĕch ôh đơ̆ng 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm kơnh hli kơ iĕm lôch, yua kơ đak pơgang 'bâu phu Kră Yang tuh boih kơ kơ̆l lu iĕm. Lu sư chu hloi nơ̆r Môis pơma.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Aaron, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Arôn thoi âu

English: “Do not drink wine or intoxicating drink, you, nor your sons with you, when you go into the tabernacle of meeting, lest you die. It shall be a statute forever throughout your generations
Bahnar: Layơ mă ih păng lu kon drŏ-nglo ih mơ̆t lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm 'nĕ kơ et sik hơmu păng huch tơmam kiơ mă pơm kơ iĕm suai kơnh hli kơ iĕm lôch. Tơdrong noh jing tơdrong juăt tơtă ling-lang lăm đĭ jơhnơr lu iĕm.

English: that you may distinguish between holy and unholy, and between unclean and clean
Bahnar: Wă kơ iĕm gơh kơnăl tơdrong 'lơ̆ng hăm tơdrong kơnê̆, tơdrong rơgoh păng tơdrong ưh kơ rơgoh.

English: and that you may teach the children of Israel all the statutes which the LORD has spoken to them by the hand of Moses.”
Bahnar: Păng lu iĕm athei bơtho kơ bơngai Isơrael dôm tơdrong juăt mă Kră Yang đei yua Môis bơtho ăn.

English: And Moses spoke to Aaron, and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his sons who were left: “Take the grain offering that remains of the offerings made by fire to the LORD, and eat it without leaven beside the altar; for it is most holy.
Bahnar: Môis khan kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư oei arih, noh Êlêasar păng Ithamar. Ih iŏk bĕ tơmam pơyơ̆r, phe 'ba mă oei rơkah, đơ̆ng soh pơyơ̆r tơ chơnang soi kơ Kră Yang boih athei sa hloi hăm 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih pông 'bơ̆t cheng chơnang soi; yua kơ tơmam âu jơ̆ rơgoh.

English: You shall eat it in a holy place, because it is your due and your sons’ due, of the sacrifices made by fire to the LORD; for so I have been commanded.
Bahnar: Athei sa tơmam soi âu tơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh, yua kơ tơmam âu 'măn lê̆ kơ ih păng lu kon drŏ-nglo ih đơ̆ng tơmam soi ăn hăm ŭnh sa pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, yua kơ Sư pơkă boih kơ inh.

English: The breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the heave offering you shall eat in a clean place, you, your sons, and your daughters with you; for they are your due and your sons’ due, which are given from the sacrifices of peace offerings of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sĕch kơtơh mă pơyơ̆r chro 'ma 'ngiĕo păng blu kon sem dơrong mă đei pơyơ̆r hiŏng tơ kơpal, na ih păng lu kon akăn ih athei sa tơ minh anih rơgoh yua kơ đe đei 'măn lê̆ kơ ih păng lu kon drŏ-nglo ih đơ̆ng lu tơmam pơyơ̆r 'blŏk bơnê đơ̆ng kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: The thigh of the heave offering and the breast of the wave offering they shall bring with the offerings of fat made by fire, to offer as a wave offering before the LORD. And it shall be yours and your sons’ with you, by a statute forever, as the LORD has commanded.”
Bahnar: Lu sư gô chĕp ba blu kon sem dơrong soi pơyơ̆r hiŏng tơ kơpal păng sĕch kơtơh mă đei pơyơ̆r chro 'ma 'ngiĕo hăm lu rơmă sư, wă soi pơyơ̆r chro 'ma 'ngiĕo 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, dôm tơmam noh đe 'măn bơih kơ ih păng lu kon drŏ-nglo ih, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt ling-lang, mă Kră Yang đei tơtă bơih.

English: Then Moses made careful inquiry about the goat of the sin offering, and there it was—burned up. And he was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron who were left, saying
Bahnar: Môis chă kon bơbe tơno wă pơm tơmam soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch, 'bôh đe 'buh khôi bơih, na sư mĭl kơ Êlêasar păng Ithamar, 'bar 'nu kon Arôn mă oei arih păng khan

English: “Why have you not eaten the sin offering in a holy place, since it is most holy, and God has given it to you to bear the guilt of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the LORD?
Bahnar: Liơ măr iĕm ưh kơ sa 'nhĕm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch tơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh? Yua kơ noh jing tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh mă đe ăn boih kơ lu iĕm, wă kơ lu iĕm pŭ đĭ-đăng tơdrong yoch kon pơlei pơla păng soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch ăn kơ lu sư 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: See! Its blood was not brought inside the holy place; indeed you should have eaten it in a holy place, as I commanded.”
Bahnar: Pham sư ưh kơ anhăk ba tơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ôh, trŏ sư, iĕm sa tơmam âu tơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r inh tơtă.

English: And Aaron said to Moses, “Look, this day they have offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before the LORD, and such things have befallen me! If I had eaten the sin offering today, would it have been accepted in the sight of the LORD?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Arôn tơl Môis: Năr âu lu sư pơyơ̆r boih tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch păng tơmam soi lu sư 'buh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; na kư̆m đei tơdrong truh kơ inh. Tơdah năr âu inh sa tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, lei Kră Yang hăm lăp đon kơ inh ưh?

English: So when Moses heard that, he was content.
Bahnar: Môis kơtơ̆ng tơdrong tơl thoi ei sư drơ̆ng trŏ.

English: Now the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying to them
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Arôn

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘These are the animals which you may eat among all the animals that are on the earth
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael: 'Nâu dôm lu kon sem brem arih kơpal teh noh iĕm gơh sa đĭ-đăng.

English: Among the animals, whatever divides the hoof, having cloven hooves and chewing the cud—that you may eat.
