Bahnar: Kon sem brem ayơ mă đei kơchôp blah, kơchôp jơ̆ng blah 'bar păng gơh mơkan noh lu iĕm gơh sa.

English: Nevertheless these you shall not eat among those that chew the cud or those that have cloven hooves: the camel, because it chews the cud but does not have cloven hooves, is unclean to you
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah kon sem brem ayơ mă lăp pôm gơh mơkan đĕch, dah lăp đei kơchôp blah đĕch lu kon sem brem noh iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa ôh, thoi kơ aseh lăk-đa sư mơkan 'nhĕt mă-lei ưh kơ đei kơchôp blah jing ưh kơ rơgoh.

English: the rock hyrax, because it chews the cud but does not have cloven hooves, is unclean to you
Bahnar: Kơne bri sư mơkan mă-lei ưh kơ đei kơchôp blah jing ưh kơ rơgoh.

English: the hare, because it chews the cud but does not have cloven hooves, is unclean to you
Bahnar: Tơpai bri sư mơkan mă-lei ưh kơ đei kơchôp blah jing ưh kơ rơgoh kơ iĕm, ưh kơ gơh sa.

English: and the swine, though it divides the hoof, having cloven hooves, yet does not chew the cud, is unclean to you.
Bahnar: Nhŭng sư đei kơchôp blah, jơ̆ng ti 'bar pah hơtuch adrol mă-lei ưh kơ mơkan, jing ưh kơ rơgoh.

English: Their flesh you shall not eat, and their carcasses you shall not touch. They are unclean to you.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa 'nhĕm lu sem noh păng ưh kơ gơh hơtŭt 'bơm akâu lu kon sem brem noh dah sư lôch boih; ưh kơ rơgoh kơ iĕm ôh.

English: ‘These you may eat of all that are in the water: whatever in the water has fins and scales, whether in the seas or in the rivers—that you may eat.
Bahnar: Dôm lu kon sem oei lăm đak lu iĕm gơh sa, noh lu kon sem mă đei hla đon păng đei kơchap mă oei lăm đak dơsĭ dah oei lăm đak krong.

English: But all in the seas or in the rivers that do not have fins and scales, all that move in the water or any living thing which is in the water, they are an abomination to you.
Bahnar: Dôm sem brem kiơ lăm đak dơsĭ dah lăm đak krong dôm lu adrĕch arih lăm đak mă ưh kơ đei hla đon păng ưh kơ đei kơchap lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa ôh, lu iĕm athei lăng krưp sem noh.

English: They shall be an abomination to you; you shall not eat their flesh, but you shall regard their carcasses as an abomination.
Bahnar: Dôm lu adrĕch sem brem âu; iĕm athei areh lăng krưp dêh 'nĕ kơ sa 'nhĕm sư păng athei lăng akâu sư lôch noh krưp dêh.

English: Whatever in the water does not have fins or scales—that shall be an abomination to you.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu sem brem lăm đak mă ưh kơ đei hla đon păng ưh kơ đei kơchap jing tơmam mă lu iĕm lăng areh krưp dêh.

English: ‘And these you shall regard as an abomination among the birds; they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle, the vulture, the buzzard
Bahnar: Lăm dôm lu kon sem păr, lu adrĕch mă lu iĕm trŏ kơ areh lăng krưp dêh noh jơ̆ klang, grơ̆, klang kok ưh kơ gơh kơ sa ôh.

English: the kite, and the falcon after its kind
Bahnar: Klang kơtơp păng klang gơsum, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch sư.

English: every raven after its kind
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng ak kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch sư.

English: the ostrich, the short-eared owl, the sea gull, and the hawk after its kind
Bahnar: Sem chhơng, sem đak dơsĭ sem tre-wĕt, koch lĕk, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch

English: the little owl, the fisher owl, and the screech owl
Bahnar: sem ditdut, klang kok, sem bơrơ̆m.

English: the white owl, the jackdaw, and the carrion vulture
Bahnar: Iĕr đak, sem hơkiĕng, klang sa tơmam ôm.

English: the stork, the heron after its kind, the hoopoe, and the bat.
Bahnar: Bôngko, hơda, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch sư, tre-yang păng hơmiĕt.

English: ‘All flying insects that creep on all fours shall be an abomination to you.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kon sem đei pơnăr mơmŏ hăm puăn pah jơ̆ng noh jing tơmam lu iĕm areh lăng krưp.

English: Yet these you may eat of every flying insect that creeps on all fours: those which have jointed legs above their feet with which to leap on the earth.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon sem ayơ mă đei pơnăr mơmŏ hăm puăn pah jơ̆ng na gơh pơplŏng kơpal, noh lu iĕm gơh sa.

English: These you may eat: the locust after its kind, the destroying locust after its kind, the cricket after its kind, and the grasshopper after its kind.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu iĕm gơh sa, noh lep ba kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch sư, adro kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch sư, lep tung-nut kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch sư, ler kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch sư.

English: But all other flying insects which have four feet shall be an abomination to you.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kon sem nai, đei pơnăr nơnăm hăm puăn pah jơ̆ng jing tơmam mă lu iĕm areh lăng krưp.

English: ‘By these you shall become unclean; whoever touches the carcass of any of them shall be unclean until evening
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu kon sem 'nâu bơih na lu iĕm jing 'mê̆-'mach, bu mă hơtŭt 'bơm akâu lôch lu kon sem âu gô đei 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: whoever carries part of the carcass of any of them shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening
Bahnar: Bu chĕp akâu lôch kon sem noh, athei pih hơbĕn ao tai sư păng jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: The carcass of any animal which divides the foot, but is not cloven-hoofed or does not chew the cud, is unclean to you. Everyone who touches it shall be unclean.
Bahnar: Lu kon sem brem ayơ đei kơchôp blah mă-lei ưh kơ đei 'bar pah jơ̆ng ti păng ưh kơ đei mơkan, noh trŏ kơ pơm kơ lu iĕm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach bơih, na bu hơtŭt 'bơm gô kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: And whatever goes on its paws, among all kinds of animals that go on all fours, those are unclean to you. Whoever touches any such carcass shall be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Lu adrĕch ayơ mă đei puăn pah jơ̆ng ti na yak nơnăm hăm tơpang jơ̆ng noh jing tơmam ưh kơ rơgoh kơ lu iĕm, bu mă hơtŭt 'bơm akâu lôch lu sem brem noh gô đei tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: Whoever carries any such carcass shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening. It is unclean to you.
Bahnar: Na bơngai bu mă chĕp ba akâu lôch lu kon sem brem noh athei pih hơbĕn ao tai sư păng gô kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng, dôm lu adrĕch tơmam noh ưh kơ rơgoh kơ lu iĕm.

English: ‘These also shall be unclean to you among the creeping things that creep on the earth: the mole, the mouse, and the large lizard after its kind
Bahnar: Lăm lu adrĕch mă mơmŏ kơpal teh, 'nâu lu adrĕch mă ưh kơ rơgoh kơ lu iĕm: Kur, kơne, makuey kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch sư.

English: the gecko, the monitor lizard, the sand reptile, the sand lizard, and the chameleon.
Bahnar: Păkkê, morkung, chŭ-chă, makuey păr.

English: These are unclean to you among all that creep. Whoever touches them when they are dead shall be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Lăm lu adrĕch noh pơm kơ lu iĕm ưh kơ rơgoh, bu hơtŭt 'bơm akâu lôch sư gô đei kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: Anything on which any of them falls, when they are dead shall be unclean, whether it is any item of wood or clothing or skin or sack, whatever item it is, in which any work is done, it must be put in water. And it shall be unclean until evening; then it shall be clean.
Bahnar: Dôm lu adrĕch tơmam 'nâu, akâu lôch sư mă huŏng 'bơm tơ kơpal tơmam kiơ, pơm kơ tơmam noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, lu tơmam pơm hăm 'long, hơbĕn ao, tơmam pơm păng akar, kơdŭng wă khan tơmam mă bơ̆n juăt kơ yua, athei tong tơmam noh lăm đak, sư gô kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng păng đơ̆ng noh gô jing rơgoh dơ̆ng.

English: Any earthen vessel into which any of them falls you shall break; and whatever is in it shall be unclean
Bahnar: Tơdah akâu noh huŏng lăm ge, dôm tơmam tah lăm noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach đĭ iĕm athei teh pơchah lê̆ ge noh.

English: in such a vessel, any edible food upon which water falls becomes unclean, and any drink that may be drunk from it becomes unclean.
Bahnar: Dôm tơmam sa, nhă, dah đak đơ̆ng ge noh 'bơm, tơmam noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach đĭ mă khan tơmam noh tah lăm ge dah đak kơnê̆ noh 'bơm kư̆m jing kơnê̆ mơ̆n.

English: And everything on which a part of any such carcass falls shall be unclean; whether it is an oven or cooking stove, it shall be broken down; for they are unclean, and shall be unclean to you.
Bahnar: Dôm tơmam dah đei akâu lôch huŏng 'bơm tŏ sĕt sư gô kơnê̆ đĭ. Mă tơnuh gŏ mă chơđah gŏ athei teh pơchah lê̆; sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach bơih, iĕm athei lăng sư kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach bơih.

English: Nevertheless a spring or a cistern, in which there is plenty of water, shall be clean, but whatever touches any such carcass becomes unclean.
Bahnar: Minh pôm tu đak glung dah đak dơnâu iĕm lăng sư thoi rơgoh; tơdah đei akâu lôch kon sem brem huŏng đak noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: And if a part of any such carcass falls on any planting seed which is to be sown, it remains clean.
Bahnar: Tơdah akâu lôch kon sem kiơ mă huŏng 'bơm lăm adrĕch găr đe wă rei, na adrĕch găr noh đe oei jô̆ sư rơgoh.

English: But if water is put on the seed, and if a part of any such carcass falls on it, it becomes unclean to you.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah đe tuh đak kơpal găr adrĕch păng tơdah đei akâu kon sem lôch mă huŏng 'bơm gar, adrĕch noh gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach kơ lu iĕm.

English: ‘And if any animal which you may eat dies, he who touches its carcass shall be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh pôm kon sem brem iĕm gơh sa na lôch hĭ, bu mă hơtŭt 'bơm akâu sư kư̆m jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: He who eats of its carcass shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening. He also who carries its carcass shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Bu mă sa 'nhĕm lôch noh athei pih hơbĕn ao tai sư păng gô 'bơm 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng păng bu mă chĕp ba akâu lôch noh kư̆m athei pih hơbĕn ao sư gô đei 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: ‘And every creeping thing that creeps on the earth shall be an abomination. It shall not be eaten.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon sem ayơ mă mơmŏ kơpal teh tă kơ lăng kơnê̆ krưp ngăl, ưh kơ gơh kơ sa 'nhĕm sư ôh.

English: Whatever crawls on its belly, whatever goes on all fours, or whatever has many feet among all creeping things that creep on the earth—these you shall not eat, for they are an abomination.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ưh kơ gơh sa 'nhĕm sư ôh lu kon sem mă mơmŏ kơpal teh, kon sem ayơ mă mơmŏ hor hăm klak yak nơnăm hăm puăn pah jơ̆ng ti dah nơnăm hăm lơ jơ̆ng, yua kơ noh lăng krưp dêh.

English: You shall not make yourselves abominable with any creeping thing that creeps; nor shall you make yourselves unclean with them, lest you be defiled by them.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ ăn minh pôm kon sem mă 'bơm tơ akâu lu iĕm pơm kơ lu iĕm 'mê̆-'mach, kơnh lu iĕm jing ưh kơ rơgoh. Athei lăng krưp dêh tơdrong noh.

English: For I am the LORD your God. You shall therefore consecrate yourselves, and you shall be holy; for I am holy. Neither shall you defile yourselves with any creeping thing that creeps on the earth.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, Inh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, lu iĕm kư̆m athei oei rơgoh, na gơh rơgoh tơpă. Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ ăn minh pôm kon sem kiơ mơmŏ kơpal teh mă pơm kơ lu iĕm jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: For I am the LORD who brings you up out of the land of Egypt, to be your God. You shall therefore be holy, for I am holy.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang Tơ'ngla mă anhăk ba lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ jing Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, lu iĕm athei rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, yua kơ Inh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: ‘This is the law of the animals and the birds and every living creature that moves in the waters, and of every creature that creeps on the earth
Bahnar: Noh jơ̆ tơdrong juăt gah kon sem brem, gah lu sem păr tơ kơpal, lu ka kon sem lăm đak păng lu kơep lep-ler mơmŏ kơpal teh.

English: to distinguish between the unclean and the clean, and between the animal that may be eaten and the animal that may not be eaten.’ ”
Bahnar: Klah lê̆ pha wă kơ băt kon sem brem ayơ mă ưh kơ rơgoh păng ayơ mă rơgoh, kon sem arih đe gơh sa păng ưh kơ gơh sa.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘If a woman has conceived, and borne a male child, then she shall be unclean seven days; as in the days of her customary impurity she shall be unclean.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael, tơdah đei minh 'nu drŏ-kăn anăp păng hơiơch kơ minh 'nu kon hơ'lơ̆p drŏ-nglo, sư gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach lăm tơpơh năr; kư̆m thoi kơplah sư 'bôh jơ̆ng mơ̆n.

English: And on the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.
Bahnar: Năr mă tơhngam đe gô kăt tơdra akar kơ kon drŏ-nglo sư.

English: She shall then continue in the blood of her purification thirty-three days. She shall not touch any hallowed thing, nor come into the sanctuary until the days of her purification are fulfilled.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh bơngai drŏ-kăn noh athei oei lăm pêng-jĭt pêng năr, wă kơ rơgoh lê̆ pham sư, ưh kơ gơh hơtŭt 'bơm tơmam kiơ mă rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, dah năm mơ̆t tơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, dĭng truh đĭ năr pơm rơgoh akâu sư 'mơ̆i.

English: ‘But if she bears a female child, then she shall be unclean two weeks, as in her customary impurity, and she shall continue in the blood of her purification sixty-six days.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah sư tơpŭ minh 'nu kon drŏ-kăn, sư gô jing 'mê̆-'mach lăm 'bar giĕng kư̆m thoi kơplah sư 'bôh hơbĕn mơ̆n, sư gô oei lăm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach sư, lăm tơdrâu-jĭt tơdrâu năr, wă kơ jing rơgoh 'lơ̆ng kơ đơ̆ng pham.

English: ‘When the days of her purification are fulfilled, whether for a son or a daughter, she shall bring to the priest a lamb of the first year as a burnt offering, and a young pigeon or a turtledove as a sin offering, to the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Tơdah kơtĕch boih măng năr oei rơgoh tơpŭ nge drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn sư, ăn kơ sư năm ba nge noh kơ 'bok soi tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm chĕp ba minh pôm kon triu minh sơnăm, wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh păng minh pôm kon kơtơp dah pơgâm wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch.

English: Then he shall offer it before the LORD, and make atonement for her. And she shall be clean from the flow of her blood. This is the law for her who has borne a male or a female.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô pơyơ̆r tơmam soi noh, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang wă soi sơmah huai yoch sư, kơplah noh sư gô jing rơgoh đơ̆ng pham sư, noh jơ̆ tơdrong juăt bơngai drŏ-kăn hơiơch kơ kon drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn.

English: ‘And if she is not able to bring a lamb, then she may bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons—one as a burnt offering and the other as a sin offering. So the priest shall make atonement for her, and she will be clean.’ ”
Bahnar: Tơdah sư chă ưh kơ kĕ đei minh pôm kon triu, sư athei rôp 'bar tŏ sem pơgâm dah 'bar tŏ kon kơtơp. Minh pôm 'măn kơ tơmam soi 'buh, minh pôm yua pơm kơ tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, 'bok soi gô soi sơmah huai yoch sư, na sư gô rơgoh.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng kơ Môis păng Arôn

English: “When a man has on the skin of his body a swelling, a scab, or a bright spot, and it becomes on the skin of his body like a leprous sore, then he shall be brought to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons the priests.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai 'bôh akâu sư pơ'ngeh păng wă đuh, dah jĭ sư thoi lak kok păng jing hloi chin tơ akâu sư, athei đe chông ba sư tơ 'bok soi tơm Arôn, dah năm ba sư tơ minh 'nu lăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, mă pơm 'bok soi.

English: The priest shall examine the sore on the skin of the body; and if the hair on the sore has turned white, and the sore appears to be deeper than the skin of his body, it is a leprous sore. Then the priest shall examine him, and pronounce him unclean.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô lăng lăng rơka jĭ tơ akâu sư, tơdah sŏk sop 'bơ̆t jĭ tơ akâu sư noh tơplih jing kok păng Jĭ sư jrŭ 'biơ̆ kơ akar so, noh jing jĭ chin, tơdah 'bok soi lăng đang bơih, sư gô jô̆ bơngai âu jing jĭ kơnê̆.

English: But if the bright spot is white on the skin of his body, and does not appear to be deeper than the skin, and its hair has not turned white, then the priest shall isolate the one who has the sore seven days.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah anih lak jing kok lăm akâu sư huay kơ jrŭ 'biơ̆ hăm akar so sư păng sŏk sop ưh kơ jing kok ôh, 'bok soi sư gô chĭt bơngai noh lăm tơpơh năr.

English: And the priest shall examine him on the seventh day; and indeed if the sore appears to be as it was, and the sore has not spread on the skin, then the priest shall isolate him another seven days.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă tơpơh 'bok soi gô lăng sư dơ̆ng. Tơdah jĭ sư oei hơnơ̆ng huay kơ lanh tơ akar nai, 'bok soi gô chĭt sư mă 'bar lăm tơpơh năr dơ̆ng.

English: Then the priest shall examine him again on the seventh day; and indeed if the sore has faded, and the sore has not spread on the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him clean; it is only a scab, and he shall wash his clothes and be clean.
Bahnar: Hlôi kơ tơpơh năr noh 'bok soi gô lăng sư dơ̆ng. Tơdah lak sư noh yơ̆m bơih ưh pă lanh tơ akar nai, 'bok soi gô jô̆ sư rơgoh, noh jĭ pơtôch đĕch. Lei sư gô pih hơbĕn ao sư jing rơgoh.

English: But if the scab should at all spread over the skin, after he has been seen by the priest for his cleansing, he shall be seen by the priest again.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp 'bok soi wă jô̆ sư 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, na jĭ đuh sư iung lanh dơ̆ng tơ lăm akar, bơngai noh sư athei năm pơlơ̆k tơ 'bok soi tăl mă 'bar.

English: And if the priest sees that the scab has indeed spread on the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is leprosy.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô lăng hơlen tơdah jĭ đuh sư iung lanh dơ̆ng tơ akâu akar sư na pơm kơ bơngai noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach; lei noh jơ̆ Jĭ chin bơih.

English: “When the leprous sore is on a person, then he shall be brought to the priest.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai 'bơm chin bơih, athei đe ba sư tơ'bôh tơ 'bok soi.

English: And the priest shall examine him; and indeed if the swelling on the skin is white, and it has turned the hair white, and there is a spot of raw flesh in the swelling
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô lăng sư tơdah đei pơ'ngeh tơ lăm akar, pơm kơ sŏk sop jing kok păng đei 'breo lăm pơ'ngeh sư

English: it is an old leprosy on the skin of his body. The priest shall pronounce him unclean, and shall not isolate him, for he is unclean.
Bahnar: noh boih Jĭ chin oei ngăn lăm akâu akar sư păng 'bok soi gô jô̆ sư kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach bơih, 'bok soi ưh kơ kăl chĭt sư ôh, yua kơ sư jing kơnê̆ bơih.

English: “And if leprosy breaks out all over the skin, and the leprosy covers all the skin of the one who has the sore, from his head to his foot, wherever the priest looks
Bahnar: Tơdah Jĭ chin lanh jơ̆p kơ akâu akar sư, đơ̆ng kơ̆l truh tơ jơ̆ng, jơ̆p-jang 'bok soi lăng 'bôh nhen.

English: then the priest shall consider; and indeed if the leprosy has covered all his body, he shall pronounce him clean who has the sore. It has all turned white. He is clean.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô lăng, tơdah jĭ chin jơ̆p-jang 'bĕnh kơ akâu sư boih, 'bok soi jô̆ sư jing rơgoh kơ tơdrong jĭ noh, akar sư jing kok jơ̆p-jang akâu na noh jing rơgoh bơih.

English: But when raw flesh appears on him, he shall be unclean.
Bahnar: Mă-lei năr ayơ mă sĕch akâu nhen đum 'brê na sư noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: And the priest shall examine the raw flesh and pronounce him to be unclean; for the raw flesh is unclean. It is leprosy.
Bahnar: Mưh 'bok soi lăng 'bôh sĕch akar sư đum 'brê na jô̆ sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach. Sĕch đum 'brê noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, noh Jĭ chin bơih.

English: Or if the raw flesh changes and turns white again, he shall come to the priest.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah akâu akar sư đơ̆ng 'brê jing kok sư athei năm tơ'bôh akâu sư tơ 'bok soi.

English: And the priest shall examine him; and indeed if the sore has turned white, then the priest shall pronounce him clean who has the sore. He is clean.
Bahnar: Na 'bok soi lăng sư păng tơdah tơdrong jĭ sư jing kok bơih, na 'bok soi jô̆ sư rơgoh đơ̆ng tơdrong jĭ, yua kơ rơgoh 'lơ̆ng bơih.

English: “If the body develops a boil in the skin, and it is healed
Bahnar: Tơdah đei minh 'nu bơngai tơ akâu sư đêl pơtôch na klaih bơih

English: and in the place of the boil there comes a white swelling or a bright spot, reddish-white, then it shall be shown to the priest
Bahnar: păng đêl rơka pơtôch noh đei pơ'ngeh kok dah pơ'ngeh 'bri, bơngai noh athei năm tơ'bôh akâu sư kơ 'bok soi.

English: and if, when the priest sees it, it indeed appears deeper than the skin, and its hair has turned white, the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is a leprous sore which has broken out of the boil.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô lăng sư, tơdah 'bơ̆t jĭ rơka sư jrŭ hloh kơ akar păng sŏk sop sư jing kok 'bok soi gô jô̆ sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, noh jĭ chin, sư lĕch 'bơ̆t đêl pơtôch.

English: But if the priest examines it, and indeed there are no white hairs in it, and it is not deeper than the skin, but has faded, then the priest shall isolate him seven days
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah 'bok soi lăng boih, na sŏk sop 'bơ̆t jĭ sư ưh kơ jing kok păng ưh kơ jrŭ tơ akar, na jing thoi rơka so đĕch 'bok soi gô chĭt sư lăm tơpơh năr.

English: and if it should at all spread over the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is a leprous sore.
Bahnar: Tơdah jĭ sư lanh lăm akar, 'bok soi gô jô̆ sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, noh sư đei jĭ chin.

English: But if the bright spot stays in one place, and has not spread, it is the scar of the boil; and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
Bahnar: Tơdah anih lak sư hơnơ̆ng minh 'bôt, ưh kơ lanh rai să, noh đêl pơtôch so đĕch, 'bok soi gô jô̆ sư rơgoh.

English: “Or if the body receives a burn on its skin by fire, and the raw flesh of the burn becomes a bright spot, reddish-white or white
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah bu mă đei pơtŏk đơ̆ng ŭnh tơ akar sư, na rơka pơtŏk noh sư 'brê dah kok

English: then the priest shall examine it; and indeed if the hair of the bright spot has turned white, and it appears deeper than the skin, it is leprosy broken out in the burn. Therefore the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is a leprous sore.
Bahnar: 'bok soi gô lăng tơdah sŏk sop 'bơ̆t jĭ lak jing kok păng jrŭ hloh kơ akar so, noh jĭ chin đuh lăm đêl pơtŏk, 'bok soi jô̆ sư kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, noh jĭ chin.

English: But if the priest examines it, and indeed there are no white hairs in the bright spot, and it is not deeper than the skin, but has faded, then the priest shall isolate him seven days.
Bahnar: Păng tơdah 'bok soi lăng anih noh, ưh kơ 'bôh sŏk sop 'bơ̆t jĭ sư huay kơ kok ôh, ưh kơ jrŭ hloh akar so păng 'bôh jĭ sư akar nhen thoi so, 'bok soi athei chĭt sư lăm tơpơh năr.

English: And the priest shall examine him on the seventh day. If it has at all spread over the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is a leprous sore.
Bahnar: Kơtĕch lăm tơpơh năr 'bok soi lăng lăng sư dơ̆ng, tơdah jĭ sư lanh jơ̆p lăm akar, 'bok soi athei jô̆ sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, noh jĭ chin.

English: But if the bright spot stays in one place, and has not spread on the skin, but has faded, it is a swelling from the burn. The priest shall pronounce him clean, for it is the scar from the burn.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah jĭ sư oei hơnơ̆ng minh 'bôt ưh kơ lanh tơ lăm akar, nhen akar so noh đơ̆ng đêl pơtŏk ŭnh, 'bok soi gô jô̆ sư jing rơgoh, yua kơ noh đêl rơka pơtŏk so.

English: “If a man or woman has a sore on the head or the beard
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn đei rơka tơ kơ̆l, dah 'bơ̆t kang sư

English: then the priest shall examine the sore; and indeed if it appears deeper than the skin, and there is in it thin yellow hair, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is a scaly leprosy of the head or beard.
Bahnar: na 'bok soi gô lăng lăng rơka noh, tơdah rơka noh jrŭ hloh kơ akar so, đei sŏk sop jing kơmưt păng chăt hui, 'bok soi gô jô̆ sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, noh jĭ đơđik, chin tơ kơ̆l dah 'bơ̆t sŏk kang sư.

English: But if the priest examines the scaly sore, and indeed it does not appear deeper than the skin, and there is no black hair in it, then the priest shall isolate the one who has the scale seven days.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'bok soi lăng tơdrong jĭ đơđik, ưh kơ jrŭ hloh akar so păng ưh kơ đei sŏk sop găm chăt 'bơ̆t rơka jĭ noh, na 'bok soi gô chĭt bơngai jĭ đơđik noh lăm tơpơh năr.

English: And on the seventh day the priest shall examine the sore; and indeed if the scale has not spread, and there is no yellow hair in it, and the scale does not appear deeper than the skin
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t năr mă tơpơh 'bok soi gô lăng lăng rơka Jĭ sư; tơdah đơđik sư ưh kơ lanh, ưh kơ đei sŏk sop kơmưt păng ưh kơ jrŭ hloh kơ akar so

English: he shall shave himself, but the scale he shall not shave. And the priest shall isolate the one who has the scale another seven days.
Bahnar: bơngai noh gô hơkôih sŏk sop păng sŏk kơ̆l sư mă-lei ưh kơ hơkôih 'bơ̆t đơđik sư, đơ̆ng noh 'bok soi gô chĭt sư mă 'bar lăm tơpơh năr dơ̆ng.

English: On the seventh day the priest shall examine the scale; and indeed if the scale has not spread over the skin, and does not appear deeper than the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him clean. He shall wash his clothes and be clean.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô lăng dơ̆ng tơdrong đơđik sư tơ lăm năr mă tơpơh, tơdah đơđik sư ưh kơ lanh rai să, ưh kơ jrŭ hloh kơ akar so, 'bok soi gô jô̆ sư jing rơgoh, bơngai jĭ noh athei pih ao tai sư na jing rơgoh.

English: But if the scale should at all spread over the skin after his cleansing
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah đơ̆ng rŏng jô̆ bơngai noh rơgoh bơih, na đei dơ̆ng jĭ sư lanh tơ akâu, 'bok soi athei lăng lăng dơ̆ng.

English: then the priest shall examine him; and indeed if the scale has spread over the skin, the priest need not seek for yellow hair. He is unclean.
Bahnar: Tơdah jĭ sư lanh tơ akâu akar sư, 'bok soi ưh kơ kăl ôh chơchă sŏk sop sư kơmưt dơ̆ng, noh jơ̆ kơnê̆ bơih.

English: But if the scale appears to be at a standstill, and there is black hair grown up in it, the scale has healed. He is clean, and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah sư 'bôh jĭ đơđik hơnơ̆ng minh 'bôt, ưh pă lanh, na sŏk sop găm ưh kơ chăt 'bơ̆t rơka jĭ noh lei tơdrong jĭ noh klaih bơih, sư jing rơgoh; păng 'bok soi gô jô̆ sư rơgoh.

English: “If a man or a woman has bright spots on the skin of the body, specifically white bright spots
Bahnar: Tơdah drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn tơ akâu akar sư đei hơđoh kok, lak kok.

English: then the priest shall look; and indeed if the bright spots on the skin of the body are dull white, it is a white spot that grows on the skin. He is clean.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô lăng. Tơdah akâu akar sư đei hơđoh kok, bul, bơngai noh jing rơgoh, yua kơ noh jơ̆ jĭ lak tơ akar sư đĕch.

English: “As for the man whose hair has fallen from his head, he is bald, but he is clean.
Bahnar: Tơdah sŏk kơ̆l minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo tơtuh, noh jơ̆ bơngai kơ̆l hok, đe jô̆ sư oei rơgoh đĕch.

English: He whose hair has fallen from his forehead, he is bald on the forehead, but he is clean.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo sŏk sư tơtuh 'bơ̆t klĕng, bơngai noh klĕng hok, jô̆ sư oei rơgoh.

English: And if there is on the bald head or bald forehead a reddish-white sore, it is leprosy breaking out on his bald head or his bald forehead.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah đei 'bơ̆t kơ̆l mưu dah 'bơ̆t, klĕng hok đei jĭ lak, noh jơ̆ jĭ chin, sư lĕch tơ klĕng hok dah 'bơ̆t kơ̆l mưu.

English: Then the priest shall examine it; and indeed if the swelling of the sore is reddish-white on his bald head or on his bald forehead, as the appearance of leprosy on the skin of the body
Bahnar: 'Bok soi athei lăng sư. Tơdah 'bơ̆t anih jĭ sư 'brê kok, 'bơ̆t kơ̆l mưu, dah 'bơ̆t klĕng hok sư thoi jĭ chin tơ akâu akar sư.

English: he is a leprous man. He is unclean. The priest shall surely pronounce him unclean; his sore is on his head.
Bahnar: Lei bơngai âu jĭ chin, 'bok soi gô jô̆ sư kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach rơka tơ kơ̆l.

English: “Now the leper on whom the sore is, his clothes shall be torn and his head bare; and he shall cover his mustache, and cry, ‘Unclean! Unclean!’
Bahnar: Bơngai jĭ chin đei tơdrong jĭ noh gô hrŭk hơbĕn ao hiah, ưh kơ chô̆ sŏk, gom lê̆ sŏk kang sư na athei ôr: 'Mê̆-'mach, 'mê̆-'mach.

English: He shall be unclean. All the days he has the sore he shall be unclean. He is unclean, and he shall dwell alone; his dwelling shall be outside the camp.
Bahnar: Lăm khei năr tơdrong jĭ, bơngai noh kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach sư athei oei hơdrô̆ 'nguaih kơ anih hơdrŭm.

English: “Also, if a garment has a leprous plague in it, whether it is a woolen garment or a linen garment
Bahnar: Tơdah đei hơbĕn ao 'bơm phơ̆ka thoi jĭ chin, hơbĕn ao hăm sŏk triu dah hơbĕn ao che

English: whether it is in the warp or woof of linen or wool, whether in leather or in anything made of leather
Bahnar: tơ brai tơdơ̆ng dah brai tơnanh, b tơ ao sŏk triu dah ao che, dah tơmam kiơ hăm akar.

English: and if the plague is greenish or reddish in the garment or in the leather, whether in the warp or in the woof, or in anything made of leather, it is a leprous plague and shall be shown to the priest.
Bahnar: Tơdah phơ̆k noh jơk dah 'brê, tơ hơbĕn ao dah tơ tơmam akar, tơ brai tơdơ̆ng dah tơnanh dah tơ minh blah akar noh jơ̆ phơ̆k, đe gô tơ'bôh kơ 'bok soi.

English: The priest shall examine the plague and isolate that which has the plague seven days.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô lăng tơmam noh păng tah chĭt lê̆ tơmam noh lăm tơpơh năr.

English: And he shall examine the plague on the seventh day. If the plague has spread in the garment, either in the warp or in the woof, in the leather or in anything made of leather, the plague is an active leprosy. It is unclean.
Bahnar: Sư gô lăng lăng tơdrong phơ̆k noh lăm năr mă tơpơh. Tơdah tơdrong phơ̆k noh lanh tơ hơbĕn ao, tơ brai tơdơ̆ng dah tơnanh tơ akar dah tơmam kiơ mă hăm akar. Tơdrong phơ̆k noh jĭ chin rai lanh; tơmam noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: He shall therefore burn that garment in which is the plague, whether warp or woof, in wool or in linen, or anything of leather, for it is an active leprosy; the garment shall be burned in the fire.
Bahnar: Thoi noh sư athei soh hơbĕn ao noh phơ̆k 'bơm tơ brai tơdơ̆ng dah brai tơnanh, tơ hơbĕn ao hăm sŏk triu dah hơbĕn ao che, dah tơmam kiơ mă hăm akar, yua kơ noh tơdrong jĭ chin rai lanh; đe athei soh lê̆ tơmam noh tơ lăm ŭnh.

English: “But if the priest examines it, and indeed the plague has not spread in the garment, either in the warp or in the woof, or in anything made of leather
Bahnar: Na tơdah 'bok soi lăng boih ưh kơ 'bôh phơ̆k tơdrong jĭ noh lanh tơ hơbĕn ao tơ brai tơdơ̆ng dah tơnanh dah tơmam kiơ mă hăm akar.

English: then the priest shall command that they wash the thing in which is the plague; and he shall isolate it another seven days.
Bahnar: Thoi noh 'bok soi sư athei đe pih lê̆ tơmam mă 'bơm phơ̆k jĭ noh păng tah 'măn lê̆ sư wơ̆t mă 'bar lăm tơpơh năr dơ̆ng.

English: Then the priest shall examine the plague after it has been washed; and indeed if the plague has not changed its color, though the plague has not spread, it is unclean, and you shall burn it in the fire; it continues eating away, whether the damage is outside or inside.
Bahnar: Đang kơ pih bơih 'bok soi gô lăng lăng dơ̆ng tơmam mă đei tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k noh. Tơdah tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k noh ưh kơ tơkloh păng ưh kơ lanh jơ̆p, lei tơmam noh jơ̆ kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach bơih, ih athei soh lê̆ lăm ŭnh bĕ, yua kơ đei tơdrong jĭ sư sa tơ pah rŏng dah pah klak.

English: If the priest examines it, and indeed the plague has faded after washing it, then he shall tear it out of the garment, whether out of the warp or out of the woof, or out of the leather.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah đơ̆ng rŏng kơ pih 'bok soi lăng lăng dơ̆ng mưh tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k yơ̆m bơih athei sư hek hŭt lê̆ 'bơ̆t đêl jĭ phơ̆k noh tơ che dah tơ akar, tơ brai tơdơ̆ng dah brai tơnanh.

English: But if it appears again in the garment, either in the warp or in the woof, or in anything made of leather, it is a spreading plague; you shall burn with fire that in which is the plague.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k sư oei đei dơ̆ng, 'bôh tơ hơbĕn ao, tơ brai tơdơ̆ng, tơnanh dah tơmam kiơ mă hăm akar, tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k noh lanh dơ̆ng bơih, ih athei soh lê̆ tơmam đei tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k noh tơ lăm ŭnh.

English: And if you wash the garment, either warp or woof, or whatever is made of leather, if the plague has disappeared from it, then it shall be washed a second time, and shall be clean.
Bahnar: Mă-lei hơbĕn ao, brai tơdơ̆ng dah brai tơnanh, dah tơmam kiơ mă hăm akar mă ih đei pih, tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k tơkloh bơih, ih athei pih dơ̆ng wơ̆t mă 'bar đơ̆ng noh sư gô rơgoh.

English: “This is the law of the leprous plague in a garment of wool or linen, either in the warp or woof, or in anything made of leather, to pronounce it clean or to pronounce it unclean.”
Bahnar: Noh jing tơdrong juăt gah tơdrong jĭ chin đei phơ̆k 'bơm tơ hơbĕn ao hăm sŏk triu dah hăm che, tơ brai tơdơ̆ng dah tơnanh dah tơ tơmam kiơ mă hăm akar. Wă lăng kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt noh na jô̆ sư rơgoh 'lơ̆ng dah oei kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “This shall be the law of the leper for the day of his cleansing: He shall be brought to the priest.
Bahnar: 'Nâu bơih tơdrong juăt lu bơngai jĭ chin lăm năr wă pơm rơgoh sư đe gô chông ba sư tơ 'bok soi.

English: And the priest shall go out of the camp, and the priest shall examine him; and indeed, if the leprosy is healed in the leper
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô lĕch tơ 'nguaih kơ kơđông na sư lăng bơngai noh. Tơdah rơka jĭ chin sư klaih bơih

English: then the priest shall command to take for him who is to be cleansed two living and clean birds, cedar wood, scarlet, and hyssop.
Bahnar: 'bok soi tơtă kơ lu sư, chĕp 'bar tŏ sem oei arih păng rơgoh hăm 'long hơngo bri, che hơhĭm păng hla 'long pơgang (Hisôp).a

English: And the priest shall command that one of the birds be killed in an earthen vessel over running water.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô athei lu sư pơlôch minh lăm 'bar tŏ sem noh, lăm gŏ 'bei tơ đak ro hlăng.

English: As for the living bird, he shall take it, the cedar wood and the scarlet and the hyssop, and dip them and the living bird in the blood of the bird that was killed over the running water.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh 'bok soi iŏk sem mă oei arih hơbĭ 'long hơngo bri, che 'brê hơhĭm păng hla 'long pơgang, năm djrŭ tơ pham sem đêl pơlôch tơ đak ro hlăng.

English: And he shall sprinkle it seven times on him who is to be cleansed from the leprosy, and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let the living bird loose in the open field.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi athei tơtraih pham tơpơh wơ̆t tơ bơngai mă wă kơ goh kơ jĭ chin păng jô̆ sư 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, đơ̆ng noh achăng sem oei arih păr tơ chŭn mir.

English: He who is to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, shave off all his hair, and wash himself in water, that he may be clean. After that he shall come into the camp, and shall stay outside his tent seven days.
Bahnar: Bơngai wă kơ đei rơgoh noh athei pih hơbĕn ao tai sư, hơkôih đĭ sŏk sư, hum lăm đak na sư gơh rơgoh, đơ̆ng noh sư gơh mơ̆t lăm kơđông, mă-lei gô oei 'nguaih kơ bơsŭn lăm tơpơh năr.

English: But on the seventh day he shall shave all the hair off his head and his beard and his eyebrows—all his hair he shall shave off. He shall wash his clothes and wash his body in water, and he shall be clean.
Bahnar: Truh năr mă tơpơh sư gô hơkôih đĭ sŏk sop, sŏk kơ̆l, sŏk kang, gơnur măt sư, pih hơbĕn ao sư păng hum lăm đak, na gơh jing rơgoh.

English: “And on the eighth day he shall take two male lambs without blemish, one ewe lamb of the first year without blemish, three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering, and one log of oil.
Bahnar: Truh năr mă tơhngam, sư gô rôp 'bar tŏ kon triu tơno ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ, b minh pôm kon triu akăn mă tơ'bưh kơ đêl, ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ, iŏk pêng lăm mơjĭt tơpŭng hĕch, tuh hrâu đak rơmă ôliwơ.c

English: Then the priest who makes him clean shall present the man who is to be made clean, and those things, before the LORD, at the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi tơ'ngla mă pơm rơgoh kơ sư, gô chông ba bơngai mă wă kơ rơgoh noh păng dôm lu tơmam noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, năm tơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And the priest shall take one male lamb and offer it as a trespass offering, and the log of oil, and wave them as a wave offering before the LORD.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh 'bok soi gô rôp minh lăm 'bar tŏ kon triu tơno wă pơyơ̆r huai đơ̆ng tơdrong hơch 'bơm kơ pơm yoch, hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ, na ba pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'ma 'ngiĕo 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Then he shall kill the lamb in the place where he kills the sin offering and the burnt offering, in a holy place; for as the sin offering is the priest’s, so is the trespass offering. It is most holy.
Bahnar: Sư gô pơlôch kon triu noh lăm anih đe juăt kơ pơlôch sem dơrong tơmam soi, wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch. Păng tơmam soi 'buh, tơ minh anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, yua kơ tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng tơdrong hơch 'bơm pơm yoch, 'nâu mơ̆ng kơ 'bok soi ngăl kư̆m thoi tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch mơ̆n, noh jơ̆ minh tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh.

English: The priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass offering, and the priest shall put it on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô iŏk pham tơmam pơyơ̆r huai đơ̆ng tơdrong hơch 'bơm pơm yoch noh, na pik tơ đon gah 'ma bơngai mă wă kơ rơgoh, tơ hơnglâu yŏng ti gah 'ma păng hơnglâu yŏng jơ̆ng gah 'ma bơngai noh.

English: And the priest shall take some of the log of oil, and pour it into the palm of his own left hand.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi iŏk tŏ sĕt đak rơmă ôliwơ hling tơ tơpang ti 'ngiĕo sư kơdih.

English: Then the priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that is in his left hand, and shall sprinkle some of the oil with his finger seven times before the LORD.
Bahnar: Djrŭ hơnglâu ti gah 'ma sư lăm đak rơmă ôliwơ tơ tơpang ti 'ngiĕo sư kơdih na tơtraih tơpơh wơ̆t 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: And of the rest of the oil in his hand, the priest shall put some on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot, on the blood of the trespass offering.
Bahnar: Đak rơmă oei oei lăm tơpang ti 'bok soi gô pik tơ hla đon gah 'ma, tơ hơnglâu yŏng ti 'ma păng hơnglâu yŏng jơ̆ng 'ma bơngai wă kơ rơgoh noh păng dan tơ kơpal pham tơmam soi pơyơ̆r huai đơ̆ng tơdrong hơch 'bơm pơm yoch.

English: The rest of the oil that is in the priest’s hand he shall put on the head of him who is to be cleansed. So the priest shall make atonement for him before the LORD.
Bahnar: Đak rơmă oei oei lăm tơpang ti, 'bok soi gô hling tơ kơ̆l bơngai wă kơ rơgoh noh. Thoi noh 'bok soi gô soi sơmah pơm rơgoh ăn kơ sư 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: “Then the priest shall offer the sin offering, and make atonement for him who is to be cleansed from his uncleanness. Afterward he shall kill the burnt offering.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô pơyơ̆r tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, wă soi sơmah ăn kơ bơngai noh, gơh rơgoh đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch sư. Đơ̆ng noh 'bok soi gô 'bet pơlôch sem dơrong tơmam soi, pơm tơmam soi 'buh.

English: And the priest shall offer the burnt offering and the grain offering on the altar. So the priest shall make atonement for him, and he shall be clean.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô pơyơ̆r tơ kơpal chơnang soi tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi tơpŭng. Thoi noh 'bok soi gô pơm rơgoh ăn tơdrong yoch sư na tơdrong yoch bơngai âu gơh rơgoh.

English: “But if he is poor and cannot afford it, then he shall take one male lamb as a trespass offering to be waved, to make atonement for him, one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering, a log of oil
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah bơngai 'noh dơnuh hin ưh kơ kĕ đei dôm tơmam noh ôh, ăn kơ sư rôp minh pôm kon triu tơno, yua lăm tơdrong soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng tơdrong hơch 'bơm pơm yoch, pơyơ̆r 'ma 'ngiĕo, wă pơm tơmam soi wă rơgoh đơ̆ng yoch sư păng minh lăm mơjĭt kĭ tơpŭng bơlah, hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ, pơm tơmam soi phe 'ba păng minh puăt lit đak ôliwơ.

English: and two turtledoves or two young pigeons, such as he is able to afford: one shall be a sin offering and the other a burnt offering.
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi noh mơ̆n, kiơ̆ kơ sư đei athei chĕp ba 'bar tŏ kon sem pơgâm dah kon sem kơtơp, sem minh pôm âu pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, sem minh pôm noh pơm tơmam soi 'buh.

English: He shall bring them to the priest on the eighth day for his cleansing, to the door of the tabernacle of meeting, before the LORD.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă tơhngam, sư gô chĕp ba kơ 'bok soi tơmam âu wă pơm rơgoh kơ sư, tơ 'măng jang Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: And the priest shall take the lamb of the trespass offering and the log of oil, and the priest shall wave them as a wave offering before the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô iŏk kon triu tơno, pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng hơch 'bơm pơm yoch păng minh puăt lit đak ôliwơ đơ̆ng noh 'bok soi pơyơ̆r 'ma 'ngiĕo 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Then he shall kill the lamb of the trespass offering, and the priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass offering and put it on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
Bahnar: Sư gô 'bet pơlôch kon triu pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng hơch 'bơm pơm yoch; 'bok soi iŏk pham pik tơ hla đon gah 'ma bơngai mă wă kơ rơgoh tơ hơnglâu yŏng ti gah 'ma tơ hơnglâu yŏng jơ̆ng 'ma sư.

English: And the priest shall pour some of the oil into the palm of his own left hand.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh 'bok soi hling đak rơmă ôliwơ tơ tơpang ti gah 'ngiĕo sư kơdih

English: Then the priest shall sprinkle with his right finger some of the oil that is in his left hand seven times before the LORD.
Bahnar: tôt hơnglâu ti 'ma sư tơ đak ôliwơ, mă tơ tơpang ti 'ngiĕo sư noh, na tơtraih tơpơh wơ̆t 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: And the priest shall put some of the oil that is in his hand on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, on the thumb of the right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot, on the place of the blood of the trespass offering.
Bahnar: Păng pik tơ hla đon gah 'ma bơngai mă wă kơ rơgoh noh, tơ hơnglâu yŏng ti 'ma păng hơnglâu yŏng jơ̆ng 'ma sư. Tơ anih đe dan pham tơmam pơyơ̆r huai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch hơch 'bơm.

English: The rest of the oil that is in the priest’s hand he shall put on the head of him who is to be cleansed, to make atonement for him before the LORD.
Bahnar: Đak rơmă ôliwơ mă oei oei lăm ti 'bok soi tuh tơ kơ̆l bơngai wă kơ rơgoh noh, wă pơm rơgoh kơ sư đơ̆ng yoch 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: And he shall offer one of the turtledoves or young pigeons, such as he can afford
Bahnar: Păng 'bok soi sư kư̆m gô pơyơ̆r, minh lăm 'bar tŏ kon sem kơtơp dah minh lăm 'bar tŏ sem pơgâm kiơ̆ kơ sư kĕ đei.

English: such as he is able to afford, the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, with the grain offering. So the priest shall make atonement for him who is to be cleansed before the LORD.
Bahnar: Pơyơ̆r minh pôm kon sem 'nâu pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, minh pôm kon sem noh pơm tơmam soi 'buh, hăm tơmam soi phe 'ba; thoi noh 'bok soi gô soi sơmah ăn kơ bơngai mă wă kơ đei rơgoh noh, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: This is the law for one who had a leprous sore, who cannot afford the usual cleansing.”
Bahnar: Noh minh tơdrong juăt gah bơngai jĭ chin dơnuh hin ưh kơ đei tơmam pơyơ̆r, wă kơ rơgoh đơ̆ng tơdrong jĭ sư.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Arôn

English: “When you have come into the land of Canaan, which I give you as a possession, and I put the leprous plague in a house in the land of your possession
Bahnar: Layơ lu iĕm mơ̆t tơ char Kanaan, mă Inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm jang sa păng Inh ăn tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k lăm minh pôm hnam, lăm char mă lu iĕm đei iŏk oei jang sa

English: and he who owns the house comes and tells the priest, saying, ‘It seems to me that there is some plague in the house,’
Bahnar: tơ'ngla hnam noh athei năm roi kơ 'bok soi thoi âu: Inh đei 'bôh tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k tơ hnam nhôn.

English: then the priest shall command that they empty the house, before the priest goes into it to examine the plague, that all that is in the house may not be made unclean; and afterward the priest shall go in to examine the house.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi tơtă athei wơh lu sư iŏk đĭ dôm mŭk tơmam đơ̆ng lăm hnam tơlĕch đĭ tơ 'nguaih, adrol kơ wă lăng tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k noh, wă kơ tơdrong jĭ kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach noh huay kơ apoh, đang kơ iŏk hơmet bơih 'bok soi gô mơ̆t lăng.

English: And he shall examine the plague; and indeed if the plague is on the walls of the house with ingrained streaks, greenish or reddish, which appear to be deep in the wall
Bahnar: Sư gô lăng tơdrong jĭ noh, tơdah tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k klep tơ tơnăr hnam 'bôh đei lơ anih phơ̆k kơmưt dah 'brê, tơdah tơdrong jĭ noh sa jrŭ tơ lăm tơnăr.

English: then the priest shall go out of the house, to the door of the house, and shut up the house seven days.
Bahnar: Na 'bok soi gô lĕch tơ 'nguaih kơ 'măng hnam, tang chĭt lê̆ 'măng hnam noh lăm tơpơh năr.

English: And the priest shall come again on the seventh day and look; and indeed if the plague has spread on the walls of the house
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă tơpơh, 'bok soi wơ̆t lăng dơ̆ng, tơdah 'bôh tơdrong jĭ sa lanh tơ tơnăr hnam.

English: then the priest shall command that they take away the stones in which is the plague, and they shall cast them into an unclean place outside the city.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, 'bok soi gô athei đe iŏk lê̆ tơmo hnam 'bơm jĭ phơ̆k noh, na klơ̆m lê̆ tơ anih 'mê̆-'mach 'nguaih kơ pơlei.

English: And he shall cause the house to be scraped inside, all around, and the dust that they scrape off they shall pour out in an unclean place outside the city.
Bahnar: Păng athei đe hơkôih đĭ lăm hnam, jum dăr kơ hnam păng chup đĭ 'bruih đêl hơkôih ei tuh tơ anih 'mê̆-'mach 'nguaih kơ pơlei.

English: Then they shall take other stones and put them in the place of those stones, and he shall take other mortar and plaster the house.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh iŏk tơmo plơ̆ng, tah pơklep đêl tơmo noh păng lŭk chuơh na man bah tơnăr hnam noh.

English: “Now if the plague comes back and breaks out in the house, after he has taken away the stones, after he has scraped the house, and after it is plastered
Bahnar: Tơdah tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k đei dơ̆ng đơ̆ng rŏng kơ iŏk tơmo noh, hơkôih lăm hnam păng man ming tơnăr, hnam noh.

English: then the priest shall come and look; and indeed if the plague has spread in the house, it is an active leprosy in the house. It is unclean.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô năm lăng dơ̆ng, tơdah 'bôh tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k lanh rai să, lei noh jơ̆ jĭ phơ̆k thoi sa lanh lăm hnam, na hnam noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: And he shall break down the house, its stones, its timber, and all the plaster of the house, and he shall carry them outside the city to an unclean place.
Bahnar: Thoi noh athei đe yuih đĭ hnam noh, tơmo, 'long păng chuơh, tŏng pơdŭ đĭ tuh lê̆ tơ anih 'mê̆-'mach 'nguaih kơ pơlei.

English: Moreover he who goes into the house at all while it is shut up shall be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Bu mơ̆t lăm hnam mă đe tang lê̆ boih, bơngai noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: And he who lies down in the house shall wash his clothes, and he who eats in the house shall wash his clothes.
Bahnar: Bu 'bĭch dah sŏng sa lăm hnam noh athei pih hơbĕn ao sư.

English: “But if the priest comes in and examines it, and indeed the plague has not spread in the house after the house was plastered, then the priest shall pronounce the house clean, because the plague is healed.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ hnam mă đei man bah ming tơdah 'bok soi wơ̆t lăng, ưh pă đei 'bôh tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k sa lanh lăm hnam, 'bok soi gô khan hnam noh rơgoh, yua kơ tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k klaih bơih.

English: And he shall take, to cleanse the house, two birds, cedar wood, scarlet, and hyssop.
Bahnar: Tơdrong wă pơm rơgoh kơ hnam 'noh, sư athei iŏk 'bar tŏ sem iĕ, hăm 'long hơngo, che brai 'brê hơhĭm păng hla 'long pơgang.

English: Then he shall kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water
Bahnar: Sư gô pơlôch minh pôm sem lăm gŏ teh, tơ đak ro hlăng.

English: and he shall take the cedar wood, the hyssop, the scarlet, and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird and in the running water, and sprinkle the house seven times.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh iŏk 'long hơngo bri Sêđar, hla pơgang Hisôp, che brai 'brê hơhĭm păng sem arih, djrŭ lu tơmam âu, tơ lăm pham sem mă kăt hơko pơlôch lăm gŏ teh tơ đak ro hlăng păng tơtraih tơpơh wơ̆t tơ hnam.

English: And he shall cleanse the house with the blood of the bird and the running water and the living bird, with the cedar wood, the hyssop, and the scarlet.
Bahnar: Thoi noh wă pơm rơgoh kơ hnam noh, sư iŏk pham sem, đak ro hlăng, sem oei arih, 'long hơngo Sêđar, hla 'long pơgang Hisôp, che brai 'brê hơhĭm.

English: Then he shall let the living bird loose outside the city in the open field, and make atonement for the house, and it shall be clean.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư achăng sem oei arih păr 'nguaih kơ pơlei truh tơ chŭn mir. Thoi âu sư soi sơmah kơ hnam noh wă kơ rơgoh, na hnam noh gô jing rơgoh.

English: “This is the law for any leprous sore and scale
Bahnar: Noh jing tơdrong juăt kơ đĭ-đăng tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k păng đơđik.

English: for the leprosy of a garment and of a house
Bahnar: Tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k đei phơ̆k tơ hơbĕn ao dah tơ hnam oei.

English: for a swelling and a scab and a bright spot
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anih pơ'ngeh, djah, rơka tơlŏng.

English: to teach when it is unclean and when it is clean. This is the law of leprosy.”
Bahnar: Bơtho tơ'bôh wă kơ băt, liơ mă jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach păng liơ mă jing rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, noh jơ̆ khôi juăt tơdrong jĭ phơ̆k.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis păng Arôn

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When any man has a discharge from his body, his discharge is unclean.
Bahnar: Roi bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael; tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo đei đuh lĕch đơ̆ng akâu sư jĭ lĕcha đuh noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: And this shall be his uncleanness in regard to his discharge—whether his body runs with his discharge, or his body is stopped up by his discharge, it is his uncleanness.
Bahnar: 'Nâu jing khôi juăt gah tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach yua kơ đei đuh lĕch đơ̆ng akâu sư. Mă khan akâu sư oei lĕch hơnơ̆ng dah ưh pă lĕch bơih, akâu sư noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: Every bed is unclean on which he who has the discharge lies, and everything on which he sits shall be unclean.
Bahnar: Anih giơng tep bơngai đei tơdrong jĭ đuh lĕch đơ̆ng akâu, gô jing 'mê̆-'mach păng dôm tơmam kiơ mă sư ngăl hơ-oei kư̆m gô jing 'mê̆-'mach mơ̆n.

English: And whoever touches his bed shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Bu mă hơtŭt 'bơm giơng tep sư, athei pih hơbĕn ao sư, hum lăm đak păng sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: He who sits on anything on which he who has the discharge sat shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Bu hơ-oei kơpal tơmam kiơ mă đêl bơngai đei tơdrong jĭ đuh lĕch đơ̆ng akâu hơ-oei bơih, sư athei pih hơbĕn ao sư, hum lăm đak păng sư gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: And he who touches the body of him who has the discharge shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Bu hơtŭt 'bơm akâu bơngai đei tơdrong jĭ đuh lĕch đơ̆ng akâu noh, athei pih hơbĕn ao sư, hum lăm đak păng jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: If he who has the discharge spits on him who is clean, then he shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai đei tơdrong jĭ đuh lĕch đơ̆ng akâu, gơsoh 'bơm kơ bơngai rơgoh, bơngai noh athei pih hơbĕn ao sư, hum lăm đak păng jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: Any saddle on which he who has the discharge rides shall be unclean.
Bahnar: An gre ayơ mă bơngai đei tơdrong jĭ đuh lĕch đơ̆ng akâu hao hơ-oei, an noh gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: Whoever touches anything that was under him shall be unclean until evening. He who carries any of those things shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Bu mă hơtŭt 'bơm dôm tơmam kiơ ala akâu bơngai đei tơdrong jĭ đuh, jing đei kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng păng bu mă chĕp tơmam noh, athei pih hơbĕn ao sư, hum lăm đak păng jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: And whomever the one who has the discharge touches, and has not rinsed his hands in water, he shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu mă đêl bơngai đei tơdrong jĭ đuh lĕch đơ̆ng akâu pel 'bơm na ưh kơ ôp ti adrol, bơngai noh athei pih hơbĕn ao sư, hum lăm đak păng gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: The vessel of earth that he who has the discharge touches shall be broken, and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water.
Bahnar: Gŏ man hăm gŏ teh đêl bơngai đei tơdrong jĭ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu pel 'bơm, athei teh pơchah lê̆; dah tơmam pơm hăm 'long athei ôp hăm đak.

English: ‘And when he who has a discharge is cleansed of his discharge, then he shall count for himself seven days for his cleansing, wash his clothes, and bathe his body in running water; then he shall be clean.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai drŏ-nglo đei tơdrong jĭ đuh noh klaih bơih, athei jô̆ đơ̆ng năr sư gơh klaih truh tơ tơpơh năr, đơ̆ng noh pih hơbĕn ao sư păng hum tơ đak ro, na sư gô rơgoh.

English: On the eighth day he shall take for himself two turtledoves or two young pigeons, and come before the LORD, to the door of the tabernacle of meeting, and give them to the priest.
Bahnar: Truh năr mă tơhngam sư gô rôp 'bar tŏ sem pơgâm dah 'bar tŏ kon sem kơtơp, năm ba 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng jao sem noh ăn kơ 'bok soi.

English: Then the priest shall offer them, the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering. So the priest shall make atonement for him before the LORD because of his discharge.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô pơyơ̆r, minh pôm sem pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch minh pôm sem pơm tơmam soi 'buh, thoi noh 'bok soi gô soi sơmah wă kơ goh tơdrong yoch sư 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang yua kơ đei tơdrong jĭ lĕch đak đuh đơ̆ng akâu.

English: ‘If any man has an emission of semen, then he shall wash all his body in water, and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai drŏ-nglo lĕch đak kơtăk athei hum đĭ akâu sư lăm đak păng gô kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: And any garment and any leather on which there is semen, it shall be washed with water, and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng hơbĕn ao păng đĭ-đăng akâu akar sư đêl 'bơm đak kơtăk lĕch noh, athei pih hum hơrao 'nhao hơpĕch lăm đak păng gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: Also, when a woman lies with a man, and there is an emission of semen, they shall bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai drŏ-nglo ngôi hăm minh 'nu drŏ-kăn na lĕch đak kơtăk, 'bar 'nu măr sư athei hum lăm đak păng gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: ‘If a woman has a discharge, and the discharge from her body is blood, she shall be set apart seven days; and whoever touches her shall be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn 'bôh jơ̆ng, sư athei chu iŏk tơdrong 'mê̆ noh lăm tơpơh năr bu hơtŭt 'bơm sư gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: Everything that she lies on during her impurity shall be unclean; also everything that she sits on shall be unclean.
Bahnar: Dôm tơmam sư yua 'bĭch kơplah sư đei tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach đĭ; păng tơmam sư kơtĭt oei kư̆m jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: Whoever touches her bed shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Bu hơtŭt 'bơm giơng sư tep, athei pih hơbĕn ao, hum lăm đak păng gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: And whoever touches anything that she sat on shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Bu hơtŭt 'bơm tơmam đêl sư kơtĭt oei, athei pih hơbĕn ao, hum lăm đak păng gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: If anything is on her bed or on anything on which she sits, when he touches it, he shall be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Tơdah tơmam kiơ kơpal giơng sư, dah tơmam đêl sư hơ-oei na bu mă hơtŭt 'bơm gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: And if any man lies with her at all, so that her impurity is on him, he shall be unclean seven days; and every bed on which he lies shall be unclean.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai drŏ-nglo 'bĭch hăm bơngai drŏ-kăn, na tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach bơngai drŏ-kăn 'bôh jơ̆ng, 'bơm tơ drŏ-nglo, bơngai drŏ-nglo gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach lăm tơpơh năr; giơng đêl sư 'bĭch kư̆m gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: ‘If a woman has a discharge of blood for many days, other than at the time of her customary impurity, or if it runs beyond her usual time of impurity, all the days of her unclean discharge shall be as the days of her customary impurity. She shall be unclean.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai drŏ-kăn 'bôh pham lơ năr, hloh kơ khei năr sư juăt kơ 'bôh jơ̆ng, dah tơdrong 'bôh pham noh đunh dêh, hloh kơ năr jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, sư gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach đĭ lăm năr sư 'bôh jơ̆ng noh; thoi lăm năr kơplah sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: Every bed on which she lies all the days of her discharge shall be to her as the bed of her impurity; and whatever she sits on shall be unclean, as the uncleanness of her impurity.
Bahnar: Lăm năr sư 'bôh jơ̆ng. Lu giơng mă sư ngăl 'bĭch păng dôm tơmam kiơ đêl sư kơtĭt hơ-oei jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach ngăl, kư̆m thoi kơplah sư 'bôh hơbĕn.

English: Whoever touches those things shall be unclean; he shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
Bahnar: Bu hơtŭt 'bơm tơmam noh gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach athei pih hơbĕn ao sư hum lăm đak; păng gô jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng.

English: ‘But if she is cleansed of her discharge, then she shall count for herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah pham 'bôh jơ̆ng noh păt bơih, athei jô̆ đơ̆ng năr sư păt truh tơ tơpơh năr, đơ̆ng noh jô̆ sư jing rơgoh.

English: And on the eighth day she shall take for herself two turtledoves or two young pigeons, and bring them to the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă tơhngam, sư gô rôp 'bar tŏ sem pơgâm dah 'bar tŏ kon sem kơtơp păng sư athei chĕp ba kơ 'bok soi tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: Then the priest shall offer the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and the priest shall make atonement for her before the LORD for the discharge of her uncleanness.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô pơyơ̆r minh pôm sem wă soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch păng minh pôm sem dơ̆ng pơm tơmam soi 'buh, na 'bok soi gô soi sơmah wă kơ sư rơgoh đơ̆ng yoch sư 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, yua kơ tơdrong sư 'bôh pham lơ năr, jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: ‘Thus you shall separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness, lest they die in their uncleanness when they defile My tabernacle that is among them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih athei klah lê̆ lu bơngai Isơrael ataih đơ̆ng lu tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach lu sư, kơnh hli kơ lu sư lôch lăm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach lu sư noh na pơm 'mê̆-'mach kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm Inh mă oei tŏk-bŏk lu sư.

English: This is the law for one who has a discharge, and for him who emits semen and is unclean thereby
Bahnar: Noh jing tơdrong juăt gah bơngai drŏ-nglo mă đei tơdrong jĭ đuh lĕch đơ̆ng akâu sư păng bơngai drŏ-nglo lĕch đak kơtăk jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: and for her who is indisposed because of her customary impurity, and for one who has a discharge, either man or woman, and for him who lies with her who is unclean.’ ”
Bahnar: Gah bơngai drŏ-kăn 'bôh jơ̆ng dah bơngai drŏ-nglo lĕch đak kơtăk păng gah bơngai drŏ-nglo 'bĭch hăm bơngai drŏ-kăn oei 'bôh jơ̆ng kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: Now the LORD spoke to Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they offered profane fire before the LORD, and died
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Arôn lôch kơplah măr sư năm jê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang

English: and the LORD said to Moses: “Tell Aaron your brother not to come at just any time into the Holy Place inside the veil, before the mercy seat which is on the ark, lest he die; for I will appear in the cloud above the mercy seat.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu: Khan bĕ kơ Arôn 'nhŏng ih 'nĕ kơ mơ̆t ling-lang tơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh tơ lăm kơ che đe pĕng 'bơ̆t anăp tơnglơ̆p mơnat ăn 'măn tơ kơpal kơ hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p, kơnh hli kơ sư lôch, yua kơ Inh gô oei lăm hơmơ̆l tơ'bôh tơ anih mơnat ăn.

English: “Thus Aaron shall come into the Holy Place: with the blood of a young bull as a sin offering, and of a ram as a burnt offering.
Bahnar: Arôn gô mơ̆t lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh thoi âu: Sư dui ba minh pôm rơmo dăm wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch păng minh pôm triu tơno wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh.

English: He shall put the holy linen tunic and the linen trousers on his body; he shall be girded with a linen sash, and with the linen turban he shall be attired. These are holy garments. Therefore he shall wash his body in water, and put them on.
Bahnar: Sư gô hrŭk ao tai che hơtăng rơgoh păng hơbĕn che, tơ̆n tơlei tơ̆n che păng yơ̆l môk che tơ kơ̆l sư, noh jơ̆ hơbĕn ao 'lơ̆ng rơgoh mă-lei sư gô hrŭk đang kơ sư hum.

English: And he shall take from the congregation of the children of Israel two kids of the goats as a sin offering, and one ram as a burnt offering.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ sư iŏk đơ̆ng lăm tơpôl kon pơlei Isơrael 'bar tŏ bơbe tơno wă pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch păng minh pôm triu tơno yua pơm tơmam soi 'buh.

English: “Aaron shall offer the bull as a sin offering, which is for himself, and make atonement for himself and for his house.
Bahnar: Arôn gô pơyơ̆r rơmo dăm pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch sư kơdih, sư gô soi sơmah wă kơ rơgoh đơ̆ng yoch sư păng hnam dơnŏ sư.

English: He shall take the two goats and present them before the LORD at the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Na sư gô rôp 'bar tŏ bơbe tơno, dan 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: Then Aaron shall cast lots for the two goats: one lot for the LORD and the other lot for the scapegoat.
Bahnar: Arôn gô hlang lăng kơ 'bar tŏ bơbe tơno noh, mă minh wă 'măn kơ Kră Yang, minh dơ̆ng kơ Asasên wă khan pŭ iŏk đĭ tơdrong yoch.

English: And Aaron shall bring the goat on which the LORD’s lot fell, and offer it as a sin offering.
Bahnar: Arôn gô pơyơ̆r bơbe tơno, trŏ 'măn kơ Kră Yang, na pơyơ̆r sư pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch.

English: But the goat on which the lot fell to be the scapegoat shall be presented alive before the LORD, to make atonement upon it, and to let it go as the scapegoat into the wilderness.
Bahnar: Gah bơbe mă trŏ kơ Asasên wă pŭ iŏk đĭ tơdrong yoch sư pơyơ̆r oei arih lê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang wă pơm rơgoh tơdrong yoch, đơ̆ng noh achăng lê̆ sư tơ tơmăn glă wă kơ sư pŭ iŏk đĭ tơdrong yoch kon pơlei.

English: “And Aaron shall bring the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and make atonement for himself and for his house, and shall kill the bull as the sin offering which is for himself.
Bahnar: Arôn pơyơ̆r rơmo dăm, pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch, sư pơlôch rơmo noh soi sơmah wă kơ goh đơ̆ng yoch sư kơdih păng hnam dơnŏ sư.

English: Then he shall take a censer full of burning coals of fire from the altar before the LORD, with his hands full of sweet incense beaten fine, and bring it inside the veil.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk bô̆i kep ngar ŭnh ngŭr 'brê kơpal chơnang soi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng iŏk 'bar chup tah tơmam 'bâu phu hĕch, na chĕp ba tơ gah lăm kơ che pĕng.

English: And he shall put the incense on the fire before the LORD, that the cloud of incense may cover the mercy seat that is on the Testimony, lest he die.
Bahnar: Sư gô dan tơmam 'bâu phu kơpal ŭnh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang wă kơ 'nhui đơ̆ng rơmă gom lê̆ tơnglơ̆p tơdrong mơnat ăn, tơ kơpal hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p. Na sư huay kơ lôch.

English: He shall take some of the blood of the bull and sprinkle it with his finger on the mercy seat on the east side; and before the mercy seat he shall sprinkle some of the blood with his finger seven times.
Bahnar: Sư gô iŏk pham rơmo tơno noh, djrŭ hơnglâu ti sư tơtraih tơ tơnglơ̆p tơdrong mơnat ăn păng tơtraih tơpơh wơ̆t gah anăp tơnglơ̆p tơdrong mơnat ăn noh.

English: “Then he shall kill the goat of the sin offering, which is for the people, bring its blood inside the veil, do with that blood as he did with the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it on the mercy seat and before the mercy seat.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư gô pơlôch bơbe tơno pơm tơmam soi yua huai đơ̆ng yoch kon pơlei pơla; sư chĕp ba pham bơbe noh tơ lăm che pĕng, kư̆m thoi yua pham rơmo dăm mơ̆n, tơtraih tơ kơpal tơnglơ̆p tơdrong mơnat ăn păng tơ anăp tơ'bơ̆p mơnat ăn.

English: So he shall make atonement for the Holy Place, because of the uncleanness of the children of Israel, and because of their transgressions, for all their sins; and so he shall do for the tabernacle of meeting which remains among them in the midst of their uncleanness.
Bahnar: Thoi noh sư năm soi sơmah tơ lăm anih 'Lơ̆ng rơgoh yua kơ đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, pơm glăi, yoch kon pơlei Isơrael na sư athei soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch. Sư kư̆m soi sơmah huay đơ̆ng yoch kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, yua kơ anih akŭm oei tơ tŏk-bŏk tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach lu sư.

English: There shall be no man in the tabernacle of meeting when he goes in to make atonement in the Holy Place, until he comes out, that he may make atonement for himself, for his household, and for all the assembly of Israel.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'bok soi mơ̆t lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm wă soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch lăm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, 'nĕ kơ ăn minh 'nu bơngai bu oei lăm noh, dĭng truh tơ sư lĕch, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch sư kơdih, hnam dơnŏ sư păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: And he shall go out to the altar that is before the LORD, and make atonement for it, and shall take some of the blood of the bull and some of the blood of the goat, and put it on the horns of the altar all around.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh sư gô lĕch năm tơ chơnang soi 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, soi sơmah kơ chơnang soi wă kơ rơgoh; sư iŏk pham rơmo dăm păng pham bơbe tơno pik jum dăr lu ake chơnang soi.

English: Then he shall sprinkle some of the blood on it with his finger seven times, cleanse it, and consecrate it from the uncleanness of the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Păng iŏk hơnglâu ti sư tơtraih pham tơpơh wơ̆t tơ chơnang soi, pơm kơ chơnang soi jing 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng ôp lê̆ đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: “And when he has made an end of atoning for the Holy Place, the tabernacle of meeting, and the altar, he shall bring the live goat.
Bahnar: Layơ 'bok soi, soi sơmah huai yoch ăn kơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, kơ chơnang soi đang boih, lei sư gô pơyơ̆r bơbe tơno oei arih.

English: Aaron shall lay both his hands on the head of the live goat, confess over it all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions, concerning all their sins, putting them on the head of the goat, and shall send it away into the wilderness by the hand of a suitable man.
Bahnar: Arôn dan 'bar pah ti sư kơpal kơ̆l bơbe tơno mă oei arih, na roi đĭ-đăng dôm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ pơm glăi lu kon pơlei Isơrael păng dan đĭ-đăng tơdrong yoch lu sư pơm boih kơpal kơ̆l bơbe tơno. Đơ̆ng noh yua minh 'nu bơngai đei jao boih tơdrong jang 'nâu na puh achăng bơbe noh tơ tơmăn glă.

English: The goat shall bear on itself all their iniquities to an uninhabited land; and he shall release the goat in the wilderness.
Bahnar: Kon bơbe noh gô pŭ tơ akâu sư dôm tơdrong yoch kon pơlei Isơrael, lĕch tơ bri brah ưh kơ đei bơngai, đe achăng bơbe noh tơ tơmăn glă.

English: “Then Aaron shall come into the tabernacle of meeting, shall take off the linen garments which he put on when he went into the Holy Place, and shall leave them there.
Bahnar: Arôn gô mơ̆t lăm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, plôh lê̆ hơbĕn ao đêl sư hrŭk mơ̆t tơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng sư gô lê̆ hloi hơbĕn ao tơ noh.

English: And he shall wash his body with water in a holy place, put on his garments, come out and offer his burnt offering and the burnt offering of the people, and make atonement for himself and for the people.
Bahnar: Sư gô hum tơ lăm minh anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, hrŭk ao sư, lĕch tơ 'nguaih, pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh kơ sư kơdih păng tơmam soi 'buh kơ kon pơlei pơla, soi sơmah kơ sư kơdih păng kon pơlei pơla wă kơ rơgoh.

English: The fat of the sin offering he shall burn on the altar.
Bahnar: Sư gô iŏk rơmă tơmam soi huai tơdrong yoch na soh pơyơ̆r tơ kơpal chơnang soi.

English: And he who released the goat as the scapegoat shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water, and afterward he may come into the camp.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă dui tơlĕch bơbe tơno gah pŭ tơdrong yoch kon pơlei athei pih hơbĕn ao sư păng hum lăm đak, đơ̆ng noh sư gơh brŏk mơ̆t tơ gơđông.

English: The bull for the sin offering and the goat for the sin offering, whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the Holy Place, shall be carried outside the camp. And they shall burn in the fire their skins, their flesh, and their offal.
Bahnar: Đe gô anhăk ba rơmo tơno păng bơbe tơno tơ 'nguaih kơ gơđông, tơmam mă hlôi pơyơ̆r bơih pơm tơmam soi huai iŏk đơ̆ng yoch, pham sư đe anhăk ba tơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh wă soi sơmah huai tơdrong yoch; đơ̆ng noh sư gô iŏk soh lê̆ lăm ŭnh, akar, sĕch păng ĭch, tơmam soi noh tơ 'nguaih kơ gơđông.

English: Then he who burns them shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water, and afterward he may come into the camp.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă soh athei pih hơbĕn ao sư păng hum; đơ̆ng noh na gơh brŏk mơ̆t tơ gơđông.

English: “This shall be a statute forever for you: In the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall afflict your souls, and do no work at all, whether a native of your own country or a stranger who dwells among you.
Bahnar: 'Nâu jing tơdrong juăt kơ lu iĕm ling-lang khŏm khŏm truh tơ năr mơjĭt lăm khei tơpơh, lu iĕm athei pơmat akâu lu iĕm kơdih, ưh kơ gơh pơm minh tơdrong kiơ, mă kon pơlei pơla iĕm kơdih, dah tơmoi nai bơngai đơ̆ng ataih oei hăm lu iĕm.

English: For on that day the priest shall make atonement for you, to cleanse you, that you may be clean from all your sins before the LORD.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lăm năr noh đe gô soi sơmah ôp rơgoh lu iĕm đơ̆ng yoch, wă kơ lu iĕm gơh rơgoh, na lu iĕm gô rơgoh tơdrong yoch lu iĕm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: It is a sabbath of solemn rest for you, and you shall afflict your souls. It is a statute forever.
Bahnar: Noh jing thoi năr Sa'bat kơ lu iĕm, minh năr pơdơh pơyom, lu iĕm athei pơmat akâu iĕm kơdih, noh jing tơdrong juăt ling-lang.

English: And the priest, who is anointed and consecrated to minister as priest in his father’s place, shall make atonement, and put on the linen clothes, the holy garments
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô tuh rơmă păng pôk sư pơm 'bok soi tơplih kơ 'bă sư, wă soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch, gô hrŭk hơbĕn ao che wă khan hơbĕn ao 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, na soi sơmah huai iŏk tơdrong yoch.

English: then he shall make atonement for the Holy Sanctuary, and he shall make atonement for the tabernacle of meeting and for the altar, and he shall make atonement for the priests and for all the people of the assembly.
Bahnar: Sư mă soi sơmah pơm rơgoh ăn kơ anih rơgoh păng kơ Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng soi sơmah kơ chơnang soi, soi sơmah kơ lu 'bok soi păng soi sơmah kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: This shall be an everlasting statute for you, to make atonement for the children of Israel, for all their sins, once a year.” And he did as the LORD commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Minh sơnăm minh wơ̆t athei soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch kon pơlei Isơrael, wă pơm rơgoh tơdrong yoch lu sư, noh gô jing tơdrong juăt lu iĕm ling-lang khŏm khŏm. Arôn pơm rok kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang khan pơkă bơih kơ Môis.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Speak to Aaron, to his sons, and to all the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘This is the thing which the LORD has commanded, saying
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ Arôn, lu kon drŏ-nglo sư păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael: 'Nâu nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă boih.

English: “Whatever man of the house of Israel who kills an ox or lamb or goat in the camp, or who kills it outside the camp
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo, đơ̆ng lăm hnam Isơrael koh pơlôch minh pôm rơmo, minh pôm kon triu dah minh pôm bơbe lăm anih kơđông dah 'nguaih kơ anih kơđông

English: and does not bring it to the door of the tabernacle of meeting to offer an offering to the LORD before the tabernacle of the LORD, the guilt of bloodshed shall be imputed to that man. He has shed blood; and that man shall be cut off from among his people
Bahnar: na ưh kơ dui ba tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, wă pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang 'bơ̆t anăp Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang, pham noh gô tuh tơpŭ tơdrong yoch kơ bơngai drŏ-nglo noh; sư 'bet tuh pham bơih; đe gô tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: to the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices which they offer in the open field, that they may bring them to the LORD at the door of the tabernacle of meeting, to the priest, and offer them as peace offerings to the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh wă kơ kon pơlei Isơrael iŏk tơmam soi lu sư mă đei 'bet pơlôch tơ bri tơ mir, na anhăk ba kơ 'bok soi, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm. Wă 'bet pơyơ̆r soi sơmah kơ tơdrong 'blŏk bơnê kơ Kră Yang.

English: And the priest shall sprinkle the blood on the altar of the LORD at the door of the tabernacle of meeting, and burn the fat for a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô tơtraih pham tơmam soi tơ kơpal chơnang soi kơ Kră Yang 'bơ̆t 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm păng soh pơyơ̆r rơmă đei 'bâu phu ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: They shall no more offer their sacrifices to demons, after whom they have played the harlot. This shall be a statute forever for them throughout their generations.” ’
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael ưh pă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi lu sư kơ yang kơnê̆ păng ưh pă tơ'bưh pơm pơyô kư̆ kă hăm lu sư dơ̆ng. Noh jing tơdrong juăt ling-lang kơ lu sư lăm đĭ chăl đơ̆ng rŏng.

English: “Also you shall say to them: ‘Whatever man of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who dwell among you, who offers a burnt offering or sacrifice
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih athei khan kơ lu sư: Tơdah bu mă lăm bơngai Isơrael, dah bơngai tơmoi oei lăm lu kon pơlei, sư pơyơ̆r minh pôm tơmam soi 'buh dah pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kiơ

English: and does not bring it to the door of the tabernacle of meeting, to offer it to the LORD, that man shall be cut off from among his people.
Bahnar: na ưh kơ chĕp ba tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm wă pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, lei bơngai noh đe gô puh tơweh sư đơ̆ng kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: ‘And whatever man of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who dwell among you, who eats any blood, I will set My face against that person who eats blood, and will cut him off from among his people.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu mă đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch Isơrael, dah bơngai tơmoi oei hăm sư, sa pham kiơ bưh, lei Inh gô iung hil mĭl kơ bơngai sa pham noh, Inh gô puh tơhiong lê̆ sư đơ̆ng bơngai Isơrael sư.

English: For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have given it to you upon the altar to make atonement for your souls; for it is the blood that makes atonement for the soul.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong ariha sĕch akar oei tơ lăm pham; Inh ăn boih kơ lu iĕm pham tơtraih tơ chơnang soi wă soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng yoch bơhngol lu iĕm; yua kơ pham jing tơdrong arih.

English: Therefore I said to the children of Israel, ‘No one among you shall eat blood, nor shall any stranger who dwells among you eat blood.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong noh na Inh khan boih kơ bơngai Isơrael, Lăm lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh minh 'nu bơngai bu mă sa pham, bơngai tơmoi oei hăm iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ gơh sa pham.

English: “Whatever man of the children of Israel, or of the strangers who dwell among you, who hunts and catches any animal or bird that may be eaten, he shall pour out its blood and cover it with dust
Bahnar: Thoi noh mơ̆n tơdah đei minh 'nu bơngai lăm kon pơlei Isơrael dah đơ̆ng lăm bơngai tơmoi, chă hơnguang đei minh pôm jĭl juei dah sem păr mă bơ̆n juăt kơ sa, 'bet lê̆ pham lĕch na iŏk teh 'bŭ lê̆.

English: for it is the life of all flesh. Its blood sustains its life. Therefore I said to the children of Israel, ‘You shall not eat the blood of any flesh, for the life of all flesh is its blood. Whoever eats it shall be cut off.’
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong arih đĭ-đăng lu kon sem brem lăm pham ngăl, yua kơ thoi noh na Inh khan boih kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael, lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh sa pham dôm lu kon sem brem, yua kơ tơdrong arih lu sem brem noh jơ̆ lăm pham sư, bu sa đe gô puh tơweh lê̆ sư.

English: “And every person who eats what died naturally or what was torn by beasts, whether he is a native of your own country or a stranger, he shall both wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening. Then he shall be clean.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đơ̆ng pơlei kơtă dah đơ̆ng tơmoi, na sa 'nhĕm sem brem lôch kơmăp kơdih dah lôch đơ̆ng đêl sem bri kăp bơngai noh athei pih hơbĕn ao sư, hum lăm đak păng gô đei kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng, klaih kơ noh sư jing rơgoh.

English: But if he does not wash them or bathe his body, then he shall bear his guilt.”
Bahnar: Tơdah sư ưh kơ pih hơbĕn ao sư păng ưh kơ hum, sư gô pŭ tơdrong yoch sư.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael, Inh jing Kră Yang lu iĕm.

English: According to the doings of the land of Egypt, where you dwelt, you shall not do; and according to the doings of the land of Canaan, where I am bringing you, you shall not do; nor shall you walk in their ordinances.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơm rok ôh tơdrong lu sư pơm tơ lăm char Êyiptơ, char mă đêl lu iĕm oei, dah tơ char Kanaan, đơ̆ng char noh mă Inh chông ba lu iĕm. Lu iĕm kư̆m 'nĕ kơ yak kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt lu sư ôh.

English: You shall observe My judgments and keep My ordinances, to walk in them: I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei pơm kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Inh đei tơtă boih, bơwei tơdrong juăt Inh na yak kiơ̆ tơdrong noh, Inh jing Kră Yang lu iĕm.

English: You shall therefore keep My statutes and My judgments, which if a man does, he shall live by them: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu iĕm athei wei răk tơdrong juăt Inh păng nơ̆r Inh tơtă, bu mă pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong noh, sư gô arih, Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: ‘None of you shall approach anyone who is near of kin to him, to uncover his nakedness: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ ăn minh 'nu lăm lu iĕm năm jê̆ bơngai drŏ-kăn kơtum kơtŏng iĕm kơdih na hưch pơm kư̆ kă, Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: The nakedness of your father or the nakedness of your mother you shall not uncover. She is your mother; you shall not uncover her nakedness.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơm pơ'brơh kơ 'bă ih, hưch pơm kư̆ kă hăm mĕ ih kơdih, yua kơ bre sư mĕ 'bă ih.

English: The nakedness of your father’s wife you shall not uncover; it is your father’s nakedness.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hưch pơm kư̆ kă hăm akăn 'bă ih; tơdrong noh pơm mơlâu pơ'brơh kơ 'bă ih.

English: The nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father, or the daughter of your mother, whether born at home or elsewhere, their nakedness you shall not uncover.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hưch pơm kư̆ kă kơ mai oh ih kơdih, mă khan pôm 'bă mĕ phara, dah minh pôm mĕ, 'bă phara, mă khan tơpŭ lăm hnam dah tơpŭ phara hnam.

English: The nakedness of your son’s daughter or your daughter’s daughter, their nakedness you shall not uncover; for theirs is your own nakedness.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hưch pơm kư̆ kă hăm mon drŏ-kăn ih, mă khan mon gah mĕ dah gah 'bă, mưh ih hưch pơm kư̆ kă noh pơm mơlâu pơ'brơh kơdih akâu.

English: The nakedness of your father’s wife’s daughter, begotten by your father—she is your sister—you shall not uncover her nakedness.
