Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hưch pơm kư̆ kă hăm kon adruh akăn 'bă ih, đơ̆ng 'bă ih pơjing, yua kơ sư jing mai oh ih kơdih.

English: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s sister; she is near of kin to your father.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hưch pơm kư̆ kă hăm duch nă gah 'bă, yua kơ sư jing mai oh 'bă ih.

English: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister, for she is near of kin to your mother.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hưch pơm kư̆ kă hăm duch nă gah mĕ, yua kơ sư jing mai oh mĕ ih.

English: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s brother. You shall not approach his wife; she is your aunt.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hưch pơm kư̆ kă hăm akăn mih dah ma ih, wă khan akăn lu sư; yua kơ sư jing duch nă mĕ tơm ih.

English: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law—she is your son’s wife—you shall not uncover her nakedness.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hưch pơm kư̆ kă hăm mŏ mai ih; yua kơ sư jing akăn kon drŏ-nglo ih, 'nĕ hưch kơ sư.

English: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your brother’s wife; it is your brother’s nakedness.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hưch pơm kư̆ kă hăm mi dah duch; yua kơ sư akăn 'nhŏng păng oh ih.

English: You shall not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter, nor shall you take her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter, to uncover her nakedness. They are near of kin to her. It is wickedness.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hưch pơm kư̆ kă hăm minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn păng kon adruh sư. Kŭm 'nĕ hưch kơ sâu drŏ-kăn gah kon drŏ-nglo dah hưch kơ sâu drŏ-kăn gah kon drŏ-kăn sư. Lu sư noh jing adrĕch adrung sư jê̆ dêh; pơm thoi noh kơnê̆ tơpă.

English: Nor shall you take a woman as a rival to her sister, to uncover her nakedness while the other is alive.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ iŏk mŏ mai dah oh akăn ih, wă plah tơgar iŏk hưch pơm kư̆ kă, kơplah akăn ih oei arih.

English: ‘Also you shall not approach a woman to uncover her nakedness as long as she is in her customary impurity.
Bahnar: Kơplah drŏ-kăn oei 'bôh jơ̆ng 'nĕ kơ năm jê̆ na 'bĭch hăm sư.

English: Moreover you shall not lie carnally with your neighbor’s wife, to defile yourself with her.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ 'bĭch hăm akăn rông 'bôt ih, kơnh pơm kơ ih jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach ih hăm sư.

English: And you shall not let any of your descendants pass through the fire to Molech, nor shall you profane the name of your God: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơyơ̆ra kon hơ'lơ̆p ih kơ yang Mơlŏk, b 'nĕ kơ pơm 'mê̆-'mach kơ anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, inh bơih Kră Yang.

English: You shall not lie with a male as with a woman. It is an abomination.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ 'bĭch pơm tơduă drŏ-nglo, thoi 'bĭch hăm bơngai drŏ-kăn;c tơdrong noh jing tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hil mĭl dêh.

English: Nor shall you mate with any animal, to defile yourself with it. Nor shall any woman stand before an animal to mate with it. It is perversion.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ 'bĭch pơm kư̆ kă hăm kon sem brem. Na pơm kơdih akâu 'mê̆-'mach hăm sư, bơngai drŏ-kăn kư̆m 'nĕ ăn akâu sư kơ kon sem brem wă 'bĭch pơm kư̆ kă hăm sư; noh jing minh tơdrong pơm kơnê̆ dêh.

English: ‘Do not defile yourselves with any of these things; for by all these the nations are defiled, which I am casting out before you.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơm minh tơdrong kiơ lăm dôm tơdrong noh na pơm kơ akâu iĕm kơdih jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, lu kon pơlei mă Inh puh tơweh đơ̆ng anăp măt lu iĕm, lu sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach bơih.

English: For the land is defiled; therefore I visit the punishment of its iniquity upon it, and the land vomits out its inhabitants.
Bahnar: Teh âu, yua kơ lu sư na kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach boih, Inh gô phak tơdrong kơnê̆ lu sư, teh gô hăk tơlĕch lê̆ kon pơlei sư.

English: You shall therefore keep My statutes and My judgments, and shall not commit any of these abominations, either any of your own nation or any stranger who dwells among you
Bahnar: Gah lu iĕm, kon pơlei kơtă dah đơ̆ng tơmoi oei hơdai lu iĕm, athei bơwei răk khôi juăt păng nơ̆r Inh tơtă 'nĕ kơ pơm minh tơdrong kơnê̆ chư̆ tơdrong mă Inh areh

English: (for all these abominations the men of the land have done, who were before you, and thus the land is defiled)
Bahnar: yua kơ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆ brư̆ Inh areh noh, lu bơngai oei lăm char âu hlôi pơm, lu bơngai mă oei adrol kơ lu iĕm, yua kơ thoi noh na char âu jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach boih

English: lest the land vomit you out also when you defile it, as it vomited out the nations that were before you.
Bahnar: thoi noh 'nĕ pơm kơ teh đak jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, kơnh hli kơ teh đak gô hăk tơlĕch lê̆ lu iĕm, thoi đei hăk lê̆ bơih kon pơlei mă oei tơ lăm char âu adrol kơ lu iĕm.

English: For whoever commits any of these abominations, the persons who commit them shall be cut off from among their people.
Bahnar: Yua kơ adrĕch bu pơm minh lăm dôm lu tơdrong kơnê̆ mă Inh areh noh, đe gô puh tơweh sư lĕch đơ̆ng kon pơlei lu sư.

English: ‘Therefore you shall keep My ordinance, so that you do not commit any of these abominable customs which were committed before you, and that you do not defile yourselves by them: I am the LORD your God.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu iĕm athei wei răk bĕ tơdrong Inh tơtă, 'nĕ kơ pơm ôh minh lăm tơdrong juăt kơnê̆ mă Inh areh âu, mă lu oei adrol kơ iĕm lu sư pơm boih păng lu iĕm 'nĕ yua tơdrong kơnê̆ noh na pơm kơ iĕm jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to all the congregation of the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘You shall be holy, for I the LORD your God am holy.
Bahnar: Roi tơbăt ăn bĕ kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael khŭl akŭm, lu iĕm athei oei sa mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh bĕ, yua kơ Inh Kră Yang lu iĕm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: ‘Every one of you shall revere his mother and his father, and keep My Sabbaths: I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu lu iĕm athei lui yom kơ mĕ 'bă păng răk năr Sa'bat Inh, Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: ‘Do not turn to idols, nor make for yourselves molded gods: I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ man rup yang păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ tuh hling pơm rup yang, Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: ‘And if you offer a sacrifice of a peace offering to the LORD, you shall offer it of your own free will.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê kơ Kră Yang, lu iĕm pơyơ̆r thoi yơ trŏ lăp na Inh iŏk.

English: It shall be eaten the same day you offer it, and on the next day. And if any remains until the third day, it shall be burned in the fire.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei sa lăm năr iĕm pơyơ̆r noh, dah năr dơning đĕch; lu tơmam mă rơkah truh năr mă pêng athei tuh soh lê̆ tơ ŭnh.

English: And if it is eaten at all on the third day, it is an abomination. It shall not be accepted.
Bahnar: Tơdah đe sa 'nhĕm 'măn truh kơ năr mă pêng noh jơ̆ minh tơdrong kơnê̆ Inh Kră Yang areh dêh; ưh kơ iŏk ôh.

English: Therefore everyone who eats it shall bear his iniquity, because he has profaned the hallowed offering of the LORD; and that person shall be cut off from his people.
Bahnar: Bu sa tơmam soi thoi noh gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong yoch sư kơdih, yua kơ sư pơm 'mê̆-'mach kơ tơmam rơgoh 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang bơngai noh; đe gô puh tơlĕch đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla sư.

English: ‘When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not wholly reap the corners of your field, nor shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm kĕch yuă 'ba lăm tơring iĕm, 'nĕ kơ yuă truh tơ tôch mum chŭn. Păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ chă dônh mok lu ba oei đei.

English: And you shall not glean your vineyard, nor shall you gather every grape of your vineyard; you shall leave them for the poor and the stranger: I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m 'nĕ kơ phĕ hơlơ̆k plei hơmu 'bar wơ̆t, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ dônh lu plei hơmu đêl huŏng, iĕm athei lê̆ kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin păng bơngai tơmoi 'bĭch ngôi dônh. Inh boih Kră Yang lu iĕm.

English: ‘You shall not steal, nor deal falsely, nor lie to one another.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kư̆m 'nĕ kơ tơtông, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ pơhlŭ hơlĕnh 'nĕ kơ chă plêl pơdăr kơ đe.

English: And you shall not swear by My name falsely, nor shall you profane the name of your God: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ yua anăn Inh na pơkă hơlĕnh, yua kơ ih pơm kơnê̆ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: ‘You shall not cheat your neighbor, nor rob him. The wages of him who is hired shall not remain with you all night until morning.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơjăm pơjuă bơngai oei cheng pleh kơ ih, 'nĕ kơ tơtông tơgar tơmam lu sư. Tơmam apah bơngai jang kơ iĕm, 'nĕ kơ wei lê̆ tơ hnam iĕm truh tơnăr dơning.

English: You shall not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling block before the blind, but shall fear your God: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hiap bơngai klĭk, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ dan lê̆ tơmam kiơ 'bơ̆t anăp bơngai măt tol, wă pơm kơ sư kơtơih pơ̆k, ih athei hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, Inh bơih Kră Yang.

English: ‘You shall do no injustice in judgment. You shall not be partial to the poor, nor honor the person of the mighty. In righteousness you shall judge your neighbor.
Bahnar: Lăm iĕm sek tơlang 'nĕ kơ pơm glăi tơdrong tơpăt. 'Nĕ kơ mơ̆t bơngai dơnuh hin dah bơngai pơm yŏng tih ôh, na athei sek tơlang tơpăt kơ bơngai rông 'bôt bơ̆n.

English: You shall not go about as a talebearer among your people; nor shall you take a stand against the life of your neighbor: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ roi sa pơma 'bơm, 'nĕ chă tơdrong wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ rông 'bôt ih, Inh bơih Kră Yang.

English: ‘You shall not hate your brother in your heart. You shall surely rebuke your neighbor, and not bear sin because of him.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ đei jơhngơ̆m areh arĕnh kơ 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n, athei bơtho pơlung rông 'bôt ih, 'nĕ kơ ăn kơdih akâu puh yoch yua kơ lu sư pơm glăi.

English: You shall not take vengeance, nor bear any grudge against the children of your people, but you shall love your neighbor as yourself: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơm 'mong răk rong mong găr hăm rông 'bôt kơtum kơtŏng 'nhŏng oh ih, athei 'mêm kơ lu sư thoi ih 'mêm akâu ih kơdih, Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: ‘You shall keep My statutes. You shall not let your livestock breed with another kind. You shall not sow your field with mixed seed. Nor shall a garment of mixed linen and wool come upon you.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei bơwei răk nơ̆r Inh tơtă, 'nĕ kơ ăn kon sem dơrong phara adrĕch tơkiơ̆ băl, 'nĕ kơ rei lăm chŭn ih 'bar tŏ anăn adrĕch păng 'nĕ kơ hrŭk ao đe tanh hăm lơ brai phara.

English: ‘Whoever lies carnally with a woman who is betrothed to a man as a concubine, and who has not at all been redeemed nor given her freedom, for this there shall be scourging; but they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo 'bĭch hăm minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn đĭch, mă hơkơ̆t bơih hăm minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo nai, mă-lei đe tam mă huai răt iŏk sư dah pơklaih sư rơngei đơ̆ng đĭch, na đe gô sek tơlang kơ măr sư, mă-lei ưh kơ truh kơ pơlôch ôh, yua kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn tam mă rơngei đơ̆ng đĭch.

English: And he shall bring his trespass offering to the LORD, to the door of the tabernacle of meeting, a ram as a trespass offering.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong yoch sư bơngai drŏ-nglo athei năm ba minh pôm triu tơno pơyơ̆r tơ anăp Kră Yang, tơ 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm, na pơm tơmam soi sơmah huai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.

English: The priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before the LORD for his sin which he has committed. And the sin which he has committed shall be forgiven him.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô iŏk triu tơno noh pơm tơmam soi wă kơ goh đơ̆ng tơdrong hơch 'bơm pơm yoch, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang wă soi sơmah ăn kơ bơngai mă đêl pơm glăi noh, thoi noh tơdrong yoch sư gơh mơnat ăn.

English: ‘When you come into the land, and have planted all kinds of trees for food, then you shall count their fruit as uncircumcised. Three years it shall be as uncircumcised to you. It shall not be eaten.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm mơ̆t bơih lăm char Kanaan păng đei pơtăm boih lu plei 'long sa iĕm athei lăng lu plei noh ưh kơ rơgoh;a lăm pêng sơnăm đe khă lu iĕm, 'nĕ kơ sa plei noh ôh.

English: But in the fourth year all its fruit shall be holy, a praise to the LORD.
Bahnar: Mă-lei truh kơ sơnăm mă puăn, lu plei noh jing rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, jing tơmam pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang.

English: And in the fifth year you may eat its fruit, that it may yield to you its increase: I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Truh lăm sơnăm mă pơđăm lu iĕm gơh sa plei noh, wă kơ plei rai lơ hloh ăn kơ iĕm, inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: ‘You shall not eat anything with the blood, nor shall you practice divination or soothsaying.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ sa 'nhĕm mă oei đei pham, 'nĕ kơ pơm pơjâu chă tơwir lăng tơdra.

English: You shall not shave around the sides of your head, nor shall you disfigure the edges of your beard.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ yuă sŏk klĕng păng 'nĕ kơ yuă sŏk kang ôh.

English: You shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor tattoo any marks on you: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Kơplah bơngai lôch iĕm 'nĕ kơ 'bet akâu, 'nĕ kơ chhơ̆ săm akâu iĕm, Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: ‘Do not prostitute your daughter, to cause her to be a harlot, lest the land fall into harlotry, and the land become full of wickedness.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ kon adruh ih, 'nĕ kơ lê̆ sư pơm đi kư̆ kă, kơnh lăm tơring bơ̆n jing pơm đi păng 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: ‘You shall keep My Sabbaths and reverence My sanctuary: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei bơwei năr Sa'bat păng pơyom kơ Anih 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Inh, Inh boih Kră Yang lu iĕm.

English: ‘Give no regard to mediums and familiar spirits; do not seek after them, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ năm tơ lu bơngai mă juăt kơ pơma hăm yang kơnê̆ dah lu pơjâu, 'nĕ kơ chă apinh lu sư ôh kơnh pơm kơ iĕm jing kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lu sư, Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: ‘You shall rise before the gray headed and honor the presence of an old man, and fear your God: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei iung dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp bơngai sŏk ko, lu iĕm athei pơyom kơ bơngai kră păng hli yom kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: ‘And if a stranger dwells with you in your land, you shall not mistreat him.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai tơmoi oei hơdai lăm tơring lu iĕm, 'nĕ kơ pơjuă pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư.

English: The stranger who dwells among you shall be to you as one born among you, and you shall love him as yourself; for you were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Bơngai tơmoi mă chă oei pơdơh hơdai lu iĕm, athei lăng sư thoi kon pơlei iĕm kơdih. Athei 'mêm kơ lu sư thoi iĕm 'mêm akâu kơdih; yua kơ lu iĕm kư̆m đêl jing bơngai tơmoi oei tơ char Êyiptơ sơ̆. Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: ‘You shall do no injustice in judgment, in measurement of length, weight, or volume.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơm glăi kơplah iĕm đei sek tơlang kơ đe, dah hơgăt tơdrong kiơ kơjung dah kơđeh, 'lơ̆ng dah kơnê̆, trăp dah hơiơch.

English: You shall have honest scales, honest weights, an honest ephah, and an honest hin: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei đei 'long kŏng tơpăt, plei kŏng athei trŏ, athei trŏ kơ êphab păng trŏ kơ hnŏng (Hin)c tơpă, Inh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, tơ'ngla mă chông anhăk iĕm đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ.

English: ‘Therefore you shall observe all My statutes and all My judgments, and perform them: I am the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu iĕm athei bơwei răk pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong juăt Inh păng nơ̆r Inh tơtă, Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Again, you shall say to the children of Israel: ‘Whoever of the children of Israel, or of the strangers who dwell in Israel, who gives any of his descendants to Molech, he shall surely be put to death. The people of the land shall stone him with stones.
Bahnar: Ih athei khan kơ kon pơlei Isơrael. Tơdah bơngai bu lăm kon pơlei Isơrael dah bơngai tơmoi oei lăm char Isơrael jao minh 'nu kon hơ'lơ̆p sư ăn kơ yang Mơlŏk, a bơngai noh đe gô pơlôch sư, kon pơlei lăm char noh gô klơ̆m pơlôch sư hăm tơmo.

English: I will set My face against that man, and will cut him off from his people, because he has given some of his descendants to Molech, to defile My sanctuary and profane My holy name.
Bahnar: Inh kơdih gô hil mĭl kơ bơngai noh păng pơtôch lê̆ sư đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla sư, yua kơ sư jao kon hơ'lơ̆p sư kơ yang Mơlŏk, pơm kơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach păng pơ'mê̆ kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh.

English: And if the people of the land should in any way hide their eyes from the man, when he gives some of his descendants to Molech, and they do not kill him
Bahnar: Tơdah kon pơlei lăm char âu đơ̆p muh măt sư ưh kơ wă lăng dah ưh kơ pơlôch bơngai noh, kơplah bơngai noh jao kon hơ'lơ̆p sư kơ yang Mơlŏk

English: then I will set My face against that man and against his family; and I will cut him off from his people, and all who prostitute themselves with him to commit harlotry with Molech.
Bahnar: thoi noh Inh gô hil mĭl kơ bơngai noh păng hnam dơnŏ sư păng puh tơweh lê̆ sư păng lu bơngai mă kiơ̆ sư đei pơm pơyô ngôi kư̆ kă hăm yang Mơlŏk

English: ‘And the person who turns to mediums and familiar spirits, to prostitute himself with them, I will set My face against that person and cut him off from his people.
Bahnar: Tơdah bu năm lăng tơ pơjâu păng bơngai pơma hăm yang kơnê̆ lui kiơ̆ na pơm pơyô ngôi kư̆ kă hăm lu sư, Inh gô hil mĭl kơ bơngai noh păng gô puh tơweh sư lĕch đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla sư.

English: Consecrate yourselves therefore, and be holy, for I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei wei akâu iĕm jing 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, yua kơ Inh jơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: And you shall keep My statutes, and perform them: I am the LORD who sanctifies you.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei bơwei pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Inh, Inh boih Kră Yang Tơ'ngla mă pơm kơ lu iĕm jing rơgoh.

English: ‘For everyone who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death. He has cursed his father or his mother. His blood shall be upon him.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu blei hiap mĕ dah 'bă sư đe gô pơlôch. Sư hiap boih mĕ 'bă sư na pham sư gô tuh tơ sư kơdih.

English: ‘The man who commits adultery with another man’s wife, he who commits adultery with his neighbor’s wife, the adulterer and the adulteress, shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu pơm kư̆ kă hưch kơ akăn đe dah pơm kư̆ kă hưch kơ akăn rông 'bôt, bre sư noh đe gô pơlôch sư.

English: The man who lies with his father’s wife has uncovered his father’s nakedness; both of them shall surely be put to death. Their blood shall be upon them.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu mă 'bĭch hăm akăn 'bă sư kơdih, noh jơ̆ pơm mơlâu pơ'brơh kơ 'bă sư. Bre sư pơm kư̆ kă noh đe gô pơlôch đĭ, pham lu sư gô tuh tơ kơ̆l lu sư kơdih.

English: If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall surely be put to death. They have committed perversion. Their blood shall be upon them.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu 'bĭch hăm mŏ mai sư kơdih đĭ kơ măr sư noh đe gô pơlôch, yua kơ măr sư pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ hơgăm dêh, pham lu sư gô tuh tơ lu sư kơdih.

English: If a man lies with a male as he lies with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination. They shall surely be put to death. Their blood shall be upon them.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai drŏ-nglo 'bĭch pơm kư̆ kă hăm tơduă bơngai drŏ-nglo thoi 'bĭch pơm kư̆ kă hăm bơngai drŏ-kăn, 'bar 'nu bre sư đe gô pơlôch đĭ. Yua kơ pơm boih tơdrong kơnê̆ mă Inh hil mĭl krưp dêh, pham lu sư gô tuh tơ lu sư kơdih.

English: If a man marries a woman and her mother, it is wickedness. They shall be burned with fire, both he and they, that there may be no wickedness among you.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo iŏk bre mĕ kon na pơm akăn, noh jing tơdrong kơnê̆ chư̆ dêh; đe gô soh pơđĭ pêng 'nu lu sư, wă kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ chư̆ noh huay pă đei lăm lu iĕm.

English: If a man mates with an animal, he shall surely be put to death, and you shall kill the animal.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai drŏ-nglo pơm kư̆ kă hăm kon sem brem, đe gô pơlôch sư; na iĕm kư̆m athei pơlôch kon sem brem noh mơ̆n.

English: If a woman approaches any animal and mates with it, you shall kill the woman and the animal. They shall surely be put to death. Their blood is upon them.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai drŏ-kăn năm 'bĭch pơm kư̆ kă hăm kon sem brem ih athei pơlôch lê̆ bơngai drŏ-kăn hăm kon sem brem noh hloi. Pham lu sư gô tuh tơ lu sư kơdih.

English: ‘If a man takes his sister, his father’s daughter or his mother’s daughter, and sees her nakedness and she sees his nakedness, it is a wicked thing. And they shall be cut off in the sight of their people. He has uncovered his sister’s nakedness. He shall bear his guilt.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo, iŏk mŏ dah oh sư kơdih minh pôm 'bă, na mĕ phara dah pôm mĕ na 'bă pha, na sư ngôi kư̆ kă, noh jing tơdrong kơnê̆ pơm kư̆ kă đe gô puh tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng anăp kon pơlei lu sư, bơngai pơm kơnê̆, pơ'brơh kơ mŏ oh sư, sư gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong glăi kơnê̆ sư.

English: If a man lies with a woman during her sickness and uncovers her nakedness, he has exposed her flow, and she has uncovered the flow of her blood. Both of them shall be cut off from their people.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai drŏ-nglo 'bĭch hăm bơngai drŏ-kăn kơplah oei 'bôh jơ̆ng; bơngai drŏ-nglo pơm kơ pham bơngai drŏ-kăn lĕch, na bơngai drŏ-kăn tơlĕch pham sư kơdih, 'bar 'nu sư noh, đe gô puh tơlĕch weh đơ̆ng kon pơlei lu sư.

English: ‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister nor of your father’s sister, for that would uncover his near of kin. They shall bear their guilt.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ hưch pơm kư̆ kă hăm mai oh gah mĕ dah mai oh gah 'bă ih, yua kơ tơdrong noh pơm mơlâu pơ'mê̆ kơ adrĕch adrung jê̆ bơ̆n; 'bar 'nu bre noh gô pŭ tơdrong glăi sư.

English: If a man lies with his uncle’s wife, he has uncovered his uncle’s nakedness. They shall bear their sin; they shall die childless.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu drŏ-nglo 'bĭch hăm duch akăn ma, nă akăn mih sư kơdih, noh jơ̆ pơm pơ'brơh kơ mih ma sư, bre sư noh gô pŭ tơdrong kơnê̆ sư, măr sư gô lôch ưh kơ đei kon ôh.

English: If a man takes his brother’s wife, it is an unclean thing. He has uncovered his brother’s nakedness. They shall be childless.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo hưch kơ akăn 'nhŏng oh sư kơdih, noh jơ̆ tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach. Bơngai noh pơm kơnê̆ kơ 'nhŏng oh sư kơdih, bre sư gô ưh kơ đei kon ôh.

English: ‘You shall therefore keep all My statutes and all My judgments, and perform them, that the land where I am bringing you to dwell may not vomit you out.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei bơwei pơm kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong juăt Inh păng nơ̆r Inh tơtă păng pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong noh; wă kơ tơring char Inh ăn kơ iĕm oei huay kơ hăk tơlĕch tŭk iĕm.

English: And you shall not walk in the statutes of the nation which I am casting out before you; for they commit all these things, and therefore I abhor them.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt lu kon pơlei mă Inh gô puh tơweh sư đơ̆ng anăp lu iĕm; yua kơ lu sư pơm dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ noh na Inh hil mĭl dêh kơ lu sư tơpă.

English: But I have said to you, “You shall inherit their land, and I will give it to you to possess, a land flowing with milk and honey.” I am the LORD your God, who has separated you from the peoples.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ lu iĕm, lu iĕm gô iŏk teh đêl lu sư oei, Inh ăn kơ lu iĕm đei teh noh, wă pơm tơmam iĕm kơdih, noh jơ̆ teh đak toh, đak sut kơdrot, Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, plah iŏk lu iĕm đơ̆ng kon pơlei nai.

English: You shall therefore distinguish between clean animals and unclean, between unclean birds and clean, and you shall not make yourselves abominable by beast or by bird, or by any kind of living thing that creeps on the ground, which I have separated from you as unclean.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu iĕm athei jô̆ klah phara lu kon sem brem rơgoh păng kon sem brem ưh kơ rơgoh, lu sem păr rơgoh păng sem păr ưh kơ rơgoh, 'nĕ kơ pơm kơ iĕm kơdih jing kơnê̆ na Inh hil areh, yua kơ kon sem brem, sem păr, 'bih kơep lep-ler, tơmam mă Inh đei jô̆ phara lu sư jing kơnê̆.

English: And you shall be holy to Me, for I the LORD am holy, and have separated you from the peoples, that you should be Mine.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ lu iĕm arih hăm Inh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, Inh klah lu iĕm bơih đơ̆ng kon pơlei âu, wă kơ lu iĕm jing khŭl kon pơlei gah Inh.

English: ‘A man or a woman who is a medium, or who has familiar spirits, shall surely be put to death; they shall stone them with stones. Their blood shall be upon them.’ ”
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-nglo dah drŏ-kăn pơm pơjâu dah pơm pơma hăm yang kơnê̆, đe gô pơlôch sư, klơ̆m sư păng tơmo, pham lu sư gô tuh tơ lu sư kơdih.

English: And the LORD said to Moses, “Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them: ‘None shall defile himself for the dead among his people
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis, khan bĕ kơ lu 'bok soi kon drŏ-nglo Arôn, lu sư 'nĕ kơ hơtŭt 'bơm akâu lăm lu kon pơlei sư lôch, kơnh pơm kơ lu sư kơdih jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: except for his relatives who are nearest to him: his mother, his father, his son, his daughter, and his brother
Bahnar: Lăp pôm kơtum kơtŏng 'nhŏng oh sư jê̆ dêh đĕch, pơtih thoi mĕ sư, 'bă sư, kon drŏ-nglo sư, kon drŏ-kăn sư

English: also his virgin sister who is near to him, who has had no husband, for her he may defile himself.
Bahnar: dah mai oh sư oei adruh hơlai tam mă đei klo; lei huay kơ pơm kơ sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: Otherwise he shall not defile himself, being a chief man among his people, to profane himself.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi 'nĕ pơm kơdih akâu sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach đơ̆ng lu adrĕch adrung sư oei chă klo kăn nai pơyoch sư kơdih.a

English: ‘They shall not make any bald place on their heads, nor shall they shave the edges of their beards nor make any cuttings in their flesh.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi ưh kơ gơh hơkôih sŏk kơ̆l pơm kơ sư jing kơ̆l 'ngôch, 'nĕ kơ hơkôih sŏk kang sư kơdih kư̆m 'nĕ kơ 'bet akâu sư kơdih mơ̆n.

English: They shall be holy to their God and not profane the name of their God, for they offer the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and the bread of their God; therefore they shall be holy.
Bahnar: Lu sư athei arih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'nĕ kơ pơm mơgrĭ kơ Anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư; yua kơ lu sư pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang dôm tơmam pơyơ̆r soh hăm ŭnh, wă khan pơyơ̆r 'bĕng tơmam sa kơ Kră Yang, yua kơ noh lu sư jing 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: They shall not take a wife who is a harlot or a defiled woman, nor shall they take a woman divorced from her husband; for the priest is holy to his God.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi ưh kơ gơh ôh oei kơ drŏ-kăn đi, dah drŏ-kăn kơnê̆ bơih; kư̆m ưh kơ gơh oei kơ drŏ-kăn đêl klo sư achăng; yua kơ 'bok soi bơngai 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: Therefore you shall consecrate him, for he offers the bread of your God. He shall be holy to you, for I the LORD, who sanctify you, am holy.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih athei lăng jô̆ sư 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, yua kơ sư pơyơ̆r 'bĕng tơmam sa kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih. Sư jing rơgoh 'lơ̆ng kơ Inh; yua kơ Inh Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng rơgoh. Tơ'ngla mă pơm kơ lu iĕm jing rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: The daughter of any priest, if she profanes herself by playing the harlot, she profanes her father. She shall be burned with fire.
Bahnar: Tơdah kon adruh 'bok soi ngôi kư̆ kă, noh jơ̆ pơm kơnê̆ kơ anăn 'bă sư, na đe gô soh sư lăm ŭnh.

English: ‘He who is the high priest among his brethren, on whose head the anointing oil was poured and who is consecrated to wear the garments, shall not uncover his head nor tear his clothes
Bahnar: 'Bok soi tơm jing kră tơm hloh lăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư, đêl đei tuh đak rơmă bơih tơ kơ̆l sư, đe pôk sư gơh hrŭk ao rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, na kơ̆l sư ưh kơ lê̆ ôh sŏk ưh kơ păi, b kư̆m ưh kơ hek lê̆ ao sư mơ̆n.

English: nor shall he go near any dead body, nor defile himself for his father or his mother
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ bơngai lôch ôh, mă 'bă sư, dah mĕ sư lôch wă pơm kơ sư jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.

English: nor shall he go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God; for the consecration of the anointing oil of his God is upon him: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m ưh kơ gơh weh đơ̆ng anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ôh dah pơm mơgrĭ kơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư kơdih jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, yua kơ đak 'bâu phu thoi hơgăl đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe tuh oei đei tơ kơ̆l sư, Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: And he shall take a wife in her virginity.
Bahnar: Sư athei oei kơ drŏ-kăn hơlai oei plơ̆ng.

English: A widow or a divorced woman or a defiled woman or a harlot—these he shall not marry; but he shall take a virgin of his own people as wife.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ gơh oei kơ drŏ-kăn adro, drŏ-kăn klo sư hrĕch, drŏ-kăn ngôi kư̆ kă pơm đi; mă-lei athei oei kơ drŏ-kăn hơlai oei plơ̆ng đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei sư kơdih

English: Nor shall he profane his posterity among his people, for I the LORD sanctify him.’ ”
Bahnar: wă kơ sư ưh kơ gơh pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach kơ kon sâu sư lăm kon pơlei pơla sư, yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang pơm kơ sư jing rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to Aaron, saying: ‘No man of your descendants in succeeding generations, who has any defect, may approach to offer the bread of his God.
Bahnar: athei khan bĕ kơ Arôn. Ưh kơ đei bu lăm kon hơ'lơ̆p ih lăm chăl arih sư đei tơdrong jĭ jăn ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh.

English: For any man who has a defect shall not approach: a man blind or lame, who has a marred face or any limb too long
Bahnar: Yua kơ ưh kơ đei bơngai bu mă jĭ jăn gơh năm jê̆ tơ bơsŭn, bơngai măt tol, jopo, muh măt cheng chong dah jơ̆ng sư kơjung kơđeh.

English: a man who has a broken foot or broken hand
Bahnar: Bơngai tơgơ̆ ti dah tơgơ̆ jơ̆ng

English: or is a hunchback or a dwarf, or a man who has a defect in his eye, or eczema or scab, or is a eunuch.
Bahnar: bơngai kơdŭ grŏn, kơđeh hnang dah jĭ măt, tơ'boch roch, jĭ lak, bŏng sư pơchah minh pôm.

English: No man of the descendants of Aaron the priest, who has a defect, shall come near to offer the offerings made by fire to the LORD. He has a defect; he shall not come near to offer the bread of his God.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu lăm kon drŏ-nglo Arôn 'bok soi tơm đei tơdrong jĭ jăn lăm akâu sư ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang; tơdah đei jĭ jăn lăm akâu ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ wă pơyơ̆r 'bĕng tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư.

English: He may eat the bread of his God, both the most holy and the holy
Bahnar: Sư gơh sa tơmam sa Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư, mă tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh hloh păng tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: only he shall not go near the veil or approach the altar, because he has a defect, lest he profane My sanctuaries; for I the LORD sanctify them.’ ”
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ che pĕng, kư̆m ưh kơ gơh năm jê̆ chơnang soi, yua kơ akâu đei jĭ jăn wă kơ sư huay kơ pơm kơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach; yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang, pơm kơ lu sư noh jing rơgoh.

English: And Moses told it to Aaron and his sons, and to all the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Môis pơma thoi noh kơ Arôn păng kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to Aaron and his sons, that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, and that they do not profane My holy name by what they dedicate to Me: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, wă kơ lu sư kơchăng pơm mă 'lơ̆ng lu tơmam pơyơ̆r kon pơlei Isơrael, mă đei 'măn pơyơ̆r pơm rơgoh ăn kơ Inh, wă kơ lu sư huay kơ pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh, Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: Say to them: ‘Whoever of all your descendants throughout your generations, who goes near the holy things which the children of Israel dedicate to the LORD, while he has uncleanness upon him, that person shall be cut off from My presence: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ lu sư. Tơdah đei bu lăm lu kon sâu iĕm lăm đĭ chăl arih lu iĕm năm jê̆ lu tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh mă kon pơlei Isơrael pơyơ̆r 'măn lê̆ kơ Kră Yang, na bơngai noh sư đei tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, đe gô puh tơlĕch sư weh đơ̆ng anăp Inh, Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: ‘Whatever man of the descendants of Aaron, who is a leper or has a discharge, shall not eat the holy offerings until he is clean. And whoever touches anything made unclean by a corpse, or a man who has had an emission of semen
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu lăm kon drŏ-nglo Arôn jĭ chin dah jĭ lĕch đak kơtăk, ưh kơ gơh sa ôh tơmam đe 'măn lê̆ 'lơ̆ng rơgoh dĭng truh tơ sư rơgoh 'lơ̆ng 'mơ̆i. Tơdah bu đei hơtŭt 'bơm bơngai đei kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach yua kơ 'bơm akâu lôch, dah bơngai đei đak kơtăk lĕch

English: or whoever touches any creeping thing by which he would be made unclean, or any person by whom he would become unclean, whatever his uncleanness may be
Bahnar: tơdah hơtŭt 'bơm hơdrông kơep lep-ler, dah hơtŭt 'bơm minh 'nu bơngai đei tơdrong kơnê̆, pơm kơ sư kư̆m kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach. Mă tôm tơdrong kiơ nai kư̆m kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach lei-lăi.

English: the person who has touched any such thing shall be unclean until evening, and shall not eat the holy offerings unless he washes his body with water.
Bahnar: Bu hơtŭt 'bơm dôm tơmam noh jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach truh kơmăng, ưh kơ gơh sa tơmam đe 'măn lê̆ rơgoh mă-lei đang kơ hum lăm đak.

English: And when the sun goes down he shall be clean; and afterward he may eat the holy offerings, because it is his food.
Bahnar: Đang kơ 'năr mơ̆t bơih, sư jing rơgoh lei na gơh sa tơmam rơgoh yua kơ tơmam noh tơmam sa sư.

English: Whatever dies naturally or is torn by beasts he shall not eat, to defile himself with it: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ gơh sa ôh kon sem bri lôch kơmăp, dah lôch đơ̆ng sem bri kăp, wă kơ sư huay kơ kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: ‘They shall therefore keep My ordinance, lest they bear sin for it and die thereby, if they profane it: I the LORD sanctify them.
Bahnar: Yua kơ noh na sư athei bơwei nơ̆r Inh pơkă, kơnh hli kơ lu sư pŭ tơdrong yoch păng lôch hloi yua kơ đei pơm dôm tơdrong Inh tơtă jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, Inh boih Kră Yang pơm kơ sư jing rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: ‘No outsider shall eat the holy offering; one who dwells with the priest, or a hired servant, shall not eat the holy thing.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai tơmoi ưh kơ gơh sa tơmam rơgoh 'lơ̆ng ôh, bơngai tơmoi chă oei lăm hnam 'bok soi dah bơngai chă jang mưng kơ đe kư̆m ưh kơ gơh sa tơmam rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: But if the priest buys a person with his money, he may eat it; and one who is born in his house may eat his food.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai ayơ mă 'bok soi iŏk jên răt bơih păng lu bơngai mă tơpŭ lăm hnam sư gơh sa tơmam sa sư.

English: If the priest’s daughter is married to an outsider, she may not eat of the holy offerings.
Bahnar: Tơdah kon adruh 'bok soi chă klo bơngai tơmoi drŏ-kăn noh ưh kơ gơh sa ôh tơmam rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: But if the priest’s daughter is a widow or divorced, and has no child, and has returned to her father’s house as in her youth, she may eat her father’s food; but no outsider shall eat it.
Bahnar: Păng tơdah kon adruh 'bok soi adro, dah klo sư achăng lê̆, ưh kơ đei hơ'lơ̆p ôh, na wih brŏk tơ hnam 'bă sư thoi oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆ lei sư gơh sa tơmam 'bă sư. Mă-lei ưh kơ đei bơngai tơmoi ayơ gơh sa tơmam noh ôh.

English: ‘And if a man eats the holy offering unintentionally, then he shall restore a holy offering to the priest, and add one-fifth to it.
Bahnar: Tơdah bu hơch 'bơm sa tơmam rơgoh 'lơ̆ng, sư athei 'mong ăn kơ 'bok soi đêl sư sa noh păng ăn thim dơ̆ng minh lăm pơđăm kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong gĭt sư, ăn kơ 'bok soi tơmam sa noh.

English: They shall not profane the holy offerings of the children of Israel, which they offer to the LORD
Bahnar: 'Bok soi ưh kơ gơh pơm 'mê̆-'mach kơ tơmam soi mă kon pơlei Isơrael pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: or allow them to bear the guilt of trespass when they eat their holy offerings; for I the LORD sanctify them.’ ”
Bahnar: Bu sa tơmam rơgoh đêl pơyơ̆r thoi noh gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong sư hlôi pơm glăi, yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang pơm kơ lu sư jing rơgoh 'lơ̆ng.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to Aaron and his sons, and to all the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘Whatever man of the house of Israel, or of the strangers in Israel, who offers his sacrifice for any of his vows or for any of his freewill offerings, which they offer to the LORD as a burnt offering
Bahnar: athei khan bĕ kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael, tơdah đei minh 'nu lăm hnam Isơrael dah bơngai tơmoi oei lăm char Isơrael lu sư, ba tơmam soi pơyơ̆r dah tơmam soi pơsĭt tơdrong pơkă dah tơmam soi lăp đon 'maih wă pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang jing tơmam soi 'buh

English: you shall offer of your own free will a male without blemish from the cattle, from the sheep, or from the goats.
Bahnar: wă kơ Inh iŏk athei pơyơ̆r minh pôm rơmo, triu, dah bơbe tơno ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ, rôp đơ̆ng lăm hơdrong.

English: Whatever has a defect, you shall not offer, for it shall not be acceptable on your behalf.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơyơ̆r kon sem dơrong ayơ mă đei jĭ kiơ kiơ, yua kơ tơmam soi noh Inh ưh kơ iŏk ôh.

English: And whoever offers a sacrifice of a peace offering to the LORD, to fulfill his vow, or a freewill offering from the cattle or the sheep, it must be perfect to be accepted; there shall be no defect in it.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê hăm rơmo, triu dah pơyơ̆r pơsĭt tơdrong pơkă dah pơyơ̆r tơmam soi Inh lăp đon. Wă kơ gơh iŏk, tơmam pơyơ̆r noh athei 'lơ̆ng, ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ kiơ.

English: Those that are blind or broken or maimed, or have an ulcer or eczema or scabs, you shall not offer to the LORD, nor make an offering by fire of them on the altar to the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang minh pôm kon sem dơrong ayơ mă măt tol, tơgơ̆ jơ̆ng, rơka, tơ'boch roch jĭ lak, iĕm 'nĕ kơ rôp sư pơm tơmam soi 'buh hăm ŭnh pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang tơ kơpal chơnang soi.

English: Either a bull or a lamb that has any limb too long or too short you may offer as a freewill offering, but for a vow it shall not be accepted.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gơh rôp minh pôm rơmo dah triu đei jơ̆ng kơjung hnang, dah kơđeh hnang wă pơm tơmam soi lăp đon 'maih wă, mă-lei gah tơmam soi pơsĭt tơdrong pơkă, kon sem tơmam soi thoi noh Kră Yang ưh kơ iŏk ôh.

English: ‘You shall not offer to the LORD what is bruised or crushed, or torn or cut; nor shall you make any offering of them in your land.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang lăm char iĕm kơdih minh pôm sem dơrong bŏng sư pơchah, hĕch dah krĕo lê̆.

English: Nor from a foreigner’s hand shall you offer any of these as the bread of your God, because their corruption is in them, and defects are in them. They shall not be accepted on your behalf.’ ”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ iŏk đơ̆ng ti bơngai tơmoi, minh pôm kon sem tơmam soi ayơ mă thoi noh, wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih. Yua kơ akâu sư rơka rơkĕch, Inh ưh kơ iŏk ôh tơmam soi noh.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis.

English: “When a bull or a sheep or a goat is born, it shall be seven days with its mother; and from the eighth day and thereafter it shall be accepted as an offering made by fire to the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơdah, kon rơmo, kon triu, kon bơbe, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư tuh athei oei hơdai mĕ sư lăm tơpơh năr. Mă-lei ưh kơ hloh năr mă tơhngam ôh, iŏk đơ̆ng năr âu tơ anăp Inh gô iŏk sư jing tơmam pơyơ̆r soh hăm ŭnh ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Whether it is a cow or ewe, do not kill both her and her young on the same day.
Bahnar: Mă rơmo akăn dah triu akăn, iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơlôch yŏng păng kon sư lăm minh năr.

English: And when you offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving to the LORD, offer it of your own free will.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê kơ Kră Yang, lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r mă trŏ thoi noh, na Inh iŏk.

English: On the same day it shall be eaten; you shall leave none of it until morning: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Đe gô sa tơmam sa noh lăm năr noh, 'nĕ kơ lê̆ minh kơnăt 'măn kơ năr dơning. Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: “Therefore you shall keep My commandments, and perform them: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu iĕm athei bơwei pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong Inh tơtă, Inh bơih Kră Yang.

English: You shall not profane My holy name, but I will be hallowed among the children of Israel. I am the LORD who sanctifies you
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pơm 'mê̆-'mach kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh, na Inh đei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rơgoh lăm kon pơlei Isơrael, Inh boih Kră Yang Tơ'ngla pơm kơ iĕm jing rơgoh.

English: who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the LORD.”
Bahnar: Wă khan Tơ'ngla chông anhăk ba iĕm đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ, wă kơ Inh pơm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘The feasts of the LORD, which you shall proclaim to be holy convocations, these are My feasts.
Bahnar: Athei roi bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael: 'Nâu năr pơm giĕng tih đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm đei pơkă jing năr akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh.

English: ‘Six days shall work be done, but the seventh day is a Sabbath of solemn rest, a holy convocation. You shall do no work on it; it is the Sabbath of the LORD in all your dwellings.
Bahnar: Đe gô bơ̆jang lăm tơdrâu năr; mă-lei năr tơpơh, noh năr Sa'bat, năr đe pơdơh wă khan năr akŭm kơkuh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh. 'Nĕ kơ bơ̆jang kiơ; noh năr Sa'bat kơ Kră Yang tơ lăm jơ̆p-jang anih lu iĕm.

English: ‘These are the feasts of the LORD, holy convocations which you shall proclaim at their appointed times.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu năr Kră Yang pơkă boih, năr akŭm kơkuh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, lu iĕm athei ră roi bĕ kơ đe mưh truh năr mă đei pơkă bơih.

English: On the fourteenth day of the first month at twilight is the LORD’s Passover.
Bahnar: Truh năr mơjĭt-puăn khei mônh, kơplah til kơsơ̆ măng noh năr giĕng Năm Brih Kră Yang.a

English: And on the fifteenth day of the same month is the Feast of Unleavened Bread to the LORD; seven days you must eat unleavened bread.
Bahnar: Na truh năr mơjĭt-pơđăm khei noh đe pơm giĕng 'Bĕng Ưh Kơ Đei 'Buih Pông. Wă kơkuh pơyom kơ Kră Yang, na lu iĕm gô sa 'bĕng ưh kơ đei 'buih noh lăm tơpơh năr.

English: On the first day you shall have a holy convocation; you shall do no customary work on it.
Bahnar: Năr blŭng-a lu iĕm athei akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, ưh kơ gơh bơ̆jang kiơ kơ sĕch akar.

English: But you shall offer an offering made by fire to the LORD for seven days. The seventh day shall be a holy convocation; you shall do no customary work on it.’ ”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang tơmam soi yua 'buh lăm ŭnh lăm tơpơh năr; truh năr mă tơpơh gô đei tơdrong akŭm kơkuh 'lơ̆ng rơgoh; lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơm minh tơdrong jang kiơ kơ sĕch akar ôh.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When you come into the land which I give to you, and reap its harvest, then you shall bring a sheaf of the firstfruits of your harvest to the priest.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael: Tơdah lu iĕm mơ̆t tơ lăm char mă Inh ăn kơ lu iĕm păng lu iĕm đei kĕch yuă, bơyan 'ba tơ noh, iĕm athei năm ba minh hơchô̆ ba plei blŭng-a ăn kơ 'bok soi.

English: He shall wave the sheaf before the LORD, to be accepted on your behalf; on the day after the Sabbath the priest shall wave it.
Bahnar: Năr đơ̆ng rŏng hlôi kơ năr giĕng Sa'bat, 'bok soi gô pơyơ̆r hơchô̆ ba, ba 'ma 'ngiĕo 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, wă kơ tơdrong pơyơ̆r hơchô̆ 'ba noh Kră Yang iŏk

English: And you shall offer on that day, when you wave the sheaf, a male lamb of the first year, without blemish, as a burnt offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: lăm năr pơyơ̆r hơchô̆ 'ba, mă ba 'ma 'ngiĕo noh lu iĕm kư̆m athei pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang minh pôm kon triu tơ'bưh kơ đêl, ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ, wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh.

English: Its grain offering shall be two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil, an offering made by fire to the LORD, for a sweet aroma; and its drink offering shall be of wine, one-fourth of a hin.
Bahnar: Păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi phe 'ba, dang 'bar lăm mơjĭt êpha tơpŭng, b lŭk hrâu hăm đak rơmă ôliwơ pơm tơmam soi soh hăm ŭnh, pơyơ̆r đei 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ Kră Yang păng pơyơ̆r tơmam huch hai sik plei hơmu, minh lăm puăn hin.c

English: You shall eat neither bread nor parched grain nor fresh grain until the same day that you have brought an offering to your God; it shall be a statute forever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ sa 'bĕng, 'ba hơdrĕng, dah 'ba oei adrih, dĭng truh tơnăr âu, wă khan truh năr mă lu iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang boih. Mă khan tơ anih ayơ, noh boih tơdrong juăt pơkă kơ lu iĕm ling-lang truh tơ kon sâu iĕm.

English: ‘And you shall count for yourselves from the day after the Sabbath, from the day that you brought the sheaf of the wave offering: seven Sabbaths shall be completed.
Bahnar: Iŏk đơ̆ng rŏng năr pơdơh Sa'bat, năr mă lu iĕm chĕp hơchô̆ 'ba pơyơ̆r ba 'ma 'ngiĕo, iĕm athei jô̆ noh tơpơh 'măng giĕng.

English: Count fifty days to the day after the seventh Sabbath; then you shall offer a new grain offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm jô̆ pơđăm-jĭt năr đơ̆ng rŏng kơ năr pơdơh Sa'bat tăl mă tơpơh; kơplah noh iĕm athei pơyơ̆r tơmam phe 'ba hle ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: You shall bring from your dwellings two wave loaves of two-tenths of an ephah. They shall be of fine flour; they shall be baked with leaven. They are the firstfruits to the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei năm ba đơ̆ng hnam iĕm 'bar tŏ 'bĕng wă pơm tơmam soi ba 'ma 'ngiĕo, 'bĕng noh pơm hăm minh lăm mơjĭt êpha tơpŭng, đei 'buih pông pơtŏ tơ ŭnh; 'bĕng noh jing tơmam blŭng-a lăm bơyan pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang.

English: And you shall offer with the bread seven lambs of the first year, without blemish, one young bull, and two rams. They shall be as a burnt offering to the LORD, with their grain offering and their drink offerings, an offering made by fire for a sweet aroma to the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kư̆m athei pơyơ̆r hloi 'bĕng noh hăm tơpơh tŏ triu kon dang minh sơnăm, ưh kơ đei jĭ kiơ, minh pôm kon rơmo tơno păng 'bar tŏ triu tơno hơdai hăm tơmam soi phe 'ba păng tơmam soi huch wă pơm tơmam soi 'buh hăm ŭnh, pơyơ̆r đei 'bâu phu 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then you shall sacrifice one kid of the goats as a sin offering, and two male lambs of the first year as a sacrifice of a peace offering.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r minh pôm bơbe tơno pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch păng 'bar tŏ kon triu đei minh sơnăm wă pơm tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê.

English: The priest shall wave them with the bread of the firstfruits as a wave offering before the LORD, with the two lambs. They shall be holy to the LORD for the priest.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi gô iŏk tơmam soi noh hơdai hăm 'bar tŏ 'bĕng pơm păng 'ba blŭng-a lăm bơyan hơdai hăm 'bar tŏ kon triu na pơyơ̆r ba 'ma 'ngiĕo 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, lu tơmam noh athei 'măn lê̆ rơgoh pha ăn kơ Kră Yang păng gô ăn kơ 'bok soi.

English: And you shall proclaim on the same day that it is a holy convocation to you. You shall do no customary work on it. It shall be a statute forever in all your dwellings throughout your generations.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei roi tơ'băt: Tơdrong akŭm tơm năr noh athei đei tơdrong akŭm rơgoh, ưh kơ gơh kơ bơ̆jang tơdrong sĕch akar. Noh jing tơdrong juăt pơkă ling-lang ăn kơ adrĕch adrung lu iĕm, mă tơ anih yơ yơ lu iĕm oei.

English: ‘When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not wholly reap the corners of your field when you reap, nor shall you gather any gleaning from your harvest. You shall leave them for the poor and for the stranger: I am the LORD your God.’ ”
Bahnar: Tơdah kĕch yuă 'ba lăm tơring iĕm, 'nĕ kơ yuă kĕch truh tơ mum jih kơ mir păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ dônh lu 'ba mă huŏng. Athei 'măn lu 'ba noh kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin păng lu bơngai tơmoi, Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall have a sabbath-rest, a memorial of blowing of trumpets, a holy convocation.
Bahnar: Roi tơ'băt bĕ kơ bơngai Isơrael, lăm năr mônh khei tơpơh, d năr noh lu iĕm gô đei năr pơdơh gĭt găl, wă kơ 'blŏk hơdơ̆r; iĕm athei hlôm keng, na ră roi, năr noh đei tơdrong akŭm rơgoh.

English: You shall do no customary work on it; and you shall offer an offering made by fire to the LORD.’ ”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh bơ̆jang kơ sĕch akar ôh; iĕm athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh hăm ŭnh kơ Kră Yang.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang kư̆m khan kơ Môis

English: “Also the tenth day of this seventh month shall be the Day of Atonement. It shall be a holy convocation for you; you shall afflict your souls, and offer an offering made by fire to the LORD.
Bahnar: Năr mônh khei tơpơh âu jơ̆ năr pơm giĕng huai đơ̆ng yoch; lu iĕm gô đei tơdrong akŭm rơgoh, lu iĕm athei hơdrĭ lăm jơhngơ̆m pơmat akâu iĕm kơdihe păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi yua 'buh hăm ŭnh kơ Kră Yang.

English: And you shall do no work on that same day, for it is the Day of Atonement, to make atonement for you before the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Năr noh 'nĕ kơ jang minh tơdrong kiơ; yua kơ năr noh wă huai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch, lăm năr noh wă pơm rơgoh tơdrong yoch iĕm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: For any person who is not afflicted in soul on that same day shall be cut off from his people.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh bu mă ưh kơ hơdrĭ kơ jơhngơ̆m pơmat akâu sư kơdih đe gô puh tơlĕch sư đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla sư.

English: And any person who does any work on that same day, that person I will destroy from among his people.
Bahnar: Păng tơdah bơngai bu bơ̆jang tơdrong kiơ, lăm năr âu, Inh gô pơrăm sư đơ̆ng lăm kon pơlei pơla sư.

English: You shall do no manner of work; it shall be a statute forever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh jang minh tơdrong kiơ noh jơ̆ khôi juăt pơkă ling-lang ăn kơ adrĕch adrung iĕm jơ̆p-jang mă tơ anih ayơ iĕm oei.

English: It shall be to you a sabbath of solemn rest, and you shall afflict your souls; on the ninth day of the month at evening, from evening to evening, you shall celebrate your sabbath.”
Bahnar: Noh jing minh năr Sa'bat, năr pơdơh ăn kơ lu iĕm, lu iĕm athei hơdrĭ lăm jơhngơ̆m pơmat akâu kơdih; dơ̆ng măng năr tơsĭn lăm khei noh, iĕm athei bơwei năr Sa'bat iĕm, đơ̆ng kơsơ̆ âu truh kơsơ̆ dơning.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘The fifteenth day of this seventh month shall be the Feast of Tabernacles for seven days to the LORD.
Bahnar: Roi khan bĕ kơ bơngai Isơrael, 'bơ̆t năr mơjĭt-pơđăm khei tơpơhf âu, pơm giĕng bơsŭn lăm tơpơh năr wă kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: On the first day there shall be a holy convocation. You shall do no customary work on it.
Bahnar: Năr mă blŭng-a đei tơdrong akŭm rơgoh; lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh bơ̆jang kơ sĕch akar minh tơdrong kiơ ôh.

English: For seven days you shall offer an offering made by fire to the LORD. On the eighth day you shall have a holy convocation, and you shall offer an offering made by fire to the LORD. It is a sacred assembly, and you shall do no customary work on it.
Bahnar: Lăm tơpơh năr noh iĕm athei pơyơ̆r rim năr dôm tơmam soi, yua 'buh hăm ŭnh ăn kơ Kră Yang; truh lăm năr tơhngam lu iĕm đei akŭm rơgoh păng năm ba tơmam pơyơ̆r 'buh hăm ŭnh kơ Kră Yang; noh đei tơdrong akŭm tih pơyom. Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ bơ̆jang kơ sĕch akar minh tơdrong kiơ.

English: ‘These are the feasts of the LORD which you shall proclaim to be holy convocations, to offer an offering made by fire to the LORD, a burnt offering and a grain offering, a sacrifice and drink offerings, everything on its day
Bahnar: Noh jing năr pơm giĕng Kră Yang pơkă bơih, lu iĕm ră roi kơ kon pơlei pơla, noh jing năr akŭm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh wă pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang dôm tơmam soi yua 'buh hăm ŭnh. Tơmam soi 'buh, tơmam soi phe 'ba, tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê, tơmam soi huch, tơmam ayơ đe hơgăt trŏ kơ năr noh.

English: besides the Sabbaths of the LORD, besides your gifts, besides all your vows, and besides all your freewill offerings which you give to the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nguaih kơ bơwei năr pơdơh Sa'bat Kră Yang, lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi iĕm kơdih, lu tơmam soi pơsĭt nơ̆r pơkă păng tơmam soi 'maih wă. Iĕm juăt kơ pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: ‘Also on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the fruit of the land, you shall keep the feast of the LORD for seven days; on the first day there shall be a sabbath-rest, and on the eighth day a sabbath-rest.
Bahnar: Truh năr mơjĭt-pơđăm khei tơpơh, g đang kơ lu iĕm kĕch yuă bơyan hơnê̆ sơnăm iĕm bơih, lu iĕm athei bơwei tơdrong pơm giĕng iĕm lăm tơpơh năr, năr blŭng-a jing năr pơdơh đei tơdrong pơyom păng năr mă tơhngam kư̆m năr pơdơh pơyom.

English: And you shall take for yourselves on the first day the fruit of beautiful trees, branches of palm trees, the boughs of leafy trees, and willows of the brook; and you shall rejoice before the LORD your God for seven days.
Bahnar: Năr mă mônh lu iĕm athei iŏk plei 'long 'lơ̆ng; dơng 'long gol, dơng tih đei hla lơ păng 'long hla prai, na lu iĕm et sa chơt hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm lăm tơpơh năr.

English: You shall keep it as a feast to the LORD for seven days in the year. It shall be a statute forever in your generations. You shall celebrate it in the seventh month.
Bahnar: Rim sơnăm lăm khei tơpơh lu iĕm athei bơwei năr pơdơh Kră Yang âu, lăm tơpơh năr, noh jing khôi juăt pơkă ăn kơ adrĕch adrung iĕm ling-lang đĭ chăl; lu iĕm pơm 'blŏk hơdơ̆r lăm khei tơpơh.

English: You shall dwell in booths for seven days. All who are native Israelites shall dwell in booths
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai bu lăm adrĕch adrung Isơrael athei oei lăm hnam bơsŭn tơpơh năr.

English: that your generations may know that I made the children of Israel dwell in booths when I brought them out of the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.’ ”
Bahnar: Wă kơ kon drŏ-nglo lu iĕm băt, kơplah Inh anhăk ba lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng Êyiptơ, Inh ăn kơ lu iĕm oei lăm hnam bơsŭn, Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: So Moses declared to the children of Israel the feasts of the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis roi kơ lu kon pơlei Isơrael dôm tơdrong pơm giĕng Kră Yang đei pơkă boih.

English: Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis

English: “Command the children of Israel that they bring to you pure oil of pressed olives for the light, to make the lamps burn continually.
Bahnar: Tơtă bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael athei chĕp ba đak rơmă ôliwơ rơgoh, wă tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng, wă bơwei ŭnh kơđeng khơ̆ng hơnơ̆ng.

English: Outside the veil of the Testimony, in the tabernacle of meeting, Aaron shall be in charge of it from evening until morning before the LORD continually; it shall be a statute forever in your generations.
Bahnar: Arôn gô wei ŭnh kơđeng noh lăm hnam akŭm tơ 'nguaih kơ che pĕng hom tơdrong pơgơ̆p wă kơ ŭnh kơđeng noh oei khơ̆ng ling-lang đơ̆ng kơsơ̆ âu truh pơgê dơning 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; noh jơ̆ khôi juăt pơkă ling-lang đĭ chăl kơ adrĕch adrung lu iĕm.

English: He shall be in charge of the lamps on the pure gold lampstand before the LORD continually.
Bahnar: Arôn gô wei ŭnh kơđeng dan kơpal jơ̆ng kơđeng hăm maih. Wă kơ ŭnh kơđeng khơ̆ng hơnơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: “And you shall take fine flour and bake twelve cakes with it. Two-tenths of an ephah shall be in each cake.
Bahnar: Ih athei iŏk tơpŭng pơtŏ tơ ŭnh pơm mơjĭt-'bar tŏ 'bĕng, minh pôm 'bĕng man iŏk 'bar lăm mơjĭt êpha tơpŭng.a

English: You shall set them in two rows, six in a row, on the pure gold table before the LORD.
Bahnar: Ih săp pơrĕng 'bĕng kơpal gơ'bang maih pơm 'bar trong minh trong tơdrâu tŏ, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: And you shall put pure frankincense on each row, that it may be on the bread for a memorial, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
Bahnar: Iŏk rơmă rơgoh, dan kơpal rim trong wă kơ 'blŏk hơdơ̆r 'bĕng noh, thoi tơmam soi, yua 'buh hăm ŭnh pơyơ̆r 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Every Sabbath he shall set it in order before the LORD continually, being taken from the children of Israel by an everlasting covenant.
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t năr pơdơh Sa'bat Arôn gô săp pơrĕng 'bĕng âu ling-lang 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, tơmam âu đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla Isơrael pơyơ̆r, noh jơ̆ minh tơdrong pơgơ̆p ling-lang.

English: And it shall be for Aaron and his sons, and they shall eat it in a holy place; for it is most holy to him from the offerings of the LORD made by fire, by a perpetual statute.”
Bahnar: Lu 'bĕng âu gô 'măn kơ Arôn păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, lu sư gô sa tơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, yua kơ tơmam 'măn kơ lu sư noh rơgoh, noh đơ̆ng lu tơmam soi yua 'buh hăm ŭnh pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang, noh jing tơdrong juăt pơkă ling-lang.

English: Now the son of an Israelite woman, whose father was an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel; and this Israelite woman’s son and a man of Israel fought each other in the camp.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo mĕ sư bơngai Isơrael 'bă sư bơngai Êyiptơ sư yak chă ngôi lăm bơngai Isơrael, tơhil tôn tơteh băl hăm minh 'nu bơngai Isơrael.

English: And the Israelite woman’s son blasphemed the name of the LORD and cursed; and so they brought him to Moses. (His mother’s name was Shelomith the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan.)
Bahnar: Kon bơngai drŏ-kăn Isơrael noh pơma blông păng hiap kơ anăn Kră Yang đe chông ba sư tơ Môis. Anăn mĕ sư Sôlômit, kon yă Dibri, đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Đan.

English: Then they put him in custody, that the mind of the LORD might be shown to them.
Bahnar: Đe chĭt sư truh tơ Kră Yang tơl pơdah kơ lu sư wă sek thoi yơ.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis thoi âu

English: “Take outside the camp him who has cursed; then let all who heard him lay their hands on his head, and let all the congregation stone him.
Bahnar: Chông ba bĕ bơngai mă hiap pơtê̆ lĕch tơ 'nguaih kơ gơđông, đĭ-đăng đe bu mă kơtơ̆ng sư athei dan ti lu sư 'bơ̆t kơ̆l bơngai noh păng ăn đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla klơ̆m pơlôch sư păng tơmo.

English: “Then you shall speak to the children of Israel, saying: ‘Whoever curses his God shall bear his sin.
Bahnar: Păng khan bĕ kơ kon pơlei pơla Isơrael, bơngai hiap Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư gô pŭ iŏk tơdrong phak đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch sư kơdih.

English: And whoever blasphemes the name of the LORD shall surely be put to death. All the congregation shall certainly stone him, the stranger as well as him who is born in the land. When he blasphemes the name of the LORD, he shall be put to death.
Bahnar: Bu pơma blông kơ anăn Kră Yang; đe gô pơlôch sư, kon pơlei gô klơ̆m sư păng tơmo. Mă khan bơngai đơ̆ng tơmoi nai, dah bơngai kon pơlei sư kơdih, mưh pơma blông kơ Anăn Kră Yang đe gô pơlôch đĭ.

English: ‘Whoever kills any man shall surely be put to death.
Bahnar: Bu mă pơlôch minh 'nu bơngai, đe gô pơlôch sư mơ̆n.

English: Whoever kills an animal shall make it good, animal for animal.
Bahnar: Bu pơlôch minh pôm kon sem brem sư athei 'mong, wă khan tơdrong arih 'mong tơdrong arih.

English: ‘If a man causes disfigurement of his neighbor, as he has done, so shall it be done to him
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai pơm kơ rông 'bôt sư rơka, đe gô pơm kơ sư jĭ rơka lei-lăi thoi sư đei pơm kơ đe boih.

English: fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth; as he has caused disfigurement of a man, so shall it be done to him.
Bahnar: Kơting 'mong kơting, măt 'mong măt, hơnĕnh 'mong hơnĕnh, đe gô pơm kơ sư rơka lei-lăi thoi sư pơm kơ đe rơka.

English: And whoever kills an animal shall restore it; but whoever kills a man shall be put to death.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơlôch kon sem brem sư athei 'mong, na bơngai bu pơlôch bơngai đe gô pơlôch sư.

English: You shall have the same law for the stranger and for one from your own country; for I am the LORD your God.’ ”
Bahnar: Mă bơngai tơmoi lăm pơlei pơla kơdih kư̆m gô yua minh tơdrong juăt đĕch; yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: Then Moses spoke to the children of Israel; and they took outside the camp him who had cursed, and stoned him with stones. So the children of Israel did as the LORD commanded Moses.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Môis khan kơ kon pơlei Isơrael, chông anhăk bơngai hiap pơtê̆ lĕch tơ 'nguaih kơ gơđông, đơ̆ng noh klơ̆m sư păng tơmo. Na kon pơlei Isơrael pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang mă đei tơtă bơih kơ Môis.

English: And the LORD spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Môis tơ kông Sinai.

English: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘When you come into the land which I give you, then the land shall keep a sabbath to the LORD.
Bahnar: Khan bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael, tơdah lu iĕm mơ̆t lăm char mă Inh ăn kơ lu iĕm, teh athei pơdơh Sa'bat ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Six years you shall sow your field, and six years you shall prune your vineyard, and gather its fruit
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrâu sơnăm ih gô rei pơtăm lăm chŭn ih păng kăt hơmet pơgar hơmu ih, đơ̆ng noh phĕ plei sư.

English: but in the seventh year there shall be a sabbath of solemn rest for the land, a sabbath to the LORD. You shall neither sow your field nor prune your vineyard.
Bahnar: Mă-lei sơnăm mă tơpơh jing sơnăm Sa'bat, ăn kơ teh pơdơh wă khan minh sơnăm ăn kơ Kră Yang, ih ưh kơ rei pơtăm lăm chŭn mir ih, dah kăt hơmet pơgar hơmu ih.

English: What grows of its own accord of your harvest you shall not reap, nor gather the grapes of your untended vine, for it is a year of rest for the land.
Bahnar: Ih ưh kơ kĕch yuă ôh lu 'ba rah kơdih lăm mir chŭn ih; ih kư̆m ưh kơ gơh phĕ plei hơmu mă plei kơdih đơ̆ng so ih ưh kơ đei kăt bơwei hơmet ming; yua kơ noh jơ̆ minh sơnăm kơ teh pơdơh.

English: And the sabbath produce of the land shall be food for you: for you, your male and female servants, your hired man, and the stranger who dwells with you
Bahnar: Dôm tơmam sa mă chăt tơ teh lăm sơnăm Sa'bat gô ăn pơm tơmam sa kơ iĕm, ăn kơ đĭch đam drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn, ăn kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai jang kơ ih păng đĭ-đăng bơngai tơmoi mă oei hăm ih

English: for your livestock and the beasts that are in your land—all its produce shall be for food.
Bahnar: păng kư̆m ăn kơ sem dơrong ih păng sem bri brah oei lăm tơring char ih. Đĭ-đăng plei sa wă pơm tơmam sa ih.

English: ‘And you shall count seven sabbaths of years for yourself, seven times seven years; and the time of the seven sabbaths of years shall be to you forty-nine years.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m athei jô̆ tơpơh jơhnơr wă khan tơpơh wơ̆t tơpơh sơnăm, noh jing puăn-jĭt tơsĭn sơnăm.

English: Then you shall cause the trumpet of the Jubilee to sound on the tenth day of the seventh month; on the Day of Atonement you shall make the trumpet to sound throughout all your land.
Bahnar: Truh tơnăr mơjĭt khei tơpơh noh wă khan năr huai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch lu iĕm athei hlôm keng tơgiĕp mă re kơtơ̆ng jơ̆p lăm tơring char lu iĕm.

English: And you shall consecrate the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout all the land to all its inhabitants. It shall be a Jubilee for you; and each of you shall return to his possession, and each of you shall return to his family.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei iŏk sơnăm mă pơđăm-jĭt, pơm sơnăm 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng ră roi tơdrong rơngei kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla oei lăm char noh jĭ sơnăm hiôk-hian kơ lu iĕm, bu bu kư̆m wơ̆t iŏk teh jang sa sư kơdih đĭ-đăng gô rơngei wih brŏk tơ hnam dơnŏ sư kơdih.

English: That fiftieth year shall be a Jubilee to you; in it you shall neither sow nor reap what grows of its own accord, nor gather the grapes of your untended vine.
Bahnar: Sơnăm mă pơđăm-jĭt âu jơ̆ sơnăm hiôk-hian kơ lu iĕm; lu iĕm ưh pă rei pơtăm, kĕch yuă tơmam rah chăt kơdih sư păng kư̆m ưh pă phĕ lu plei hơmu mă đêl ưh pă kăt hơmet.

English: For it is the Jubilee; it shall be holy to you; you shall eat its produce from the field.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sơnăm hiôk-hian; gô jing 'lơ̆ng rơgoh ăn kơ lu iĕm; lu iĕm gô sa tơmam kiơ chăt kơdih đơ̆ng chŭn mir lu iĕm.

English: ‘In this Year of Jubilee, each of you shall return to his possession.
Bahnar: Lăm sơnăm hiôk-hian âu, đĭ-đăng rim 'nu gô wih tơ mŭk tơmam chŭn mir sư kơdih.

English: And if you sell anything to your neighbor or buy from your neighbor’s hand, you shall not oppress one another.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm tĕch dah răt kiơ đơ̆ng rông 'bôt iĕm, iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơgâm sa dih băl.

English: According to the number of years after the Jubilee you shall buy from your neighbor, and according to the number of years of crops he shall sell to you.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆ jô̆ dôm sơnăm đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sơnăm hiôk-hian na răt đơ̆ng rông 'bôt ih, sư gô tĕch kơ ih kiơ̆ kơ dôm sơnăm sư oei đei kĕch yuă.

English: According to the multitude of years you shall increase its price, and according to the fewer number of years you shall diminish its price; for he sells to you according to the number of the years of the crops.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ dôm yơ sơnăm, tơdah sơnăm oei lơ ih gô hơtŏk 'long sư păng tơdah oei pă tŏ sĕt sơnăm ih gô tơjur 'long sư, yua kơ kiơ̆ kơ bơyan kĕch yuă sư gô tĕch tơ ih.

English: Therefore you shall not oppress one another, but you shall fear your God; for I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Lăm lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ pơgâm sa rông 'bôt iĕm kơdih. Sơmă athei băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: ‘So you shall observe My statutes and keep My judgments, and perform them; and you will dwell in the land in safety.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu iĕm athei pơm kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r inh athei, bơwei tơdrong juăt păng rok kiơ̆, thoi noh na lu iĕm gô arih hiôk hơđơ̆ng lăm tơring char iĕm.

English: Then the land will yield its fruit, and you will eat your fill, and dwell there in safety.
Bahnar: Teh gô chăt lơ plei 'long sa, lu iĕm gô sa phĭ jơnap păng arih hiôk hơđơ̆ng lăm char iĕm.

English: ‘And if you say, “What shall we eat in the seventh year, since we shall not sow nor gather in our produce?”
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm khan: Mưh nhôn ưh kơ đei rei pơtăm ưh kơ kĕch yuă, lei lăm sơnăm mă tơpơh lu nhôn gô sa kiơ.

English: Then I will command My blessing on you in the sixth year, and it will bring forth produce enough for three years.
Bahnar: Sơnăm mă tơdrâu Inh gô tuh ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu iĕm, na sơnăm noh iĕm gô đei phe 'ba plei 'long sa lơ, 'mong kơ pêng sơnăm.

English: And you shall sow in the eighth year, and eat old produce until the ninth year; until its produce comes in, you shall eat of the old harvest.
Bahnar: Mưh rei pơtăm lăm sơnăm mă tơhngam, lu iĕm gô sa plei bơyan so păng gô sa dĭng truh tơ bơyan kĕch yuă sơnăm mă tơsĭn.

English: ‘The land shall not be sold permanently, for the land is Mine; for you are strangers and sojourners with Me.
Bahnar: Teh ưh kơ gơh tĕch hloi ôh, yua kơ noh teh Inh, iĕm thoi bơngai tơmoi mă oei hơdai Inh đĕch.

English: And in all the land of your possession you shall grant redemption of the land.
Bahnar: Tơdrong gơh pơdrâu iŏk teh đêl tĕch, athei pơyom jơ̆p kơ lăm teh đak iĕm oei.

English: ‘If one of your brethren becomes poor, and has sold some of his possession, and if his redeeming relative comes to redeem it, then he may redeem what his brother sold.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'nhŏng oh lu iĕm hoh kơ'bah, wă tĕch hai 'biơ̆ teh jang sa sư, na bơngai mă 'nhŏng oh tơ jê̆ bơngai noh athei răt huai iŏk teh noh.

English: Or if the man has no one to redeem it, but he himself becomes able to redeem it
Bahnar: Mă-lei, tơdah ưh kơ đei bu tơgŭm huai iŏk, na đơ̆ng rŏng bơngai noh sư jang sa jing mơdrŏng dơ̆ng đei tôm tơmam wă huai pơdrâu iŏk teh sư kơdih

English: then let him count the years since its sale, and restore the remainder to the man to whom he sold it, that he may return to his possession.
Bahnar: bơngai noh athei jô̆ đơ̆ng sơnăm sư tĕch, păng pơdrâu ăn kơ bơngai mă răt teh sư tơdrong gĭt jên kiơ̆ kơ dôm sơnăm mă oei oei noh, na pơdrâu teh noh jing teh sư kơdih.

English: But if he is not able to have it restored to himself, then what was sold shall remain in the hand of him who bought it until the Year of Jubilee; and in the Jubilee it shall be released, and he shall return to his possession.
Bahnar: mă-lei tơdah bơngai noh ưh kơ kĕ đei jên wă pơdrâu kơ bơngai mă răt, bơngai răt noh gô bơwei teh dĭng truh tơ sơnăm hiôk-hian, noh sơnăm mă tơmam, teh gô pơdrâu kơ tơ'ngla sư, na bơngai noh gô iŏk tơwih teh sư kơdih.

English: ‘If a man sells a house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it is sold; within a full year he may redeem it.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai bu tĕch hnam lăm minh pôm pơlei đei dur war tăp dăr, bơngai tĕch noh gơh pơdrâu huai iŏk dang kiơ̆ lăm minh sơnăm, jô̆ iŏk đơ̆ng năr sư tĕch. Lăm sơnăm noh, bơngai tĕch gơh pơdrâu huai iŏk hnam sư kơdih.

English: But if it is not redeemed within the space of a full year, then the house in the walled city shall belong permanently to him who bought it, throughout his generations. It shall not be released in the Jubilee.
Bahnar: Tơdah hlôi kơ minh sơnăm bơih na bơngai tĕch ưh kơ huai pơdrâu iŏk, lei hnam mă lăm tŏk-bŏk pơlei đei dur war tăp dăr noh gô oei hơnơ̆ng gah ti bơngai răt.

English: However the houses of villages which have no wall around them shall be counted as the fields of the country. They may be redeemed, and they shall be released in the Jubilee.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu hnam tơ pơlei iĕ 'nguaih ưh kơ đei dur war jô̆ hloi hăm chŭn mir; tơ'ngla sư gơh pơdrâu iŏk, truh tơ sơnăm hiôk-hian, đe gô pơdrâu tơwih kơ tơ'ngla sư.

English: Nevertheless the cities of the Levites, and the houses in the cities of their possession, the Levites may redeem at any time.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah pơlei lu bơngai Lêwi, hnam lu sư lăm pơlei noh, lu bơngai Lêwi ling-lang sư gơh huai iŏk mơ̆ng kơ lu sư wă.

English: And if a man purchases a house from the Levites, then the house that was sold in the city of his possession shall be released in the Jubilee; for the houses in the cities of the Levites are their possession among the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Bu răt đơ̆ng bơngai Lêwi minh pôm hnam lăm pơlei bơngai Lêwi, truh tơ sơnăm hiôk-hian hnam noh gô pơdrâu tơwih kơ tơ'ngla sư, yua kơ lu hnam lăm pơlei bơngai Lêwi jing mŭk tơmam teh choh lu sư lăm lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: But the field of the common-land of their cities may not be sold, for it is their perpetual possession.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu tơmăn 'nhĕt rong sem dơrong tăp dăr pơlei tih lu sư, bơngai Lêwi ưh kơ gơh kơ tĕch ôh, yua kơ noh jing teh lu sư jang sa ling-lang.

English: ‘If one of your brethren becomes poor, and falls into poverty among you, then you shall help him, like a stranger or a sojourner, that he may live with you.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'nhŏng oh oei hơdai ih jing dơnuh hin mŭk tơmam 'me sa kơdih akâu ưh kơmah, ih athei tơgŭm 'me rong sư, mă khan sư bơngai tơmoi oei tơ âu, wă kơ sư gơh oei hơdai ih.

English: Take no usury or interest from him; but fear your God, that your brother may live with you.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ sa lơi kư̆m 'nĕ kơ iŏk yua đơ̆ng sưa sơmă athei hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, na 'nhŏng oh ih gô oei hơdai ih.

English: You shall not lend him your money for usury, nor lend him your food at a profit.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ ăn kơ sư mưng jên ih na iŏk jên kon păng 'nĕ ăn kơ sư mưng phe 'ba na 'mong đei kon.

English: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan and to be your God.
Bahnar: Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm Tơ'ngla mă chông anhăk iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ wă năm ba iĕm tơ dêh Kanaan păng pơm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: ‘And if one of your brethren who dwells by you becomes poor, and sells himself to you, you shall not compel him to serve as a slave.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'nhŏng oh jing dơnuh hin păng tĕch akâu sư kơ ih, ih 'nĕ kơ pơgŏ sư jang thoi đĭch hŏ.

English: As a hired servant and a sojourner he shall be with you, and shall serve you until the Year of Jubilee.
Bahnar: Sư gô oei hơdai ih thoi minh 'nu bơngai jang kơ ih păng thoi bơngai tơmoi sa tơ ih, sư gô tơgŭm tơdrong jang ih truh tơ sơnăm hiôk-hian.

English: And then he shall depart from you—he and his children with him—and shall return to his own family. He shall return to the possession of his fathers.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh sư gô tơklah đơ̆ng hnam ih, sư păng hơ'lơ̆p sư wih tơ hnam sư. Gô iŏk chŭn mir yă 'bok sư kơdih.

English: For they are My servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt; they shall not be sold as slaves.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu sư jing đam Inh, mă Inh hlôi chông anhăk lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ; đe ưh kơ gơh tĕch lu sư thoi đe tĕch đĭch ôh.

English: You shall not rule over him with rigor, but you shall fear your God.
Bahnar: Pơgơ̆r sư 'nĕ kơ pơjuă pơđep dêh, sơmă athei hli yom kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih.

English: And as for your male and female slaves whom you may have—from the nations that are around you, from them you may buy male and female slaves.
Bahnar: Na lu đĭch drŏ-nglo đĭch drŏ-kăn mă ih đei, lu iĕm gơh răt đơ̆ng adrĕch bơngai tăp dăr kơ iĕm.

English: Moreover you may buy the children of the strangers who dwell among you, and their families who are with you, which they beget in your land; and they shall become your property.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kư̆m gơh răt đĭch đam đơ̆ng lu kon drŏ-nglo bơngai tơmoi oei lăm char iĕm. Adrĕch adrung lu sư oei hơdai hăm lu iĕm, đe tơpŭ boih kơ lu sư lăm char iĕm, thoi noh lu sư jing tơmam lu iĕm.

English: And you may take them as an inheritance for your children after you, to inherit them as a possession; they shall be your permanent slaves. But regarding your brethren, the children of Israel, you shall not rule over one another with rigor.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm wei sư pơm tơmam thoi kon drŏ-nglo iĕm. Wei sư thoi bơngai đĭch đam ling-lang, mă-lei tơduă 'nhŏng oh iĕm bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ gơh pơjuă pơđep băl.

English: ‘Now if a sojourner or stranger close to you becomes rich, and one of your brethren who dwells by him becomes poor, and sells himself to the stranger or sojourner close to you, or to a member of the stranger’s family
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai đơ̆ng teh đak 'nguaih, dah bơngai tơmoi oei lăm teh đak ih jing mơdrŏng na 'nhŏng oh ih oei hơdai sư jing dơnuh, na năm tĕch akâu sư kơdih kơ bơngai tơmoi đơ̆ng teh đak nai oei hăm ih, dah tĕch ăn kơ minh 'nu bơngai bu lăm hnam bơngai tơmoi noh.

English: after he is sold he may be redeemed again. One of his brothers may redeem him
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ hlôi tĕch akâu sư kơdih bơih. Iĕm kư̆m gơh huai pơdrâu iŏk; dah minh 'nu lăm 'nhŏng oh lu sư kư̆m gơh huai pơdrâu iŏk sư.

English: or his uncle or his uncle’s son may redeem him; or anyone who is near of kin to him in his family may redeem him; or if he is able he may redeem himself.
Bahnar: Mih ma sư, dah kon mih ma sư kơlĕ, dah minh 'nu adrĕch sư kư̆m gơh huai pơdrâu iŏk sư, tơdah sư kơdih kĕ đei mơdrŏng, sư kư̆m gơh huai pơdrâu sư kơdih.

English: Thus he shall reckon with him who bought him: The price of his release shall be according to the number of years, from the year that he was sold to him until the Year of Jubilee; it shall be according to the time of a hired servant for him.
Bahnar: Sư gô tinh jô̆ hăm tơ'ngla răt sư đơ̆ng sơnăm ayơ mă sư tĕch akâu sư kơdih, dĭng truh tơ sơnăm hiôk-hian; păng 'long sư wă huai tinh jô̆ kiơ̆ kơ sơnăm lơ dah tŏ sĕt wă khan tinh jô̆ thoi đe juăt kơ jang apah.

English: If there are still many years remaining, according to them he shall repay the price of his redemption from the money with which he was bought.
Bahnar: Tơdah oei lơ sơnăm bơngai noh athei ăn jên wă jê̆ dôm đe răt sư. Tơmam wă huai sư.

English: And if there remain but a few years until the Year of Jubilee, then he shall reckon with him, and according to his years he shall repay him the price of his redemption.
Bahnar: Tơdah truh sơnăm hiôk-hian oei pă tŏ sĕt athei tinh jô̆ hăm tơ'ngla răt sư, kiơ̆ kơ sơnăm noh na 'mong jên, wă huai iŏk sư.

English: He shall be with him as a yearly hired servant, and he shall not rule with rigor over him in your sight.
Bahnar: Sư hăm tơ'ngla sư, lăng thoi minh 'nu bơngai jang apah kiơ̆ kơ sơnăm, tơ'ngla sư ưh kơ gơh pơjuă pơđep sư ôh 'bơ̆t anăp ih.

English: And if he is not redeemed in these years, then he shall be released in the Year of Jubilee—he and his children with him.
Bahnar: Tơdah sư ưh kơ kĕ huai sư kơdih thoi noh, na gô truh sơnăm hiôk-hian, sư păng lu kon sư kư̆m gô rơngei.

English: For the children of Israel are servants to Me; they are My servants whom I brought out of the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu kon pơlei Isơrael đam Inh. Wă khan lu đam Inh mă đei chông anhăk lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ, Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: ‘You shall not make idols for yourselves; neither a carved image nor a sacred pillar shall you rear up for yourselves; nor shall you set up an engraved stone in your land, to bow down to it; for I am the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm 'nĕ kơ man rup yang, dah traih pơm păng 'long dah pơm hăm tơmo, 'nĕ kơ pơdơ̆ng minh pôm tơmo ayơ lăm tơring iĕm đei rup na drap kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp rup noh, yua kơ Inh boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.

English: You shall keep My Sabbaths and reverence My sanctuary: I am the LORD.
Bahnar: Wei răk bĕ năr pơdơh Sa'bat Inh păng pơyom kơ anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh, Inh boih Kră Yang.

English: ‘If you walk in My statutes and keep My commandments, and perform them
Bahnar: Tơdah iĕm yak rok kiơ̆ khôi juăt Inh, wei răk păng pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh tơtă

English: then I will give you rain in its season, the land shall yield its produce, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit.
Bahnar: thoi noh Inh gô tơjur ăn đak 'mi trŏ kơ bơyan sư lăm teh gô đei lơ 'long plei sa tơ mir gô đei 'nhot sa.

English: Your threshing shall last till the time of vintage, and the vintage shall last till the time of sowing; you shall eat your bread to the full, and dwell in your land safely.
Bahnar: Bơyan kĕch 'ba oei đei truh tơ bơyan phĕ plei hơmu, oei đei truh tơ bơyan rei, lu iĕm gô sŏng sa phĭ mah, arih hiôk hơđơ̆ng lăm char iĕm.

English: I will give peace in the land, and you shall lie down, and none will make you afraid; I will rid the land of evil beasts, and the sword will not go through your land.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn tơdrong rơnŭk rơnua lăm char iĕm, lu iĕm gô tep pơdơh pă đei hli kơ bu, Inh gô puh đĭ lu sem bri nuih kơtang đơ̆ng char iĕm, đao hơlă pă đei truh bơih tơ char iĕm.

English: You will chase your enemies, and they shall fall by the sword before you.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô druh lu bơngai ayăt kơ lu iĕm, na lu sư gô pơ̆k lôch kơ đao hơlă 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm.

English: Five of you shall chase a hundred, and a hundred of you shall put ten thousand to flight; your enemies shall fall by the sword before you.
Bahnar: Pơđăm 'nu lăm lu iĕm gô druh minh-hrĕng 'nu, minh-hrĕng lăm lu iĕm gô druh mơjĭt-rơbâu 'nu, đơ̆ng noh lu ayăt kơ iĕm gô pơ̆k lôch kơ đao hơlă 'bơ̆t anăp iĕm.

English: ‘For I will look on you favorably and make you fruitful, multiply you and confirm My covenant with you.
Bahnar: Inh gô 'mêm bơwei lu iĕm ăn kơ iĕm chek lar rai lơ păng pơjing tơdrong pơgơ̆p hăm lu iĕm kơjăp.

English: You shall eat the old harvest, and clear out the old because of the new.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm oei sa tơmam lu iĕm 'măn lê̆ sơ̆. Đơ̆ng noh tuh hŭt lê̆ tơmam so noh wă 'măn mong tơmam 'nao.

English: I will set My tabernacle among you, and My soul shall not abhor you.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm anih oei Inha tŏk-bŏk lu iĕm, Inh ưh kơ đei weh đơ̆ng lu iĕm ôh.

English: I will walk among you and be your God, and you shall be My people.
Bahnar: Inh gô oei tŏk-bŏk lu iĕm Inh gô jing Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm păng lu iĕm gô jing kon pơlei pơla Inh.

English: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, that you should not be their slaves; I have broken the bands of your yoke and made you walk upright.
